[MASK] filed a concurring opinion , in which KENNEDY , SOUTER , and GINSBURG joined .	BREYER
[MASK] filed an opinion concurring in part , in which SOUTER , GINSBURG , and BREYER joined as to Parts I and II .	KENNEDY

[MASK] Buffett is giving away 85 % of his wealth , mostly to the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation .	Warren
[MASK] 's a move that really worries me ; Buffett 's usual justification for keeping most of his money was that he was still compounding the value of his fortune at a pretty high rate , so any gifts now would mean significantly less money for the foundation later .	It
[MASK] 's a little hard to parse , but at this point his ostensible view is that the Gateses are very good money - redistributors , and he wants them to have the money as soon as possible .	It
[MASK] essentially sounds like he 's worried that Bill or Melinda are going to die soon .	Which
[MASK] assume his actual reason is that he 's worried that Berkshire Hathaway just ca n't grow quickly enough to justify his usual charity policy .	I
[MASK] 'm not sure how the market will react .	I
[MASK] does n't change the company 's intrinsic worth , and as the article notes , the company might be added to a major index once the shares get more liquid .	It
On the other hand , [MASK] is essentially a statement that the company is overpriced from the guy who knows it best -- and happens to be the best investor of the last century .	this
em ... no ... the Gates [MASK] mainly invests in medical research and education , that means donating now adds a tremendous value compared to donating in ten years .	foundation

The [MASK] topped out in February of 1966 at 995 .	Dow
By September of that year the [MASK] had tumbled to 744 .	Dow
The [MASK] then rallied to a high of 943 in September of '67 .	Dow
By March of '68 the [MASK] had fallen to 825 , only to climb to a highly speculative peak of 985 in December of '68 .	Dow
The [MASK] then sank to 631 in December of '70 .	Dow
By April of '71 the [MASK] had climbed back to 950 , only to fall to 869 in February of '72 .	Dow
A big [MASK] then took the Dow ( unconfirmed ) to a record high of 1051 in January of '73 , turning everyone bullish .	rally
But by December of '73 the [MASK] had collapsed to 788 .	Dow
At that time , the [MASK] and geniuses of Wall Street were predicting a 250 Dow and many were talking openly about the end of capitalism .	gurus
Of course , [MASK] was the bottom	that
And [MASK] 's the way the greatest bear market since the Depression worked its way down .	that
By late 1974 [MASK] were dizzy , they were desperate , they were wrung - out , they had left Wall Street , many for good .	investors

Inhibitory [MASK] Control the Pattern of Activity in the Cortex	Systems
" Inhibitory [MASK] are essential for controlling the pattern of activity in the cortex , which has important implications for the mechanisms of cortical operation , according to a Yale School of Medicine study in Neuron ....	systems
The [MASK] demonstrate the inhibitory network is central to controlling not only the amplitude , extent and duration of activation of recurrent excitatory cortical networks , but also the precise timing of action potentials , and , thus , network synchronization ... "	findings
* [MASK] Projects Catastrophe Will Be Most Costly Weather - Related Disaster in History *	Worldwatch
The overwhelming human and financial [MASK] of Hurricane Katrina are powerful evidence that political and economic decisions made in the United States and other countries have failed to account for our dependence on a healthy resource base , according to an assessment released today by the Worldwatch Institute .	impacts
[MASK] of the Mississippi River and the destruction of wetlands at its mouth have left the area around New Orleans abnormally vulnerable to the forces of nature .	Alteration
According to many scientists , the early [MASK] of global warming  90 degree Fahrenheit water temperatures in the Gulf and rising sea levels  may have exacerbated the destructive power of Katrina .	results

[MASK] Peters is visiting a school .	Winston
In one class , [MASK] asks the students if anyone can give him an example of a " tragedy " .	he
One little [MASK] stands up and offers that , " if my best friend who lives next door was playing in the street when a car came along and killed him , that would be a tragedy " .	boy
" No , " Winston says , " [MASK] would be an ACCIDENT . "	That
A [MASK] raises her hand .	girl
" If a school bus carrying fifty children drove off a cliff , killing everyone involved ... [MASK] would be a tragedy " .	that
" [MASK] 'm afraid not , " explains Winston , " that is what we would call a GREAT LOSS . "	I
The [MASK] is silent , none of the other children volunteer .	room
Finally , a [MASK] in the back raises his hand .	boy
In a timid voice , [MASK] says : " If an airplane carrying Winston Peters was blown up by a bomb , THAT would be a tragedy " .	he
" Wonderful ! " [MASK] beams .	Winston
And can [MASK] tell me WHY that would be a tragedy ? "	you
" Well , " says the boy , " because [MASK] would n't be an accident , and it certainly would n't be a great loss ! "	it

U.S. astronauts will launch to the moon on sleek , single , shuttle booster rockets and the first new upper - stage rocket this country has developed in more than a decade , [MASK] and the Pentagon have told the White House .	NASA
[MASK] looks as if NASA is transitioning away from the shuttle model , as in the past they have proven to be quite dangerous as Columbia has recently proved .	It
Although these new rockets are probably more expensive , [MASK] will be able to go at a much greater range than it's shuttle cousins , as they can not only break free from the atmosphere but reach the moon as well .	they
" NASA then plans to develop a new 100 - metric - ton - class launch vehicle derived from existing capabilities with the space shuttle external tanks and solid rocket boosters for future missions to the moon , " the [MASK] said .	letter
[MASK] is planning on using these new shuttles to replace the current models , with industry forecasters predicting a launch as early as 2014 .	NASA
The new rocket [MASK] will differ slightly from it's predecessors , in the fact that the crew and cargo would launch separately from two different rockets each and join up in space later on .	design

[MASK] on adult - learned second language ( L2 ) has provided considerable insight into the neurocognitive mechanisms underlying the learning and processing of L2 grammar [ 1 ]  [ 11 ] .	Research
Of interest here , [MASK] suggest that , despite the difficulties in acquiring L2 grammar , adult learners can approximate native - like levels of use and neurocognitive processing [ 12 ]  [ 15 ] .	studies
In fact , substantial [MASK] ( months to years ) of limited or no exposure following L2 training are not uncommon , and may even be the norm [ 16 ] .	periods
In the present study , [MASK] examine the outcomes of such a period of no exposure on the neurocognition of L2 grammar : that is , whether a substantial period of no exposure leads to decreased proficiency and / or less native - like neural processes (  use it or lose it  [ 20 ] ) , no such changes , or perhaps whether even higher proficiency and / or more native - like processing may be observed .	we
Additionally , [MASK] test whether any such outcomes might vary as a function of the type of L2 training , in particular between classroom - like and immersion - like contexts .	we
[MASK] are aware of six studies designed to investigate the effects of a substantial period of limited exposure following adult L2 training [ 17 ] , [ 18 ] , [ 21 ]  [ 24 ] , all of which were restricted to the examination of behavioral ( performance ) outcomes .	We
The six [MASK] tested L2 learners after periods of 1 month to 50 years of limited L2 exposure , mainly on general language skills [ 17 ] , [ 18 ] , [ 21 ] , [ 23 ] , [ 24 ] , though also on more specific paradigms meant to target aspects of grammatical abilities [ 17 ] , [ 18 ] or lexical abilities [ 22 ] , [ 23 ] .	studies
Across the studies , the [MASK] of limited exposure followed either classroom training [ 17 ] , [ 18 ] , [ 22 ] , [ 24 ] or mixed classroom and immersion training [ 21 ] , [ 23 ] , [ 24 ] .	periods
The [MASK] lasted varying lengths of time , apparently usually in the range of a few years , and resulted in seemingly varying proficiency levels ( though not directly measured , except by [ 24 ] ) prior to the period of limited exposure .	training
A [MASK] of limited exposure generally leads to attrition ( loss ) of L2 performance or knowledge [ 17 ] , [ 18 ] , [ 21 ] , [ 23 ] .	period
Although attrition may take place within the first few years , some [MASK] suggest that it then appears to level off , with no further losses occurring [ 17 ] , [ 18 ] .	studies
Moreover , one [MASK] found no changes at all in performance , across proficiency levels , after either 2 or 4 years of limited exposure [ 22 ] .	study
On the administrative level , the [MASK] of the libraries participating in the consortium of Dutch academic libraries ( UKB ) also expressed the wish that librarians become more fluent in DH .	directors
A year later , the National [MASK] of the Netherlands ( Koninklijke Bibliotheek ) , and the University Library of the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam again concluded that librarians at their institutes who wanted to get involved in DH needed more training to adequately support researchers and students in this field .	Library
Therefore both [MASK] joined forces to develop a set of clinics on DH for librarians .	institutes
[MASK] see this as the ideal opportunity to provide these educative sessions not only to our own librarians , but also to the academic librarians of other Dutch research libraries .	We
In essence , [MASK] want to teach our country s librarians the ins and outs of DH in order for them to take up their natural role of facilitating and supporting research and ideally become the research partner needed in DH projects .	we
The [MASK] of these sessions should enable them to provide services to researchers and students , identify remaining gaps in knowledge or skills that they could address by self - directed learning and ( perhaps ) to automate their daily library work .	content
[MASK] are not setting out to turn them into programmers or data crunchers , but want to boost their knowledge level to where they feel comfortable providing information about DH projects , follow the literature and research , follow online tutorials and hopefully take up the challenge of finishing this professional development by engaging with the DH community .	We
In order to design this curriculum [MASK] follow a four step approach with a Working Out Loud - principle ( Williams , 2010 ) :	we
With these in hand , [MASK] will design the curriculum of clinics , based on the method of ' constructive alignment ' ( Biggs et al. , 2011 ) , to make sure that the intended learning objectives and the teaching / learning activities stay aligned .	we
Each [MASK] starts with one or more lectures by researchers , that address the conceptual knowledge needed .	day
By having researchers provide the lecture sessions , [MASK] hope to fuel the enthusiasm of the librarians with the inspiration of direct contact with researchers and to provide access to a network within and across universities .	we
With these clinics , [MASK] hope to initiate a stream of DH activities in Dutch universities , making access to support easier for new digital scholars .	we
The [MASK] at DH2017 will present the curriculum , its position in the international context and offer the lessons learned from both the design process and the first clinics .	poster
[MASK] welcome discussion about our efforts and the possibilities of applying this in other contexts .	We
[MASK] received his early formal education at Aberdeen Grammar School , and in August 1799 entered the school of Dr. William Glennie , in Dulwich . [ 17 ]	Byron
His [MASK] interfered with his studies , often withdrawing him from school , with the result that he lacked discipline and his classical studies were neglected .	mother
An undistinguished student and an unskilled cricketer , [MASK] did represent the school during the very first Eton v Harrow cricket match at Lord 's in 1805 . [ 19 ]	he
[MASK] fell in love with Mary Chaworth , whom he met while at school , [ 6 ] and she was the reason he refused to return to Harrow in September 1803 .	Byron
His [MASK] wrote , " He has no indisposition that I know of but love , desperate love , the worst of all maladies in my opinion . In short , the boy is distractedly in love with Miss Chaworth . " [ 6 ]	mother
[MASK] finally returned in January 1804 , [ 6 ] to a more settled period which saw the formation of a circle of emotional involvements with other Harrow boys , which he recalled with great vividness : " My school friendships were with me passions ( for I was always violent ) . " [ 21 ]	Byron
The most [MASK] of those was with John FitzGibbon , 2nd Earl of Clare  four years Byron 's junior  whom he was to meet unexpectedly many years later in Italy ( 1821 ) . [ 22 ]	enduring
His nostalgic [MASK] about his Harrow friendships , Childish Recollections ( 1806 ) , express a prescient " consciousness of sexual differences that may in the end make England untenable to him . " [ 23 ]	poems
[MASK] to Byron in the John Murray archive contain evidence of a previously unremarked if short - lived romantic relationship with a younger boy at Harrow , John Thomas Claridge .	Letters
Sure some stronger [MASK] vibrates here , Which whispers friendship will be doubly dear To one , who thus for kindred hearts must roam , And seek abroad , the love denied at home .	impulse
The following autumn , [MASK] went up to Trinity College , Cambridge , [ 24 ] where he met and formed a close friendship with the younger John Edleston .	he
About his " protg " [MASK] wrote , " He has been my almost constant associate since October , 1805 , when I entered Trinity College . His voice first attracted my attention , his countenance fixed it , and his manners attached me to him for ever . "	he
In his memory [MASK] composed Thyrza , a series of elegies . [ 25 ]	Byron
In later years , [MASK] described the affair as " a violent , though pure love and passion " .	he
This [MASK] , however , needs to be read in the context of hardening public attitudes toward homosexuality in England and the severe sanctions ( including public hanging ) against convicted or even suspected offenders . [ 26 ]	statement
The [MASK] , on the other hand , may well have been " pure " out of respect for Edleston 's innocence , in contrast to the ( probably ) more sexually overt relations experienced at Harrow School . [ 27 ]	liaison
[MASK] spent three years at Trinity College , engaging in sexual escapades , boxing , horse riding and gambling . [ 28 ]	Byron
Also while at Cambridge [MASK] formed lifelong friendships with men such as John Cam Hobhouse , who initiated him into the Cambridge Whig Club , which endorsed liberal politics , [ 28 ] and Francis Hodgson , a Fellow at King 's College , with whom he corresponded on literary and other matters until the end of his life .	he
[MASK] Abraham Norton ( c. 1818  January 8 , 1880 ) , known as Emperor Norton , was a citizen of San Francisco , California , who in 1859 proclaimed himself " Norton I , Emperor of the United States " .	Joshua
[MASK] later expanded his pretense by claiming to be " Protector of Mexico " as well .	He
Born in England , [MASK] spent most of his early life in South Africa .	Norton
After the death of his mother in 1846 and his father in 1848 , [MASK] sailed west , arriving in San Francisco possibly in November 1849 .	he
[MASK] initially made a living as a businessman , but he lost his fortune investing in Peruvian rice .	Norton
After he lost a lawsuit in which he tried to void his rice contract , Norton 's public [MASK] faded .	prominence
[MASK] reemerged in September 1859 , laying claim to the position of Emperor of the United States .	He
[MASK] had no political power , and his influence extended only so far as he was humored by those around him ;	He
Though some considered him insane or eccentric , [MASK] of San Francisco celebrated his regal presence and his proclamations , such as his order that the United States Congress be dissolved by force and his numerous decrees calling for a bridge connecting San Francisco to Oakland , and a corresponding tunnel to be built under San Francisco Bay .	citizens
On January 8 , 1880 , [MASK] collapsed at the corner of California and Dupont ( now Grant ) streets and died before he could be given medical treatment .	Norton
Nearly 30,000 [MASK] packed the streets of San Francisco to pay him homage at his funeral .	people
By 1859 , [MASK] had become completely disgruntled with what he considered the inadequacies of the legal and political structures of the United States .	Norton
On September 17 , 1859 , [MASK] took matters into his own hands and distributed letters to the various newspapers in the city , proclaiming himself " Emperor of these United States " :	he
At the peremptory request and desire of a large majority of the citizens of these United States , [MASK] , Joshua Norton , formerly of Algoa Bay , Cape of Good Hope , and now for the last 9 years and 10 months past of S. F. , Cal. , declare and proclaim myself Emperor of these U. S. ;	I
[MASK] would later add " Protector of Mexico " to this title .	Norton
In his self - appointed role of emperor , [MASK] issued numerous decrees on matters of the state .	Norton
After assuming absolute control over the country , [MASK] saw no further need for a legislature , and on October 12 , 1859 , he issued a decree formally abolishing the United States Congress .	he
In it , [MASK] observed :	Norton
... [MASK] and corruption prevent a fair and proper expression of the public voice ;	fraud
that open [MASK] of the laws are constantly occurring , caused by mobs , parties , factions and undue influence of political sects ;	violation
that the [MASK] has not that protection of person and property which he is entitled .	citizen
[MASK] ordered all interested parties to assemble at Platt 's Music Hall in San Francisco in February 1860 to " remedy the evil complained of " .	Norton
In an imperial decree the following month , [MASK] summoned the Army to depose the elected officials of the U.S. Congress :	Norton
WHEREAS , a [MASK] of men calling themselves the National Congress are now in session in Washington City , in violation of our Imperial edict of the 12th of October last , declaring the said Congress abolished ;	body
NOW , THEREFORE , [MASK] do hereby Order and Direct Major - General Scott , the Command - in - Chief of our Armies , immediately upon receipt of this , our Decree , to proceed with a suitable force and clear the Halls of Congress .	we

[MASK] was thirteen .	I
[MASK] was spring , the barren time in March when you can not be sure if it is really warmer , but you are so desperate for change that you tell yourself the mud at the edge of the sidewalk is different from winter mud and you are sure that the smell of wet soil has suddenly a bit of the scent of summer rains , of grass and drowned earthworms .	It
And [MASK] has , because it is spring and inside the ground something is stirring .	it
[MASK] was wearing a yellow linen dress which my mother had picked out and which I therefore disliked although I knew it flattered me .	I
My [MASK] were white and I was concentrating on keeping them out of the mud .	shoes
My [MASK] and I were going to mass  my mother did not go ; she was Protestant .	father
My [MASK] put his hand on top of my hair , his palm on my head , and I could feel the bone of my skull and my skin and his hot palm , so dry and strong .	father
When I was a little girl , [MASK] did that often , and called me Muscles .	he
[MASK] had not called me Muscles or put his hand on my head for a long time .	He
[MASK] could not help arching my back a little , I wanted to push against his hand like a cat but the instinct that comes with being thirteen , the half - understood caution that makes a girl timid , or wild , the shyness told me to just walk .	I
[MASK] wanted to feel the rough edge of the pocket of his coat against my cheek , but I was too tall .	I
[MASK] wanted to be seven again , and safe .	I
But [MASK] still wanted to push against his hand and put my hand in his pocket and steal the leather palmed glove , that secret animal .	I
Instead [MASK] went into the church , took a Bulletin , dipped my finger in Holy Water and genuflected .	I
The [MASK] of the church smelled like damp wood and furniture polish , not alive at all .	inside
My [MASK] took off his coat and draped it over the edge of the pew and when I came back from communion I stole his glove .	father
The paper [MASK] of the wafer was still in my mouth and I took a deep breath of the leather .	taste
[MASK] smelled like March .	It
[MASK] walked back through the school because it was drizzling , my father tall in his navy suit and my shoes going click on the linoleum .	We
The [MASK] ended in a T and we went left through the gym , walked underneath the bleachers and stood next to the side door , waiting for the rain to stop .	hall
[MASK] was dark under the bleachers .	It
My [MASK] was a young man , thirty - five , younger because he liked to be outside , to play softball on Saturday and to take my mother and me camping on vacation .	father
[MASK] stood rocked back on his heels with his coat thrown over his shoulders and his hands in his pockets .	He
[MASK] thought of bacon and eggs , toast with peach jam out of the jar .	I
[MASK] was so hungry .	I
The [MASK] under the bleachers was secret and dark .	space
The [MASK] from the door made the shadows under the bleachers darker , the long space stretched far away .	light
[MASK] heard the rain and the faint rustle of paper and smelled damp concrete .	I
[MASK] did not go near my father but kept my hand in my pocket , feeling the soft leather glove .	I
[MASK] wondered if anyone ever went back under the bleachers , if there were crickets or mice there .	I
The [MASK] might have been mice .	rustling
[MASK] wished the rain would stop .	I
[MASK] wanted to go home .	I
[MASK] made noises with my heels but they were too loud so I stopped .	I
[MASK] else clicked and I tried to see what it was but could nt see anything .	Something
[MASK] was nt as loud as my heels .	It
My [MASK] cleared his throat , looking out the door .	father
[MASK] imagined a man down there in the dark , an escaped convict or a madman .	I
In fifteen minutes [MASK] would be home and my mother would fry eggs .	we
[MASK] heard a noise like paper .	I
My [MASK] heard it , too , but he pretended not to , at least he did nt turn his head .	father
[MASK] looked at my father but he did nt turn his head .	I
[MASK] wished he would turn his head .	I
[MASK] had no explanation for the particular combination of sounds .	I
Once in a fever [MASK] heard thousands of birds outside my window and I was terrified that they would fling themselves through the glass and attack me , but it was only the rain on the eaves .	I
My father s [MASK] were largely incomprehensible to me , guided by his own secret and labyrinthine calculations .	actions
[MASK] dwelt in another world , a world of intrigue , bargains , contracts and clandestine purchases of land all over the island .	He
[MASK] was in many ways a world in himself , whole as a sphere .	He
No doubt his [MASK] were perfectly logical in his own eyes  even the one that prompted him , a patriotic islander , to bring me a tutor from Bain : Master Lunre , an Olondrian .	decisions
The [MASK] began as it usually did when my father was expected home from his travels , the house festooned with flowers and stocked with coconut liquor .	day
[MASK] stood by the gate , washed and perfumed and arrayed in our brightest clothes , my mother twisting her hands in her skirt , my father s wife with red eyes .	We
[MASK] , grown taller and broad in the shoulders , moaned gently to himself , while I stood nervously rubbing the heel of one sandal on the flagstones .	Jom
[MASK] scanned the deep blue valley for the first sign of the company , but before we saw them we heard the children shouting :  A yellow man ! 	We
[MASK] glanced at one another in confusion .	We
My [MASK] bit her lower lip ; Jom gave a groan of alarm .	mother
At first [MASK] thought the children meant my father , whose golden skin , the color of the night - monkey s pelt , was a rarity in the islands ; but certainly the children of Tyom were familiar with my father , and would never have greeted a council - member with such ill - mannered yells .	I
Then [MASK] remembered the only  yellow man  I had ever seen , an Olondrian wizard and doctor who had visited Tyom in my childhood , who wore two pieces of glass on his eyes , attached to his ears with wires , and roamed the hills of Tinimavet , cutting bits off the trees .	I
[MASK] have since learned that that doctor wrote a well - received treatise , On the Medicinal Properties of the Juice of the Young Coconut , and died a respected man in his native city of Deinivel ; but at the time I felt certain he had returned with his sack of tree - cuttings .	I
And there [MASK] were : a chain of riders weaving among the trees .	they
My father s plaited [MASK] appeared , his still , imposing figure , and beside him another man , tall and lean , astride an island mule .	umbrella
The hectic [MASK] of the children preceded the company into the village , so that they advanced like a festival , drawing people out of their houses .	screams
As they approached [MASK] saw that my father s face was shining with pride , and his bearing had in it a new hauteur , like that of the old island kings .	I
The [MASK] who rode beside him , looking uncomfortable with his long legs , kept his gaze lowered and fixed between the ears of his plodding mule .	man
[MASK] was not yellow , but very pale brown , the color of raw cashews ; he had silver hair , worn cropped close to the skull so that it resembled a cap .	He
[MASK] was not the leaf - collecting doctor , but an altogether strange man , with silver eyebrows in his smooth face and long fine - knuckled hands .	He
As he dismounted in front of the house [MASK] heard my mother whispering :  Protect us , God with the Black - and - White Tail , from that which is not of this earth . 	I
My [MASK] dismounted from his mule and strutted toward us , grinning .	father
[MASK] thought I caught an odor off him , of fish , sea - sickness and sweat .	I
[MASK] knelt and stared down at the bald ground , murmuring ritual greetings , until he touched the tops of our heads with the palm of his fleshy hand .	We
Then [MASK] stood , unable to keep from staring at the stranger , who faced us awkwardly , half - smiling , taller than any man there .	we
[MASK] interviews meteorological experts on Cyclone Phalin	Wikinews
[MASK] Phailin has winds that have been measured at 200 km / h , as it surges over land will it begin to lose strength ?	Cyclone
As of the last advisory , T [MASK] Phailin has winds of 190 kilometers per hour and has moved inland , headed on a northwest track .	C
[MASK] is a Category 3 storm .	That
The [MASK] is for a continued decline in strength to a tropical storm within 24 hours and a tropical depression within 36 hours .	forecast
Yes , [MASK] will loose strength steadily as more and more of this swirling system moves from being over ocean to being over land .	it
[MASK] occurs for two reasons :	This
Yes , the [MASK] is almost certain to lose strength as it surges over land .	Cyclone
[MASK] gather their strength through scraping moisture and heat from warm ocean water that it is not the case over land .	Cyclones
In the mean time , much stronger [MASK] over land quickly reduces their strength .	friction
All tropical [MASK] lose strength once they make landfall .	cyclones
However , [MASK] can remain dangerous storms due to very heavy rains and subsequent landslides , and river flooding .	they
Phailin 's [MASK] will rapidly weaken as it pushes inland .	winds
Once Cyclone Phailin comes on shore [MASK] will immediately begin to lose strength .	it
However , and this is important , [MASK] still will contain lots of rainfall making flooding an almost certainty .	it
A previous [MASK] in 1999 in the Bay of Bengal area of India left 10,000 people dead .	cyclone
[MASK] have not followed that aspect of the societal response for the present storm .	I
Hopefully , [MASK] all learn from past mistakes .	we
The [MASK] of strong cyclones and death in the region is notable , with at least 5 large cyclone events in the past 35 years with 10,000 and as many as 300,000 people killed , millions left homeless and estimated damages as high as US $ 10 billion .	history
[MASK] do n't have enough information to answer this question , one way or the other .	I
From all the press reports that I have read , the Indian [MASK] appears to have taken the threat of Cyclone Phailin very seriously indeed .	government
The [MASK] has been much more pro-active in preparing for this cyclone than in the past .	government
The [MASK] of cyclone track and intensity have been fairly accurate .	forecasts
Unfortunately , extensive property [MASK] is bound to occur even with the best preparation .	damage
My [MASK] of the responsiveness of the Indian government to this storm is purely from the cyber space .	knowledge
[MASK] heard that they orchestrated the largest people evacuation to a natural disaster in Indian history .	I
[MASK] visited the damaged area of the 1999 storm near Bhubaneshwar in the summer of 2012 for an invited symposium and summer school on tropical cyclones [ ... ] sponsored by the Indian government .	I
Given the living standard and residence of people living near the coastal areas in this region , the [MASK] is certainly necessary and essential to save lives .	evacuation
[MASK] can not comment directly on how the Indian government was prepared for this cyclone .	I
However , the news [MASK] ( BBC etc. ) were very encouraging in that the authorities were reportedly making strenuous efforts to evacuate the population from near the coast and areas that are prone to flooding .	reports
[MASK] is the main killer in these storms .	Water
For this question [MASK] do n't know the ' preparedness ' of the Indian gov't to deal with this .	I

[MASK] Sent Gaming is basically me and Isabel , I 'm Mario J. Lucero .	Heaven

Yep , [MASK] like to just make our own original content , and , yep , that 's what we wanted to do .	we
How did [MASK] two meet ?	you
[MASK] met back in high school .	We
But , before hand in middle school , [MASK] kept on hearing about this guy named Mario , and he kept on hearing about me , this girl named Isabel .	I
And , [MASK] , all of our friends and all of our acquaintances would say , " Hey , you 'd get along with him really well . "	everyone
So before hand [MASK] kinda knew about him , but I never met him .	I
And [MASK] of our friends , our common friends , he introduced us during study hall , and we just kind of hit it off from there .	one

Right now , yeah , [MASK] 's helping us right now .	he

Well , back in college , back in Collins College , [MASK] and I , we had met like she said at Sandia View Academy , and we went off to college together in Arizona ;	Isabel
and ... ( how do [MASK] best explain this ? )	I
Basically , [MASK] came up with a few class projects , and I came up with a few class projects ;	she
[MASK] started working with a few of our friends , and colleagues and whatnot .	we
[MASK] included Drew Cass , Devin Thurlow , people like that .	Those
She had several ideas , and she used to draw a lot in the sketchbook , [MASK] used to have this thick sketchbook that she used to carry around with her everywhere , where she 'd draw these different characters and whatnot ;	she
and [MASK] was always really shy to show that off to people , and I wanted to help her show that stuff , and I wanted to bring it out to the world .	she
[MASK] was a writer , and she always liked my writings , so I was like , let 's just get both of our things together , and let 's get this done .	I
[MASK] just want to be able to bring , like she said , bring light into the entertainment and into the media industry , specifically is what we do .	We
[MASK] Sam , 42 , and his wife Manju Sam , 36 , from Sydney , Australia , are undergoing trial for manslaughter by gross negligence for the death of their nine - month - old child , Gloria .	Thomas
[MASK] died from infection caused by severe eczema after they shunned effective conventional medical treatments for homeopathy , a form of alternative medicine that has been described as pseudoscience .	She
[MASK] in peer - reviewed academic journals including Social Science & Medicine have characterized homeopathy as a form of quackery .	Articles
[MASK] developed severe eczema at the age of four months and the parents were advised to send the child to a skin specialist .	Gloria
[MASK] Sam , a practising homeopath , instead decided to treat his daughter himself .	Thomas
His daughter 's [MASK] deteriorated , to the point that the baby spent all her energy battling the infections caused by the constant breaking of the skin , leading to severe malnutrition and , eventually , her death .	condition
By the end , Gloria 's [MASK] was so severe that her skin broke every time her parents changed her clothes or nappy , and in the words of the Crown prosecutor , Mark Tedeschi , QC , " Gloria spent a lot of the last five months of her life crying , irritable , scratching and the only thing that gave her solace was to suck on her mother 's breast . "	eczema
[MASK] also became unable to move her legs .	Gloria
[MASK] Tedeschi also told the court that , over the last five months of her life , " Gloria 's eczema played a devastating role in her overall health and it is asserted by the Crown that both her parents knew this and discussed it with each other . "	Mr.
However , despite their child 's severe illness , and her lack of improvement , the [MASK] continued to shun conventional medical treatment , instead seeking help from other homeopaths and naturopaths .	Sams
[MASK] temporarily improved during the rare times they used conventional treatments , but they soon dropped them in favour of homeopathy , and she consistently worsened .	Gloria
Allegedly , Thomas ' [MASK] pleaded with him to send Gloria to a conventional medical doctor , but he replied " I am not able to do that " .	sister
By this time , " her [MASK] was weeping , her body malnourished and her corneas melting " , according to the Sydney Morning Herald .	skin
Speaking in the parents ' defense , [MASK] Molomby , SC , said that , as the parents came from India , where homeopathy is in common use , they should be declared not guilty due to cultural differences .	Tom
[MASK] is a form of alternative medicine which treats patients with massively diluted forms of substances that , if given to a healthy person undiluted , would cause symptoms similar to the disease .	Homeopathy
Typical [MASK] take the dilutions , with ritualised shaking between each step of the dilution , past the level where any molecules of the original substance are likely to remain ; for homeopathic treatments to work , basic well - understood concepts in chemistry and physics would have to be wrong .	treatments
Australian [MASK] suffering from iodine deficiency	children
Almost half of all Australian primary school children are mild to moderately iodine deficient , [MASK] say .	researchers
A new [MASK] documenting iodine nutritional status in Australian school children has revealed many are not getting enough iodine - which can lead to mental and growth retardation .	study
The report 's [MASK] say iodine deficiency is " the sleeper health issue in Australia " , and potentially a very serious one .	authors
The [MASK] of the Australian National Iodine Nutrition Study published in the Medical Journal of Australia this week , revealed that children in mainland Australia are borderline iodine deficient .	results
The [MASK] has prompted calls for all edible salt to be iodised .	report
[MASK] say adding the mineral to salt is the simplest and most effective method of preventing iodine deficiency disorders .	They
The [MASK] say the results confirm the existence of inadequate iodine intake in the Australian population .	authors
[MASK] call for " urgent implementation of mandatory iodisation of all edible salt in Australia . "	They
Most [MASK] in food comes from seafood , milk and iodised salt .	iodine
[MASK] Cres Eastman , Director of the National Iodine Nutrition study , and Chairman of the Australian Centre for Control of Iodine Deficiency Disorders , says it is crucial that children and pregnant women in particular have an adequate intake of iodine .	Professor
Iodine [MASK] can lead to serious health problems including brain damage , stunted growth and deafness .	deficiency
[MASK] Eastman says manufacturers could easily remedy the situation by using iodised salt in their products in line with the United States and most European countries .	Professor
" I suspect they wo n't do that on a voluntary basis , we 've tried so far and have n't succeeded , so we 've convinced the Food Standards of Australia and New Zealand | that all salt should be iodised , " [MASK] said .	he
The [MASK] says the decline in iodine intake appears to be due to changes in the dairy industry , where chlorine - containing sanitisers have replaced iodine - containing sanitisers .	report
[MASK] released from these chemicals into milk has been the major source of dietary iodine in Australia for at least four decades , but is now declining .	Iodine
Another contributory [MASK] has been the decreasing consumption of iodised salt used in foods .	factor
The [MASK] states that few if any food manufacturers use iodised salt in the preparation and manufacture of foods .	report
[MASK] Eastman says iodine is added to only 10 per cent of Australian salt in contravention of a World Health Organisation recommendation that all salt be iodised .	Professor
[MASK] says authorities are reacting slowly to his urgent calls for mandatory iodised salt .	He
" The [MASK] of iodine deficiency are dependent upon how severe it is and when it occurs .	effects
So if we go to the pregnant woman , she does n't get enough iodine , she wo n't make enough thyroid hormone , and the foetus wo n't get the amount of thyroid hormone it needs for adequate and proper development of the brain , so you 'll then see consequences being loss of IQ , learning difficulties , hearing difficulties and other neurological problems , " [MASK] Eastman said .	Professor
More than two billion [MASK] around the world live in areas prone to iodine deficiency , and yet the problem is easily fixed .	people
The World Health [MASK] ( WHO ) recommends that every country should iodise all edible salt .	Organisation
The most well known [MASK] of IDD are visible goiter and cretinism , a condition characterised by severe brain damage occurring in very early life .	effects
[MASK] say Iodine deficiency is the world s most prevalent , yet easily preventable , cause of brain damage .	WHO
[MASK] Eastman said he is alarmed by what they found .	Professor
" Pregnant [MASK] in Australia are getting about half as much as what they require on a daily basis .	women
So that alarms me , because there 's quite serious potential for adverse effects and brain damage in the next generation of children born in this country , " [MASK] said .	he
" If Iodine deficiency is serious [MASK] lose 15 IQ points , on average .	you
[MASK] Buchtmann for Food Standards Australia New Zealand , says they are looking at mandatory guidelines on iodine by the end of the year .	Lydia
[MASK] says the issue is complicated and will take time to get right .	She
[MASK] need to " make sure there 's sufficient iodine added into the food supply , to help those people with a deficiency .	We
But at the other end of the scale we 've got to make sure the people who eat a lot of food - we all know the teenage boy who comes home from school and eats a whole loaf of bread - that those people do n't get too much and get overdose , " [MASK] Bauchtman said .	Ms
" One of the reasons that iodine is going down is because [MASK] are taking that good healthy eating message and not adding salt during cooking . "	people
Senior [MASK] Mu Li , of the University of NSW 's school of public health , said " it is reasonable to assume that pregnant women and breastfeeding mothers are also iodine deficient , putting the next generation of children born in this country at risk of the neuropsychological consequences of iodine deficiency . "	researcher
Madam Speaker , " [MASK] solemnly swear that in all things appertaining to the trial of the impeachment of Donald John Trump , President of the United States , now pending , I will do impartial justice according to the Constitution and laws . "	I
[MASK] is the oath Senators swore on January 16 .	That
[MASK] is the oath created by Senators when they tried the first impeachment of a President in 1868 .	It
[MASK] is an oath rooted in the Revolution fought by their grandparents to create a republic of laws , not kings .	It
[MASK] is an oath whose power derives from its common sense : that a juror must always be impartial for a trial to be fair .	It
And [MASK] is an oath made necessary by the fact that Senators are not , as we are not , under normal circumstances , impartial in our work .	it
The [MASK] chosen for this oath recognize that when our Constitution calls Senators to try impeachment , it calls them away from their role as partisans .	words
After voting to refuse to hear evidence and call witnesses with pertinent information , nearly all Republican [MASK] have already announced that they will vote against the articles .	Senators
In doing so , [MASK] of them acknowledge that what President Trump did was wrong and inappropriate .	many
[MASK] accept that it was wrong for him to withhold military aid to Ukraine until the President of that country promised to interfere in the American elections .	They
The [MASK] of President Trump 's abuse of power and attempt to solicit foreign interference in the 2020 elections is clear enough that Republican Senators can not and have not denied the facts , yet they can not bring themselves to confront this President and are choosing party over country .	evidence
The [MASK] from Alaska , in explaining her decision to vote to block witnesses and evidence , tried to deflect responsibility from the consequences of her actions , writing : " I have come to the conclusion that there will be no fair trial in the Senate . "	Senator
[MASK] agree with that .	I
[MASK] further said : " It is sad for me today to admit that , as an institution , the Congress has failed . "	She
Madam Speaker , the [MASK] has not failed .	Congress
The [MASK] did its job , whether you agree or not .	House
In regular order , by a vote of this House , [MASK] impeached the President of the United States based upon our oath to protect and defend the Constitution of the United States .	we
The [MASK] did its job and did so with the solemnity required when undertaking the process of impeachment , which we did not seek but accepted as our responsibility under the Constitution .	House
[MASK] held hearings , called witnesses , and subpoenaed documents .	We
[MASK] is the Senate , Madam Speaker , that will fail if it does not hold this President accountable for using a hold on military aid to compel an ally to interfere in our election for his own personal gain .	It
[MASK] will judge poorly those who choose fear of their party over the courage to do the right thing .	History
Neither the [MASK] nor myself , nor the whip , Jim Clyburn , urged any member in our party to vote any way on impeachment .	Speaker
Our [MASK] voted consistent with their oath of office and the conviction that that vote was required by that oath to protect and defend the Constitution .	members
[MASK] will judge .	Americans
It is because [MASK] know future generations will look back on this chapter in our history and ask :	I
[MASK] stood up for the Constitution and the laws ?	Who
[MASK] stood up for the values our Founders charged us to keep ?	Who
[MASK] refused to shrink from the heavy responsibilities of their oath ?	Who
[MASK] can be proud that the House did its job , followed the law , defended our Constitution .	I
[MASK] did not convict ; that is not our role .	We
[MASK] am also proud of the House managers , as all of my colleagues on the Democratic side of the aisle are proud of our managers who made their case .	I
[MASK] made their case with intellect .	They
[MASK] made their case with evidence that had been adduced here in the House .	They
[MASK] made their case and appealed to Senators to hold this President accountable , as our Founders intended .	They
Almost [MASK] has watched a trial either in person or on television .	everybody
A [MASK] is not an opening argument and a closing argument with nothing in between .	trial
Seventy - five [MASK] of our people wanted to have witnesses because that was their understanding of what a trial is , not just argument at the beginning and argument at the end , but evidence for jurors who have pledged to be impartial to consider .	percent
Any [MASK] in this country would agree that opening and closing statements alone are not a trial .	judge
Nevertheless , the House [MASK] proved their case .	managers
The [MASK] is clear .	truth
The American [MASK] know what that truth is and know what this President has done .	people
And [MASK] will remember who on this day abided by the truth , the whole truth , and nothing but the truth .	they
To a few of us here today [MASK] is a solemn and most momentous occasion , and yet in the history of our nation it is a commonplace occurrence .	this
The orderly [MASK] of authority as called for in the Constitution routinely takes place , as it has for almost two centuries , and few of us stop to think how unique we really are .	transfer
In the eyes of many in the world , this every 4 - year [MASK] we accept as normal is nothing less than a miracle .	ceremony
Mr. President , [MASK] want our fellow citizens to know how much you did to carry on this tradition .	I
By your gracious cooperation in the transition process , [MASK] have shown a watching world that we are a united people pledged to maintaining a political system which guarantees individual liberty to a greater degree than any other , and I thank you and your people for all your help in maintaining the continuity which is the bulwark of our Republic .	you
The [MASK] of our nation goes forward .	business
[MASK] suffer from the longest and one of the worst sustained inflations in our national history .	We
[MASK] distorts our economic decisions , penalizes thrift , and crushes the struggling young and the fixed - income elderly alike .	It
[MASK] threatens to shatter the lives of millions of our people .	It
Idle [MASK] have cast workers into unemployment , human misery , and personal indignity .	industries
But great as our tax burden is , [MASK] has not kept pace with public spending .	it
For decades [MASK] have piled deficit upon deficit , mortgaging our future and our children 's future for the temporary convenience of the present .	we
[MASK] and I , as individuals , can , by borrowing , live beyond our means , but for only a limited period of time .	You
Why , then , should [MASK] think that collectively , as a nation , we 're not bound by that same limitation ?	we
[MASK] must act today in order to preserve tomorrow .	We
The economic [MASK] we suffer have come upon us over several decades .	ills
[MASK] will not go away in days , weeks , or months , but they will go away .	They
[MASK] will go away because we as Americans have the capacity now , as we 've had in the past , to do whatever needs to be done to preserve this last and greatest bastion of freedom .	They
In this present crisis , [MASK] is not the solution to our problem ; government is the problem .	government
Well , if no one among us is capable of governing himself , then [MASK] among us has the capacity to govern someone else ?	who
[MASK] of us together , in and out of government , must bear the burden .	All
The [MASK] we seek must be equitable , with no one group singled out to pay a higher price .	solutions
[MASK] hear much of special interest groups .	We
Well , our [MASK] must be for a special interest group that has been too long neglected .	concern
[MASK] knows no sectional boundaries or ethnic and racial divisions , and it crosses political party lines .	It
[MASK] are , in short , " We the people , " this breed called Americans .	They
Well , this administration 's [MASK] will be a healthy , vigorous , growing economy that provides equal opportunities for all Americans , with no barriers born of bigotry or discrimination .	objective
[MASK] must share in the productive work of this " new beginning , " and all must share in the bounty of a revived economy .	All
With the idealism and fair play which are the core of our system and our strength , [MASK] can have a strong and prosperous America , at peace with itself and the world .	we
A [MASK] is a government in which political power  influence over institutions , leaders , and policies  rests in the hands of the people .	democracy
In a representative democracy , however , the [MASK] do not govern directly .	citizens
Instead , [MASK] elect representatives to make decisions and pass laws on behalf of all the people .	they
Thus , U.S. [MASK] vote for members of Congress , the president and vice president , members of state legislatures , governors , mayors , and members of town councils and school boards to act on their behalf .	citizens
Most representative [MASK] favor majority rule :	governments
the [MASK] of the majority of the people have more influence with government than those of the minority .	opinions
In a direct democracy , unlike representative democracy , [MASK] participate directly in making government decisions .	people
Here [MASK] debated and voted for or against all proposed laws .	they
Although neither the federal government nor any of the state governments function as a direct democracy  the Constitution requires the national and state governments to be representative forms of government  some [MASK] of direct democracy do exist in the United States .	elements
While residents of the different states vote for people to represent them and to make laws in their behalf in the state legislatures and in Congress , [MASK] may still directly vote on certain issues .	people
Such [MASK] provide additional opportunities for civic engagement .	occasions
[MASK] of Boxborough , Massachusetts , gather in a local hotel to discuss issues affecting their town .	Residents
New England town [MASK] provide an opportunity for people to experience direct democracy .	meetings
This [MASK] has lasted for hundreds of years .	tradition
Most [MASK] now have some form of representative government ( Figure 1.6 ) . 5	countries
In a monarchy , one [MASK] , usually a hereditary ruler , holds political power .	ruler
Although the power of some monarchs is limited by law , and such kings and queens often rule along with an elected legislature that makes laws for the country , [MASK] is not always the case .	this
Many southwest Asian [MASK] , such as Saudi Arabia , Qatar , and the United Arab Emirates , have absolute monarchs whose power is unrestricted .	kingdoms
As discussed earlier , another nondemocratic [MASK] of government is oligarchy , in which a handful of elite members of society , often those who belong to a particular political party , hold all political power .	form
Some nondemocratic [MASK] are totalitarian in nature .	societies
Under totalitarianism , the [MASK] is more important than the citizens , and it controls all aspects of citizens  lives .	government
These [MASK] of government are fairly rare .	forms
North [MASK] is an example of a totalitarian government .	Korea
The [MASK] of the world shows the different forms of government that currently exist .	map
[MASK] that are colored blue have some form of representative democracy , although the people may not have as much political power as they do in the United States .	Countries
[MASK] that are colored red , like China , Vietnam , and Cuba , have an oligarchic form of government .	Countries
[MASK] that are colored yellow are monarchies where the people play little part in governing .	Countries
The CIA [MASK] provides information about the types of government across the world .	website
When we divide and subdivide the tasks involved with producing a good or service , [MASK] and businesses can produce a greater quantity of output .	workers
In his observations of pin factories , [MASK] noticed that one worker alone might make 20 pins in a day , but that a small business of 10 workers ( some of whom would need to complete two or three of the 18 tasks involved with pin - making ) , could make 48,000 pins in a day .	Smith
How can a [MASK] of workers , each specializing in certain tasks , produce so much more than the same number of workers who try to produce the entire good or service by themselves ?	group
[MASK] offered three reasons .	Smith
First , [MASK] in a particular small job allows workers to focus on the parts of the production process where they have an advantage .	specialization
( In later chapters , [MASK] will develop this idea by discussing comparative advantage . )	we
[MASK] have different skills , talents , and interests , so they will be better at some jobs than at others .	People
Only [MASK] with medical degrees qualify to become doctors , for instance .	those
For some goods , [MASK] affects specialization .	geography
Whatever the reason , if people specialize in the production of what they do best , [MASK] will be more effective than if they produce a combination of things , some of which they are good at and some of which they are not .	they
Second , [MASK] who specialize in certain tasks often learn to produce more quickly and with higher quality .	workers
This [MASK] holds true for many workers , including assembly line laborers who build cars , stylists who cut hair , and doctors who perform heart surgery .	pattern
In fact , specialized [MASK] often know their jobs well enough to suggest innovative ways to do their work faster and better .	workers
A similar [MASK] often operates within businesses .	pattern
In many cases , a [MASK] that focuses on one or a few products ( sometimes called its  core competency  ) is more successful than firms that try to make a wide range of products .	business
Third , [MASK] allows businesses to take advantage of economies of scale , which means that for many goods , as the level of production increases , the average cost of producing each individual unit declines .	specialization
For example , if a factory produces only 100 cars per year , each [MASK] will be quite expensive to make on average .	car
However , if a factory produces 50,000 cars each year , then [MASK] can set up an assembly line with huge machines and workers performing specialized tasks , and the average cost of production per car will be lower .	it
The ultimate result of workers who can focus on their preferences and talents , learn to do their specialized jobs better , and work in larger organizations is that [MASK] as a whole can produce and consume far more than if each person tried to produce all of his or her own goods and services .	society
The [MASK] and specialization of labor has been a force against the problem of scarcity .	division

So like I said , [MASK] 'm on my general nuclear medicine rotation this week .	I
So so far this morning [MASK] 've just read a few studies ( it 's a little slow in the morning ) of general nuclear medicine because a lot of stuff takes time for the radio tracers to go into the body or the specific organ we are targeting , so we have to wait a little bit in the morning .	I
So [MASK] 've done three lymphoscintigraphies .	I
For lymphoscintigraphies [MASK] basically inject technetium in skin surrounding a melanoma and after we inject we wait about 15 - 20 minutes , maybe up to an hour , and wait for that radio tracer to travel to the closest lymph node which we would call the sentinel lymph node .	we
What we do is [MASK] mark it under our cameras and then the patient will go up to the OR , have the melanoma , a wide excision of the melanoma , and then they will try to find the lymph node that we marked and take that one out as well to make sure there 's no metastasis .	we
