[MASK] ( Greek :  , Athna ) , is the capital city of Greece with a metropolitan population of 3.7 million inhabitants .	Athens
[MASK] is in many ways the birthplace of Classical Greece , and therefore of Western civilization .	It
The [MASK] says that the King of Athens , Theseus unified the ten tribes of early Athens into one kingdom ( c. 1230 BC ) .	legend
This [MASK] of synoikismos  bringing together in one home  created the largest and wealthiest state on the Greek mainland , but it also created a larger class of people excluded from political life by the nobility .	process
By the 7th century BC , social [MASK] had become widespread , and the Areopagus appointed Draco to draft a strict new law code ( hence " draconian " ) .	unrest
When this failed , [MASK] appointed Solon , with a mandate to create a new constitution ( 594 ) .	they
[MASK] was the great beginning of a new social revolution , which was the result of the democracy under Clisthenes ( 508 BC ) .	This
During the Middle Ages , [MASK] experienced a decline , but re-emerged under Byzantian rule .	Athens
[MASK] was thriving and prosperous during the Crusades , actually benefiting from the Italian trade during this period .	Athens
However , this fruitful [MASK] was short - lived , as Greece suffered badly under the Ottoman Empire , only to recover in the 19th century as the capital of independent Greece .	period
[MASK] hosted the 2004 Summer Olympic Games .	Athens
While most of the sporting venues were located outside the city proper - in various locations throughout Attica - the entire urban [MASK] of Athens underwent major lasting changes that have improved the quality of life for visitors and residents alike .	area
Aside from the excellent transportation infrastructure that was completed in time for the 2004 Olympics ( from new freeways to light rail systems ) , the city 's historic [MASK] underwent serious renovation .	center
The ancient Olympic [MASK] took place in Olympia from 776 BCE to 394 AD .	Games
[MASK] is a lengthy day trip from Athens to visit Olympia , but quite interesting .	It
[MASK] was just a small provincial village when it was chosen in the 1830s to serve as the national capital of the modern Greek State .	Athens
Although it had a prestigious past , the city 's political , economic , and cultural [MASK] had declined over the centuries , leaving behind only its classical ruins as a reminder of better times .	importance
The [MASK] regained its importance in Greek civilization , and by 1900 had evolved into a very attractive cosmopolitan city , with abundant neoclassical architecture harking to the nation 's past .	city
The 20th [MASK] however , marked the rapid development of Athens .	century
The [MASK] suffered minor damage during WWII , and suffered extensive urban planning in the decades that followed , as the nation rapidly industrialized and urbanized .	city
The [MASK] also expanded outward through rash development , particularly towards the west , as its population grew by absorbing job - seekers from the provinces .	city
With the onset of the automobile , public [MASK] reduced the city 's public transportation services without foreseeing the traffic gridlock and smog that would menace the city by the 1980s .	officials
By the late 1980s and early 1990s , the city 's [MASK] led to a rude awakening among local and national officials and , coupled with the country 's new found remarkable prosperity , large scale projects began to slowly regenerate the city and undo some of the damages of recent decades .	reality
[MASK] today is ever evolving , forging a brand new identity for the 21st century .	Athens
[MASK] and late autumn are the best times to visit Athens .	Spring
[MASK] can be extremely hot and dry during heatwaves , but this rarely happens .	Summer
[MASK] is definitely low season , with the occasional rainy or snowy day , but also an ideal time to save money while enjoying the city without countless other travelers and tourists .	Winter
Whilst peak traffic hour can be a bit smoggy on the main roads , on most sunny days the [MASK] are azure blue .	skies
The government 's [MASK] on diesel vehicles within Athens and the early 1990s initiatives to improve car emissions have greatly contributed to better atmospheric conditions in the basin .	ban
[MASK] is in the province of Palawan , Philippines on Busuanga Island .	Coron
[MASK] is the largest town on the island and has the largest share of accommodations .	It
[MASK] is both the name of the largest town on the island of Busuanga , and the name of a different , smaller island just offshore .	Coron
The [MASK] is famous for its World War II wreck diving , and the site has been named in many lists of top dive spots in the world .	area
The [MASK] is around ten well preserved underwater shipwrecks surrounded with coral reef .	result
Barracuda and Kayangan [MASK] are both stunning locations , and good for snorkeling , and the island is the ancestral domain of an indigenous tribe who are managing the island in a sustainable way and keeping outsiders at a distance and offshore at night .	lakes
The first [MASK] of Coron were the Tagbanuas who belong to the second wave of Indonesians who migrated to this area some 5,000 years ago .	inhabitants
[MASK] were a nomadic , seafaring people , living mainly by fishing and subsistence agriculture .	They
Although they are now sedentary ( with the young using cell phones , etc. ) , [MASK] maintain many of their old customs , traditions and beliefs .	they
Today , the [MASK] remain the dominant if not entire population of Coron .	Tagbanuas
From 1939 to the outbreak of World War II , the [MASK] experienced the mining boom .	municipality
[MASK] shifted from farming to mining .	Labor
In July 1942 the [MASK] occupied the mining camps and resumed operation of the manganese mines .	Japanese
To this day , about [MASK] or 12 of these World War II Japanese shipwrecks comprise what is considered one of the best dive sites in the world .	10
The [MASK] increased , as many people from Luzon and the Visayas came to work either as fishermen or miners .	population
In the past , [MASK] was virtually unknown outside of Palawan .	Coron
[MASK] remains a small , quaint fishing town with laid back charm but with increasing media exposure it is growing , slowly but steadily ,	It
[MASK] has taken an important position in the tourism industry .	Coron
From one - liners to classic three - liners to the one - minute gag you tell your friends , a good [MASK] pleases everyone .	joke
Joke - [MASK] is one of the best ways to ease tension , make a new friend , or light up a room .	telling
That is , of course , if [MASK] can get a laugh .	you
All [MASK] of the joke you tell , from the content to the length , need to be suited to your audience .	aspects
[MASK] s an individual , so there are no hard and fast rules .	Everyone
elderly [MASK] wo nt like crude jokes ;	people
[MASK] of a specific ethnic or racial group wo nt enjoy jokes making fun of their group ;	people
[MASK] can find fodder lots of places  from your life , joke files online , by repurposing jokes you ve heard in the past , and so on .	You
[MASK] may want to start your own joke file .	You
[MASK] can write your jokes down on index cards to keep them handy or use a document file on your computer . [ 1 ]	You
The latter [MASK] may allow for easier revision .	option
Every [MASK] has a  target ,  which is what the joke is about .	joke
For example , [MASK] are likely to laugh at jokes about wives and vice versa ;	husbands
[MASK] will typically find jokes about school and teachers humorous .	students
The [MASK] of the joke  or setup  should have a basis in the real world so your audience can relate to it , but it should also include exaggeration because this is what gives a joke its humorous edge . [ 3 ]	opening
[MASK] s a fundamental part of the joke ;	It
if you do nt lay a good foundation here , then the [MASK] wo nt make sense to the audience or they wo nt find it humorous .	punchline
Your [MASK] needs to be both realistic and exaggerated in order to be funny 	setup
The [MASK] can be slight or considerable 	exaggeration
[MASK] just depends on the individual joke .	it
The [MASK] of the joke is obviously crucial .	ending
[MASK] is where the payoff comes in , what makes the joke succeed or fail .	This
If you want to make the audience laugh , your [MASK] needs to be surprising .	punchline
Some [MASK] also have what is called a tag or topper , which is an additional punchline .	jokes
The [MASK] builds on the original punchline or twists back on it in a surprising way .	tag
[MASK] of jokes rehash the same ground and sometimes they retell a story countless other jokes have told .	Lots
For your joke to be funny , [MASK] has to surprise the audience in some way , which means it has to seem original or new .	it
[MASK] will make a familiar joke unrecognizable .	This
[MASK] may also make it particularly interesting if your audience is your friend(s) . [ 6 ]	It
[MASK] do nt need to have it completely memorized  in fact , you " should nt " memorize it  but you need to be really comfortable with it , so comfortable that you can continue on with telling it even if you get nervous or sidetracked , which is very possible once you re in front of an audience .	You
Memorized [MASK] sound wooden , like they are being read off a script instead of relayed by a friend or entertainer .	jokes
Good [MASK] have a lot of details and personality , so do nt be afraid to embellish . [ 7 ]	jokes
If you hear a lot of awkward pauses or ahs or ums , your [MASK] is nt ready and you need to practice more . [ 8 ]	joke
[MASK] can also try practicing in front of a sympathetic friend or family member once you re ready for a  real  audience .	You
Whether you are a working man or just a little cutie trying to stay cute , those [MASK] are going to need washing sooner or later .	overalls
Your [MASK] are also murder on the straps , which are almost always the first things to wear out on your overalls .	appliances
This [MASK] will show you how to save time and prevent wear , extending the life of your overalls until they are so soft you could wear them to bed .	article
If you did nt know already , the [MASK] is the top front part with the breast pockets .	bib
[MASK] will help keep them from twisting up during the wash .	This
This [MASK] will reapportion years of your life in the long run .	step
If your washing machine is worth its salt , [MASK] will undo those straps in a heartbeat and tie them in a sheet bend unless you prevent it .	it
[MASK] have more pockets than pants .	Overalls
The [MASK] has a wallet pocket and a watch pocket .	bib
[MASK] put rocks , candy , and bugs in these .	Kids
[MASK] put cell phones and small tools in them .	Men
[MASK] defy the laws of purse - space , so when it comes to bib pockets , the sky is the limit .	Women
[MASK] ve probably got them just the way you like them , but if you move the adjusters up or down on the straps occasionally , the straps will last longer .	You
Depending on the adjusters , [MASK] may be able to leave them a little loose too .	you
The [MASK] wear out fastest around the adjusters over the course of numerous wash and dry cycles ( not to mention being out in the elements if they are work clothes ) .	straps
[MASK] is the same idea as rotating tires .	This
[MASK] know about rotating your tires , do n't you ?	You
[MASK] will cut down on some of the racket , but you 're still going to hear them .	This
The paper - type twist [MASK] will deteriorate a little , but the dryer filter screen will catch the fallout .	ties
Plastic - type twist [MASK] will hold up in the wash , but may or may not melt in your dryer .	ties
[MASK] of the content in this topic may not be applicable to some languages .	Some
[MASK] can create SQL queries in one of two ANSI SQL query modes :	You
[MASK] describes the traditional Jet SQL syntax .	ANSI-89
This [MASK] conforms closely to the ANSI-89 Level 1 specification , but is not ANSI-89 Level 1 compliant .	mode
[MASK] provides new reserved words , syntax rules , and wildcard characters that enhance your ability to create queries , filters , and SQL statements .	ANSI-92
This [MASK] conforms closely to the ANSI-92 Level 1 specification , but is not ANSI-92 Level 1 compliant .	mode
This query [MASK] has more of the ANSI syntax , and the wildcard characters conform to the SQL specification .	mode
In Microsoft Access 2000 using ADOX , [MASK] could programmatically create queries that used ANSI-92 SQL syntax .	you
However , any [MASK] you created were not visible in the Database window because there was no option to set this mode in the user interface .	queries
Now in Access 2002 , [MASK] can set the ANSI SQL query mode through the user interface for the current database and as the default setting for new databases .	you
[MASK] may want to use ANSI-92 SQL for the following reasons :	You
[MASK] anticipate upsizing your application in the future to an Access project and want to create queries that will run with minimal changes in a Microsoft SQL Server database .	You
[MASK] want to take advantage of the new features not found in ANSI-89 SQL , such as :	You
Why [MASK] should avoid mixing queries created under different ANSI SQL query modes	you
[MASK] is the default setting for a new Access database in 2002 and 2000 file format .	ANSI-89
[MASK] can not set the SQL query mode new database default to ANSI-92 in 2000 file format because the option is disabled ;	You
[MASK] is the only query mode setting available for a database in Access 2000 file format .	ANSI-89
A connection [MASK] stores information about a connection to a data source ( such as an OLE DB data source ) and the data associated with the connection .	file
In Microsoft Access , [MASK] can use a connection file to bind one or more data access pages to a data source .	you
When you open a page , [MASK] reads the connection file that is linked to the page , and based on the contents of the connection file , connects the page to the appropriate data source .	Access
A connection [MASK] uses one of the following file formats :	file
[MASK] can view or edit the contents of the file in any text editor .	You
[MASK] that connect to a common data source can share a single connection file .	Pages
If you move or copy the data source , instead of updating the ConnectionString property of each dependent page , [MASK] only need to edit the connection information in the connection file to make the pages point to the right location or database .	you
When creating a data access page , [MASK] can choose whether you want to link the page to a connection file or simply use a connection file without creating a link .	you
[MASK] can also choose whether you want to use an existing connection file or create a new one .	You
Each time [MASK] open the page , Access will read the connection file , extract the connection information , and set the ConnectionString property of the page .	you
When creating a page , [MASK] can use the contents of a connection file to set the ConnectionString property of the page , but choose not to create a link between the page and the connection file .	you
When you create a link , [MASK] will automatically set the ConnectionString property based on the contents of the connection file .	Access
[MASK] will create a backup copy of the page ( pagefilename.bak.htm ) at the same location as the original data access page file .	Access
If the data access page includes any Microsoft Office Web Components ( a PivotTable list , chart , or spreadsheet ) , only [MASK] with a valid Microsoft Office 2002 license will be able to use those components .	users
[MASK] Access provides several techniques to help you analyze data .	Microsoft
[MASK] can use a crosstab query to calculate and restructure data for easier analysis .	You
Crosstab [MASK] calculate a sum , average , count , or other type of total for data that is grouped by two types of information  one down the left side of the datasheet and another across the top .	queries
A PivotTable [MASK] is an interactive table that you can use to analyze data dynamically from within a Web browser .	list
At run time , [MASK] can change the layout of the PivotTable list .	users
[MASK] can move the fields that are displayed in the row , column , and data area of the PivotTable list , or add or remove fields from the list .	They
[MASK] can also filter , sort , and group data .	Users
The following [MASK] shows a PivotTable list on the Orders data access page .	illustration
[MASK] 2002 provides a PivotTable view for datasheets and forms .	Access
In this view , [MASK] can build an interactive report using the fields underlying the datasheet or form .	you
The [MASK] uses a Microsoft Office PivotTable Component , so you can do all the things that you can do on a PivotTable list .	view
[MASK] can add fields to the view , move or remove fields , and filter , sort , and group data .	You
The following [MASK] shows the Employees table in PivotTable view .	illustration
[MASK] can control how the data is presented in a PivotTable view by customizing the layout .	You
A different [MASK] lets you calculate and compare summarized values for different elements in your data , or display summaries for a subset of the data .	layout
[MASK] change the layout by moving the fields to predefined drop areas within the PivotTable view workspace .	You
After you move fields to the drop areas so that the drop area captions are covered up , [MASK] can still drag additional fields to the areas .	you
Filter [MASK] allow you to confine the view to a particular part of the available data .	fields
For example , when you move a Product field to the filter area , [MASK] can display data for one product at a time .	you
The other [MASK] are outer fields .	fields
[MASK] can switch the inner and outer fields .	You
The [MASK] of a PivotTable view does not have to include all of the fields that are available from the underlying record source .	layout
[MASK] can also remove fields that you no longer want to see from the PivotTable view layout .	You
[MASK] change the layout of a chart by moving the fields to predefined drop areas within the chart workspace .	You
[MASK] Explorer has a default , built-in style sheet that displays the XML source as a (collapsible|expandable) tree .	Internet
[MASK] can use style sheets to insure that the XML-based Web pages on your intranet or Website are consistent and present a uniform appearance without having to add HTML to each page .	You
[MASK] for Transformation ( XSLT ) is a specification that is currently under development by the World Wide Web Consortium ( W3C ) , and supported by Access .	XSL
[MASK] is an XML-based language that allows one XML document to be mapped , or transformed , into another XML document .	XSLT
[MASK] provides a way of transforming an XML document 's presentation information from a source format to a target format and back again .	This
Typically , a [MASK] creates an XSL transformation file that , when applied to an XML document during export , interprets or transforms the XML data into a presentation format that can be recognized by another application , such as Service Advertising Protocol ( SAP ) or a custom purchase order format .	developer
[MASK] has many of the constructs ( structures and commands ) found in other programming languages which allow the developer to use variables , loops and iterations , and conditional statements .	XSLT
[MASK] gives the developer considerable control over the output of the XML data .	This
In Access , [MASK] can export the data , the schema ( data structure ) , or both , to XML files .	you
[MASK] can also transform the data to another presentation format using an Extensible Style Language ( XSL ) file during the export process .	You
[MASK] can export tables , queries , and the data behind forms or reports from a Microsoft Access database ( .mdb ) as well as tables , views , stored produces , functions , and the data behind forms and reports from a Microsoft Access project ( .adp ) .	You
[MASK] can export a database object as an XML document in several ways :	You
[MASK] can export just the data from a table , query , datasheet , form , or report into an XML file .	You
[MASK] can export just the schema ( data structure ) of a table , query , datasheet , form , or report to an XML schema file .	You
An XML schema [MASK] is a formal specification of the rules for an XML document , providing a series of element names , as well as which elements are allowed in the document and in what combinations .	file
When you export a table to an XML document , [MASK] can also export related tables .	you
For example , if you export a table of Customers Orders , [MASK] can also choose to export a related Orders Details table and Customers table into the same file .	you
If selected , [MASK] can also save the structure of a table , query , datasheet , form , or report into a file that describes the presentation and connection information .	you
For tables , queries-views , and datasheets , the presentation [MASK] is a spreadsheet-like template .	file
In addition , when you choose to save the data as XML , [MASK] can specify that the data be transformed to a custom display format by using an existing .xsl file .	you
[MASK] is a " language " developed by Microsoft and specific to Access which can be used to describe Access database objects in XML .	ReportML
When you export data from Access to an XML file , [MASK] choose to save the structure of a form or report into a ReportML format .	you
Any XML [MASK] produced by Access is well-formed , which means that it conforms to the basic rules of XML .	document
[MASK] is :	That
Each XML [MASK] must have a unique root element ( an element encompassing the entire document ) .	document
All start and end [MASK] match .	tags
XML [MASK] are case-sensitive .	tags
Again , XML [MASK] are case-sensitive .	tags
Access [MASK] will not write out any empty tags .	ReportML
[MASK] do not overlap .	Elements
In other words , start and end [MASK] must be properly nested within other elements .	tag
Certain reserve [MASK] are part of the XML syntax and will not be interpreted as themselves if used in the data portion of an element .	characters
[MASK] need to substitute a special character sequence ( called an " entity " by XML ) as follows :	You
The [MASK] is optional but is recommended in any XML document .	declaration
The [MASK] has a special purpose in an XML document and can be misinterpreted if used directly in the text .	apostrophe
[MASK] means that in addition to being well-formed , the documents conform to a defined schema .	This
To view and modify the contents of a PivotTable view by using Excel , [MASK] can export the PivotTable view to Excel .	you
Excel PivotTable [MASK] can not display detail fields .	reports
When you export to Excel , detail [MASK] will be available on the PivotTable toolbar in Excel , but the fields wo n't be displayed in the report .	fields
After [MASK] export	you
[MASK] might notice some differences in your PivotTable view after you export it to Excel .	You
[MASK] is because PivotTable views use the Microsoft Office PivotTable Component , and Excel PivotTable reports either do not support certain PivotTable list features , or they implement some features differently .	This
[MASK] can also copy data displayed in a PivotTable view to other programs , such as Microsoft FrontPage .	You
[MASK] can use the filter feature to find specific data values or all data that matches a value .	You
[MASK] can filter fields in the row , column , and detail areas .	You
When you filter a field , [MASK] select one or more items of data in the field that you want to view , and hide the other items .	you
3 When you filter a field , the drop-down arrow Field [MASK] for the filtered field changes to blue instead of black , and the AutoFilter button on the toolbar is selected .	arrow
[MASK] can apply a filter to a series or category field to show the top or bottom n items based on a total .	You
For example , [MASK] can filter for the three cities that generated the most sales or the five products that are least profitable .	you
Instead of n items , [MASK] can also choose to filter for a certain percentage of items .	you
For example , [MASK] can filter for the top 25 % or bottom 25 % of salespeople based on the number of orders handled .	you
If there are 40 salespeople , after the filter is applied , [MASK] will see data for 10 people .	you
When you filter a field , [MASK] can display the data for a single item , or you can select some items to display and other items to hide .	you
[MASK] can filter on more than one field at a time to further narrow the focus .	You
[MASK] can filter a field to display only data that matches the value in a selected cell .	You
[MASK] can also filter data by using filter fields .	You
When you select one or more items in the filter field , the [MASK] that 's displayed and calculated in the entire PivotTable view changes to reflect those items .	data
[MASK] can add new filter fields or move existing fields to the filter area .	You
If you move the line upward , the [MASK] between the moving line and the nearest parallel line below remains constant , and the perpendicular line above the moving line contracts .	distance
If you move the line downward , the [MASK] between the moving line and the nearest parallel line below remains constant , and the perpendicular line above the moving line lengthens .	distance
If you are moving the line away from the center of the grid , the nearest parallel [MASK] does n't move , and the distance between the line you are moving and the nearest parallel line grows larger .	line
If you are moving the line towards the center of the grid , the nearest parallel [MASK] does n't move , and the distance between the line you are moving and the nearest parallel line grows smaller .	line
When you copy an interior vertical line , the new [MASK] is halfway between the line you copied and the line to the right of the line you copied .	line
When you copy an interior horizontal line , the new [MASK] is halfway between the line you copied and the line below the line you copied .	line
After you paste the line , [MASK] do not need to recreate the group  the new line is automatically part of the group .	you
The aggregate [MASK] wo n't include records containing blank ( Null ) values in their calculations .	functions
For example , the Count [MASK] returns a count of all the records without Null values .	function
If some records in one of the fields you used in the expression might have a Null value , [MASK] can convert the Null value to zero using the Nz function as shown in the following example :	you
When you design a Web page using Microsoft Office Web Components , any [MASK] with a Microsoft Office 2002 license can interact with the components in the browser to the level of interactivity you provide .	user
That is , a [MASK] with an appropriate license can make changes to data in a spreadsheet , change formatting , drag fields in a chart or PivotTable List , and so on , as long as you did n't protect these options at design time .	user
[MASK] with an Office 2002 license can also create , design , and modify components in a design environment such as Microsoft FrontPage or Microsoft Access .	Users
[MASK] who do not have Office 2002 licenses can view the components and the data in them , and can print the view of the components , but they can not interact with the components or manipulate them in a design environment .	Users
[MASK] means that if you distribute a Web page that uses components , users who have Office 2002 licenses will have access to all functionality provided , but users without a license can only view the data and information you 've provided .	This
The Web page [MASK] must also provide an installation point for the components and a pointer to that location on the component installation page .	designer
Once the Office Web Components are installed , [MASK] who have access to an Office 2002 license will be able to interact with and make changes to the components .	users
[MASK] without licenses will be able to view and print the components and the data in them , but they can not interact with or make changes to them .	Users
[MASK] have full functionality and interactivity with components , including run-time and design-time capabilities .	Users
[MASK] can interact with the component in design mode in that application only ( not in the browser or in other applications ) .	Users
However , the Web page [MASK] must provide a location from which components can be downloaded , and must reference the site license in a license package file ( .lpk ) that is associated with one or more Web pages .	designer
[MASK] use the License Package Authoring Tool to create an appropriate license file for pages .	You
[MASK] can view and print the components in view-only mode , but they can not interact with the components or use the design capabilities .	Users
The two ANSI SQL query [MASK] , ANSI-89 and ANSI-92 , are not compatible .	modes
When you create a Microsoft Access database , [MASK] need to decide which query mode you are going to use , because mixing queries created in both query modes could produce runtime errors or unexpected results .	you
The [MASK] of data types , reserved words , and wildcard characters are different in each query mode .	range
A [MASK] that uses wildcard characters in a criteria expression can produce different results under each query mode .	query
For example , if [MASK] run :	you
[MASK] returns all customers from a (country|region) named " U % " , not all (countries|regions) beginning with the letter " U " , because the percent sign ( % ) is not a wildcard character in ANSI-89 SQL .	It
If a query uses an alias that is the same as a base column name and you create a calculated field using the ambiguous name , the [MASK] will produce different results under each query mode .	query
[MASK] could break your application and require rewriting your application .	This
In Access 2000 , [MASK] can only programmatically change the ANSI SQL query mode and any queries created under ANSI-92 mode were hidden in the Database window .	you
In Access 2002 , [MASK] or a user can change ANSI SQL query mode through the user interface and ANSI-92 queries are no longer hidden in the Database window , so you should prevent accidental or intentional changes to the ANSI SQL query mode of your application by protecting your code and preventing the changing of the query mode through the application 's user interface .	you
About how [MASK] searches for reference libraries	Access
The Visual Basic [MASK] of a Microsoft Access file contains references to object libraries , and it can also contain references to other files , including other Access files .	project
When you open an Access file , if Access does n't find a referenced file in the specified location , [MASK] searches for the reference as follows .	it
First , [MASK] searches for a RefLibPaths key in the following location in the Microsoft Windows Registry :	Access
If the key exists , [MASK] checks for the existence of a value name that matches the name of the referenced file .	Access
If it finds a matching value name , [MASK] loads the reference from the path specified in the corresponding value data .	Access
If Access does n't find a RefLibPaths key , [MASK] searches for the referenced file in the locations listed below in the following order :	it
If Access still ca n't find the reference after performing this search , [MASK] must fix the reference manually .	you
[MASK] can also save tables , views , stored procedures , functions , and forms in a Microsoft Access project as a data access page .	You
For example , if you have a sales report that you want to make available over the Web , instead of creating a data access page and customizing it to look like the sales report , [MASK] can save the report as a data access page .	you
If you want to make changes to the design of the resulting page , [MASK] can open the page in Design view and make any changes you want .	you
The default [MASK]  the view in which the object is open when you carry out the Save As command  determines the design of the data access page .	view
The following [MASK] lists the outcome of each view .	table
However , [MASK] can open the page in Design view and create additional group levels to make the page appear similar to the original object .	you
[MASK] on forms and reports need not have unique names , but names of controls on a page must be unique .	Controls
While creating the page , [MASK] will change control names that are not unique .	Access
However , [MASK] can open the page in Design view and change the property settings .	you
Much later , when he was able to think about the things that happened to him , [MASK] would conclude that nothing was real except chance .	he
But [MASK] was much later .	that
The [MASK] is the story itself , and whether or not it means something is not for the story to tell .	question
[MASK] know , for example , that he was thirty-five years old .	We
[MASK] know that he had once been married , had once been a father , and that both his wife and son were now dead .	We
[MASK] also know that he wrote books .	We
To be precise , [MASK] know that he wrote mystery novels .	we
Because he spent no more than five or six months on a novel , for the rest of the year [MASK] was free to do as he wished .	he
[MASK] read many books , he looked at paintings , he went to the movies .	He
In the summer [MASK] watched baseball on television ; in the winter he went to the opera .	he
Nearly every day , rain or shine , hot or cold , [MASK] would leave his apartment to walk through the city  never really going anywhere , but simply going wherever his legs happened to take him .	he
[MASK] York was an inexhaustible space , a labyrinth of endless steps , and no matter how far he walked , no matter how well he came to know its neighborhoods and streets , it always left him with the feeling of being lost .	New
Each time he took a walk , [MASK] felt as though he were leaving himself behind , and by giving himself up to the movement of the streets , by reducing himself to a seeing eye , he was able to escape the obligation to think , and this , more than anything else , brought him a measure of peace , a salutatory emptiness within .	he
The [MASK] was outside of him , around him , before him , and the speed with which it kept changing made it impossible for him to dwell on any one thing for very long .	world
[MASK] was of the essence , the act of putting one foot in front of the other and allowing himself to follow the drift of his own body .	Motion
By wandering aimlessly , all [MASK] became equal , and it no longer mattered where he was .	places
On his best walks , [MASK] was able to feel that he was nowhere .	he
[MASK] York was the nowhere he had built around himself , and he realized that he had no intention of ever leaving it again .	New
In the past , [MASK] had been more ambitious .	Quinn
As a young man , [MASK] had published several books of poetry , had written plays , critical essays , and had worked on a number of long translations .	he
But quite abruptly , [MASK] had given up all that .	he
A part of him had died , [MASK] told his friends , and he did not want it coming back to haunt him .	he
[MASK] was no longer that part of him that could write books , and although in many ways Quinn continued to exist , he no longer existed for anyone but himself .	Quinn
The next morning , [MASK] woke up earlier than he had in several weeks .	Quinn
Even that [MASK] , ' his appointment ' , seemed odd to him .	locution
[MASK] was n't his appointment , it was Paul Auster 's .	It
And who that person was [MASK] had no idea .	he
Nevertheless , as time wore on [MASK] found himself doing a good imitation of a man preparing to go out .	he
[MASK] cleared the table of the breakfast dishes , tossed the newspaper on the couch , went into the bathroom , showered , shaved , went on to the bedroom wrapped in two towels , opened the closet and picked out his clothes for the day .	He
[MASK] found himself tending toward a jacket and a tie .	He
[MASK] had not worn a tie since the funerals of his wife and son , and he could not even remember if he still owned one .	Quinn
But there [MASK] was , hanging amidst the debris of his wardrobe .	it
[MASK] dismissed a white shirt as too formal , however , and instead chose a gray and red check affair to go with the gray tie .	He
[MASK] put them on in a kind of trance .	He
I seem to be going out , [MASK] said to himself .	he
But if I am going out , where exactly am [MASK] going ?	I
An hour later , as he climbed from the number 4 bus at 70th Street and Fifth Avenue , [MASK] still had not answered the question .	he
[MASK] thought for a moment of Vermeer 's Soldier and Young Girl Smiling , trying to remember the expression on the girl 's face , the exact position of her hands around the cup , the red back of the faceless man .	He
In his mind , [MASK] caught a glimpse of the blue map on the wall and the sunlight pouring through the window , so like the sunlight that surrounded him now .	he
[MASK] was walking .	He
[MASK] was crossing the street and moving eastward .	He
At Madison Avenue [MASK] turned right and went south for a block , then turned left and saw where he was .	he
I seem to have arrived , [MASK] said to himself .	he
[MASK] stood before the building and paused .	He
[MASK] suddenly did not seem to matter anymore .	It
[MASK] felt remarkably calm , as if everything had already happened to him .	He
As he opened the door that would lead him into the lobby , [MASK] gave himself one last word of advice .	he
If all this is really happening , [MASK] said , then I must keep my eyes open .	he
For some reason , [MASK] had not expected this , and it threw him off track .	Quinn
Already , [MASK] were happening too fast .	things
Before he had a chance to absorb the woman 's presence , to describe her to himself and form his impressions , [MASK] was talking to him , forcing him to respond .	she
Therefore , even in those first moments , [MASK] had lost ground , was starting to fall behind himself .	he
Later , when he had time to reflect on these events , [MASK] would manage to piece together his encounter with the woman .	he
But [MASK] was the work of memory , and remembered things , he knew , had a tendency to subvert the things remembered .	that
As a consequence , [MASK] could never be sure of any of it .	he
The [MASK] was thirty , perhaps thirty-five ; average height at best ; hips a touch wide , or else voluptuous , depending on your point of view ; dark hair , dark eyes , and a look in those eyes that was at once self-contained and vaguely seductive .	woman
[MASK] wore a black dress and very red lipstick .	She
[MASK] 'm Virginia Stillman , the woman began .	I
[MASK] 's been waiting for you since eight o'clock .	He
[MASK] was exactly ten .	It
He 's been frantic , the [MASK] explained .	woman
[MASK] 've never seen him like this before .	I
[MASK] just could n't wait .	He
[MASK] opened the door for Quinn .	She
As he crossed the threshold and entered the apartment , [MASK] could feel himself going blank , as if his brain had suddenly shut off .	he
[MASK] had wanted to take in the details of what he was seeing , but the task was somehow beyond him at that moment .	He
The [MASK] loomed up around him as a kind of blur .	apartment
[MASK] realized that it was large , perhaps five or six rooms , and that it was richly furnished , with numerous art objects , silver ashtrays , and elaborately framed paintings on the walls .	He
But [MASK] was all .	that
[MASK] found himself sitting on a sofa , alone in the living room .	He
[MASK] remembered now that Mrs. Stillman had told him to wait there while she went to find her husband .	He
[MASK] could n't say how long it had been .	He
But from the way the light was coming through the windows , [MASK] seemed to be almost noon .	it
The [MASK] of Virginia Stillman 's perfume hovered around him , and he began to imagine what she looked like without any clothes on .	smell
Then [MASK] thought about what Max Work might have been thinking , had he been there .	he
[MASK] decided to light a cigarette .	He
[MASK] blew the smoke into the room .	He
[MASK] heard the sound of someone entering the room behind him .	He
[MASK] stood up from the sofa and turned around , expecting to see Mrs. Stillman .	Quinn
Instead , [MASK] was a young man , dressed entirely in white , with the white-blond hair of a child .	it
Uncannily , in that first moment , [MASK] thought of his own dead son .	Quinn
Then , just as suddenly as the thought had appeared , [MASK] vanished .	it
[MASK] Stillman walked into the room and sat down in a red velvet armchair opposite Quinn .	Peter
[MASK] said not a word as he made his way to his seat , nor did he acknowledge Quinn 's presence .	He
The [MASK] of moving from one place to another seemed to require all his attention , as though not to think of what he was doing would reduce him to immobility .	act
[MASK] had never seen anyone move in such a manner , and he realized at once that this was the same person he had spoken to on the phone .	Quinn
The [MASK] acted almost exactly as the voice had : machine-like , fitful , alternating between slow and rapid gestures , rigid and yet expressive , as if the operation were out of control , not quite corresponding to the will that lay behind it .	body
[MASK] seemed to Quinn that Stillman 's body had not been used for a long time and that all its functions had been relearned , so that motion had become a conscious process , each movement broken down into its component submovements , with the result that all flow and spontaneity had been lost .	It
[MASK] was like watching a marionette trying to walk without strings .	It
[MASK] about Peter Stillman was white .	Everything
Against the pallor of his skin , the flaxen thinness of his hair , the [MASK] was almost transparent , as though one could see through to the blue veins behind the skin of his face .	effect
This [MASK] was almost the same as his eyes : a milky blue that seemed to dissolve into a mixture of sky and clouds .	blue
[MASK] could not imagine himself addressing a word to this person .	Quinn
[MASK] settled slowly into his chair and at last turned his attention to Quinn .	Stillman
As their eyes met , [MASK] suddenly felt that Stillman had become invisible .	Quinn
[MASK] could see him sitting in the chair across from him , but at the same time it felt as though he was not there .	He
But no , [MASK] did not seem possible .	that
The [MASK] was looking at him , even studying him , and if recognition did not flicker across his face , it still held something more than a blank stare .	man
[MASK] did not know what to do .	Quinn
[MASK] sat there dumbly in his seat , looking back at Stillman .	He
A long [MASK] passed .	time
No questions , please , the young [MASK] said at last .	man
[MASK] paused for a moment .	He
[MASK] say this of my free will . Yes .	I
[MASK] is not my real name . No .	That
Of course , my [MASK] is not all it should be .	mind
[MASK] sit here and think : who is this person talking to me ?	You
[MASK] will tell you .	I
Or else [MASK] will not tell you .	I
At the corner of 72nd Street and Madison Avenue , [MASK] waved down a cab .	he
As the car rattled through the park toward the West Side , [MASK] looked out the window and wondered if these were the same trees that Peter Stillman saw when he walked out into the air and the light .	Quinn
[MASK] wondered if Peter saw the same things as he did , or whether the world was a different place for him .	He
And if a tree was not a tree , [MASK] wondered what it really was .	he
After the cab had dropped him off in front of his house , [MASK] realized that he was hungry .	Quinn
[MASK] had not eaten since breakfast early that morning .	He
It was strange , [MASK] thought , how quickly time had passed in the Stillman apartment .	he
If his calculations were correct , [MASK] had been there for more than fourteen hours .	he
Within himself , however , [MASK] felt as though his stay had lasted three or four hours at most .	it
[MASK] shrugged at the discrepancy and said to himself , I must learn to look at my watch more often .	He
[MASK] retraced his path along 107th Street , turned left on Broadway , and began walking uptown , looking for a suitable place to eat .	He
A [MASK] did not appeal to him tonight  eating in the dark , the press of boozy chatter  although normally he would have welcomed it .	bar
As he crossed 112th Street , [MASK] saw that the Heights Luncheonette was still open and decided to go in .	he
[MASK] was a brightly lit yet dreary place , with a large rack of girlie magazines on one wall , an area for stationery supplies , another area for newspapers , several tables for patrons , and a long Formica counter with swivel stools .	It
A tall Puerto Rican [MASK] in a white cardboard chef 's hat stood behind the counter .	man
[MASK] sat there impassively , reading the night-owl edition of the next morning 's Daily News .	He
[MASK] would arrive early , never later than seven o'clock and sit there with a take-out coffee , a buttered roll , and an open newspaper on his lap , watching the glass door of the hotel .	He
By eight o'clock [MASK] would come out , always in his long brown overcoat , carrying a large , old-fashioned carpet bag .	Stillman
For two weeks this [MASK] did not vary . The old man would wander through the streets of the neighborhood , advancing slowly , sometimes by the merest of increments , pausing , moving on again , pausing once more , as though each step had to be weighed and measured before it could take its place among the sum total of steps .	routine
[MASK] was hare in pursuit of the tortoise , and again and again he had to remind himself to hold back .	He
[MASK] could , of course , see with his own eyes what happened , and all these things he dutifully recorded in his red notebook . But the meaning of these things continued to elude him .	He
[MASK] never seemed to be going anywhere in particular , nor did he seem to know where he was .	Stillman
and yet , as if by conscious design , [MASK] kept to a narrowly circumscribed area , bounded on the north by Riverside Park , and on the east by Amsterdam Avenue .	he
No matter how haphazard his journeys seemed to be  and each day his itinerary was different  [MASK] never crossed these borders .	Stillman
Such [MASK] baffled Quinn , for in all other respects Stillman seemed to be aimless .	precision
As he walked , [MASK] did not look up .	Stillman
Indeed , every now and then [MASK] would stoop down , pick some object off the ground , and examine it closely , turning it over and over in his hand .	he
[MASK] made Quinn think of an archeologist inspecting a shard at some prehistoric ruin .	It
Occasionally , after poring over an object in this way , [MASK] would toss it back onto the sidewalk . But more often than not he would open his bag and lay the object gently inside it .	Stillman
Then , reaching into one of his coat pockets , [MASK] would remove a red notebook  similar to Quinn 's but smaller  and write in it with great concentration for a minute or two .	he
Having completed this operation , [MASK] would return the notebook to his pocket , pick up his bag , and continue on his way .	he
As far as Quinn could tell , the [MASK] Stillman collected were valueless .	objects
[MASK] seemed to be no more than broken things , discarded things , stray bits of junk .	They
Over the days that passed , [MASK] noted a collapsible umbrella shorn of its material , the severed head of a rubber doll , a black glove , the bottom of a shattered light bulb , several pieces of printed matter ( sogged magazines , shredded newspapers ) , a torn photograph , anonymous machinery parts , and sundry other clumps of flotsam he could not identify .	Quinn
The [MASK] that Stillman took this scavenging seriously intrigued Quinn , but he could do no more than observe , write down what he saw in the red notebook , hover stupidly on the surface of things .	fact
[MASK] suspected that Stillman 's red notebook contained answers to the questions that had been accumulating in his mind , and he began to plot various stratagems for stealing it from the old man .	Quinn
But the [MASK] had not yet come for such a step .	time
Other than picking up objects from the street , [MASK] seemed to do nothing .	Stillman
Every now and then [MASK] would stop somewhere for a meal .	he
Occasionally [MASK] would bump into someone and mumble an apology .	he
Once a [MASK] nearly ran him over as he was crossing the street .	car
[MASK] did not talk to anyone , did not go into any stores , did not smile .	Stillman
[MASK] seemed neither happy nor sad .	He
Twice , when his scavenging haul had been unusually large , [MASK] returned to the hotel in the middle of the day and remerged a few minutes later with an empty bag .	he
On most days [MASK] spent at least several hours in Riverside Park , walking methodically along the macadam footpaths or else thrashing through the bushes with a stick .	he
His [MASK] for objects did not abate amidst the greenery .	quest
Stones , leaves , and twigs [MASK] found their way into his bag .	all
Once , Quinn observed , [MASK] even stooped down for a dried dog turd , sniffed it carefully , and kept it .	he
In the afternoon , often following his lunch , [MASK] would sit on a bench and gaze out across the Hudson .	he
Once , on a particularly warm day , [MASK] saw him sprawled out on the grass asleep .	Quinn
When darkness came , [MASK] would eat dinner at the Apollo Coffee Shop on 97th Street and Broadway and then return to his hotel for the night .	Stillman
Not once did [MASK] try to contact his son .	he
The essential [MASK] was to stay involved .	thing
Little by little , [MASK] began to feel cut off from his original intentions , and he wondered now if he had not embarked on a meaningless project .	Quinn
But [MASK] would assume he was aware of being watched , and Quinn felt that was unlikely .	that
[MASK] had done his job well so far , keeping at a discreet distance from the old man , blending into the traffic of the street , neither calling attention to himself nor taking drastic measures to keep himself hidden .	He
On the other hand , [MASK] was possible that Stillman had known all along that he would be watched  had even known it in advance  and therefore had not taken the trouble to discover who the particular watcher was .	it
If being followed was a certainty , what did [MASK] matter ?	it
This [MASK] of the situation comforted Quinn , and he decided to believe in it , even though he had no grounds for belief .	view
Either [MASK] knew what he was doing or he did n't .	Stillman
and if he did n't , then [MASK] was going nowhere , was wasting his time .	Quinn
If this interpretation required knowledge on Stillman 's part , then [MASK] would accept this knowledge as an article of faith , at least for the time being .	Quinn
His [MASK] through the city had taught him to understand the connectedness of inner and outer .	excursions
Using aimless motion as a technique of reversal , on his best days [MASK] could bring the outside in and thus usurp the sovereignty of inwardness .	he
By flooding himself with externals , by drowning himself out of himself , [MASK] had managed to exert some small degree of control over his fits of despair .	he
[MASK] could wander , he could stagger like a blindman from one spot to another , but this was a privilege denied to Quinn .	Stillman
For [MASK] was obliged now to concentrate on what he was doing , even if it was next to nothing .	he
Time and again his [MASK] would begin to drift , and soon thereafter his steps would follow suit .	thoughts
[MASK] meant that he was constantly in danger of quickening his pace and crashing into Stillman from behind .	This
To guard against this mishap [MASK] devised several different methods of deceleration .	he
The [MASK] was to tell himself that he was no longer Daniel Quinn .	first
[MASK] was no more than a name to him , a husk without content .	Auster
To be [MASK] meant being a man with no interior , a man with no thoughts .	Auster
The old [MASK] had become part of the city .	man
[MASK] was a speck , a punctuation mark , a brick in an endless wall of bricks .	He
[MASK] could walk through the streets every day for the rest of his life , and still he would not find him .	Quinn
[MASK] backtracked in his mind to the beginning of the case .	Quinn
His [MASK] had been to protect Peter , not to follow Stillman .	job
[MASK] had simply been a method , a way of trying to predict what would happen .	That
By watching Stillman , the [MASK] was that he would learn what his intentions were toward Peter .	theory
[MASK] had followed the old man for two weeks .	He
What , then , could [MASK] conclude ?	he
Stillman 's [MASK] had been too obscure to give any hints .	behavior
[MASK] could suggest to Virginia Stillman that she get an unlisted telephone number .	He
[MASK] would eliminate the disturbing calls , at least temporarily .	That
If that failed , [MASK] and Peter could move .	she
[MASK] could leave the neighborhood , perhaps leave the city altogether .	They
At the very worst , [MASK] could take on new identities , live under different names .	they
This last [MASK] reminded him of something important .	thought
Until now , [MASK] realized , he had never seriously questioned the circumstances of his hiring .	he
[MASK] had happened too quickly , and he had taken it for granted that he could fill in for Paul Auster .	Things
Once he had taken the leap into that name , [MASK] had stopped thinking about Auster himself .	he
If this man was as good a detective as the Stillmans thought he was , perhaps [MASK] would be able to help with the case .	he
[MASK] would make a clean breast of it , Auster would forgive him , and together they would work to save Peter Stillman .	Quinn
[MASK] looked through the yellow pages for the Auster Detective Agency .	He
In the white pages , however , [MASK] found the name .	he
[MASK] picked up the phone and was about to dial when he thought better of it .	Quinn
[MASK] was too important a conversation to leave to the phone .	This
[MASK] did not want to run the risk of being brushed off .	He
Since Auster did not have an office , [MASK] meant he worked at home .	that
[MASK] would go there and talk to him face to face .	Quinn
The [MASK] had stopped now , and although the sky was still gray , far to the west Quinn could see a tiny shift of light seeping through the clouds .	rain
As he walked up Riverside Drive , [MASK] became aware of the fact that he was no longer following Stillman .	he
[MASK] felt as though he had lost half of himself .	It
Whatever Stillman had done , [MASK] had done ; wherever Stillman had gone , he had gone .	he
The [MASK] was over , and yet his body did not know it .	spell
Auster 's [MASK] was in the middle of the long block that ran between 116th and 119th Streets , just south of Riverside Church and Grant 's Tomb .	building
[MASK] was a well-kept place , with polished doorknobs and clean glass , and it had an air of bourgeois sobriety that appealed to Quinn at that moment .	It
Auster 's [MASK] was on the eleventh floor , and Quinn rang the buzzer , expecting to hear a voice speak to him through the intercom .	apartment
But the door [MASK] answered him without any conversation .	buzzer
[MASK] pushed the door open , walked through the lobby , and rode the elevator to the eleventh floor .	Quinn
[MASK] was a tall dark fellow in his mid-thirties , with rumpled clothes and a two-day beard .	He
In his right hand , fixed between his thumb and first two fingers , [MASK] held an uncapped fountain pen , still poised in a writing position .	he
The [MASK] seemed surprised to find a stranger standing before him .	man
Yes ? [MASK] asked tentatively .	he
[MASK] spoke in the politest tone he could muster . Were you expecting someone else ?	Quinn
That 's why [MASK] rang the buzzer without asking who it was .	I
[MASK] 'm sorry to disturb you , Quinn apologized . But I 'm looking for Paul Auster .	I
[MASK] wonder if I could talk to you . It 's quite important .	I
[MASK] 'll have to tell me what it 's about first .	You
[MASK] hardly know myself . Quinn gave Auster an honest look .	I
[MASK] 's complicated , I 'm afraid . Very complicated .	It
Do [MASK] have a name ?	you
[MASK] 'm sorry . Of course I do . Quinn .	I
The [MASK] seemed to suggest something to Auster , and he paused for a moment abstractedly , as if searching through his memory .	name
Quinn , [MASK] muttered to himself .	he
[MASK] know that name from somewhere . He went silent again , straining harder to dredge up the answer .	I
[MASK] are n't a poet , are you ?	You
[MASK] did a book several years ago , did n't you ?	You
[MASK] think the title was Unfinished Business .	I
Yes . [MASK] was me .	That
[MASK] liked it very much .	I
[MASK] kept hoping to see more of your work .	I
In fact , [MASK] even wondered what had happened to you .	I
[MASK] 'm still here . Sort of .	I
[MASK] opened the door wider and gestured for Quinn to enter the apartment .	Auster
[MASK] was a pleasant enough place inside ; oddly shaped , with several long corridors , books cluttered everywhere , pictures on the walls by artists Quinn did not know , and a few children 's toys scattered on the floor  a red truck , a brown bear , a green space monster .	It
[MASK] led him to the living room , gave him a frayed upholstered chair to sit in , and then went off to the kitchen to fetch some beer .	Auster
[MASK] returned with two bottles , placed them on a wooden crate that served as the coffee table , and sat down on the sofa across from Quinn .	He
Was it some kind of literary thing you wanted to talk about ? [MASK] began .	Auster
In the end , [MASK] are actually successful .	they
The [MASK] was just one of their ploys .	book
The [MASK] was to hold a mirror up to Don Quixote 's madness to record each of his absurd and ludicrous delusions , so that when he finally read the book himself , he would see the error of his ways .	idea
[MASK] like that .	I
[MASK] Quixote , in my view , was not really mad .	Don
[MASK] only pretended to be .	He
In fact , [MASK] orchestrated the whole thing himself .	he
Again and again [MASK] wonders how accurately his chronicler will record his adventures .	he
[MASK] implies knowledge on his part ; he knows beforehand that this chronicler exists .	This
And [MASK] else is it but Sancho Panza , the faithful squire whom Don Quixote has chosen for exactly this purpose ?	who
In the same way , [MASK] chose the three others to play the roles he destined for them .	he
And not only did [MASK] select the authors , it was probably he who translated the Arabic manuscript back into Spanish .	he
[MASK] should n't put it past him .	We
[MASK] like to imagine that scene in the marketplace at Toledo .	I
[MASK] hiring Don Quixote to decipher the story of Don Quixote himself .	Cervantes
[MASK] 's the most interesting part of all .	That
In my opinion , [MASK] Quixote was conducting an experiment .	Don
[MASK] wanted to test the gullibility of his fellow men .	He
Would [MASK] be possible to persuade others to agree with what he said , even though they did not believe him ?	it
In other words , to what extent would [MASK] tolerate blasphemies if they gave them amusement ?	people
The [MASK] is obvious , is n't it ?	answer
For the proof is that [MASK] still read the book .	we
[MASK] remains highly amusing to us .	It
And [MASK] 's finally all anyone wants out of a book  to be amused .	that
[MASK] leaned back on the sofa , smiled with a certain ironic pleaure , and lit a cigarette .	Auster
The [MASK] was obviously enjoying himself , but the precise nature of that pleasure eluded Quinn .	man
[MASK] seemed to be a kind of soundless laughter , a joke that stopped short of its punchline , a generalized mirth that had no object .	It
[MASK] was about to say something in response to Auster 's theory , but he was not given the chance .	Quinn
Auster 's [MASK] perked up at the sound .	face
[MASK] rose from his seat , excused himself to Quinn , and walked quickly towards the door .	He
[MASK] heard laughter in the hallway , first from a woman and then from a child  the high and the higher , a staccato of ringing shrapnel  and then the basso rumbling of Auster 's guffaw .	Quinn
The [MASK] spoke : Daddy , look what I found !	child
And then the [MASK] explained that it had been lying on the street , and why not , it seemed perfectly okay .	woman
A moment later [MASK] heard the child running towards him down the hall . The child shot into the living room , caught sight of Quinn , and stopped dead in his tracks .	he
[MASK] was a blond-haired boy of five or six .	He
The [MASK] , rapidly withdrawing into shyness , managed no more than a faint hello .	boy
In his left hand [MASK] held a red object that Quinn could not identify .	he
[MASK] asked the boy what it was .	Quinn
[MASK] 's a yoyo , he answered , opening his hand to show him .	It
[MASK] found it on the street .	I
Does [MASK] work ?	it
The [MASK] gave an exaggerated pantomine shrug .	boy
[MASK] ca n't do it . And I do n't know how .	Siri
[MASK] asked him if he could try , and the boy walked over and put it in his hand .	Quinn
As he examined the yoyo , [MASK] could hear the child breathing beside him , watching his every move .	he
The [MASK] was plastic , similar to the ones he had played with years ago , but more elaborate somehow , an artifact of the space age .	yoyo
[MASK] fastened the loop at the end of the string around his middle finger , stood up , and gave it a try .	Quinn
The [MASK] gave off a fluted , whistling sound as it descended , and sparks shot off inside it .	yoyo
The [MASK] gasped , but then the yoyo stopped , dangling at the end of the line .	boy
A great [MASK] once said , muttered Quinn , that the way up and the way down are one and the same .	philosopher
[MASK] only went down .	It
[MASK] have to keep trying .	You
[MASK] was rewinding the spool for another attempt when Auster and his wife entered the room .	Quinn
[MASK] looked up and saw the woman first .	He
In that one brief moment [MASK] knew that he was in trouble .	he
[MASK] was a tall , thin blonde , radiantly beautiful , with an energy and happiness that seemed to make everything around her invisible .	She
[MASK] was too much for Quinn .	It
[MASK] felt as though Auster were taunting him with the things he had lost , and he responded with envy and rage , a lacerating self-pity .	He
Yes , [MASK] too would have liked to have this wife and this child , to sit around all day spouting drivel about old books , to be surrounded by yoyos and ham omelettes and fountain pens .	he
[MASK] prayed to himself for deliverance .	He
[MASK] saw the yoyo in his hands and said , I see you 've already met .	Auster
Daniel , [MASK] said to the boy , this is Daniel .	he
The [MASK] burst out laughing and said , Everybody 's Daniel !	boy
[MASK] 'm you , and you 're me .	I
And [MASK] , said Auster , turning to the woman , is my wife , Siri .	this
The [MASK] smiled her smile , said she was glad to meet Quinn as though she meant it , and then extended her hand to him .	wife
[MASK] shook it , feeling the uncanny slenderness of her bones , and asked if her name was Norwegian .	He
Not many people know that , [MASK] said .	she
Do [MASK] come from Norway ?	you
Indirectly , [MASK] said . By way of Northfield , Minnesota .	she
And then [MASK] laughed her laugh , and Quinn felt a little more of himself collapse .	she
[MASK] was nowhere now .	Quinn
[MASK] had nothing , he knew nothing , he knew that he knew nothing .	He
His [MASK] read nearly six .	watch
[MASK] walked home the way he had come , lengthening his strides with each new block .	Quinn
By the time he came to his street , [MASK] was running .	he
It 's June second , [MASK] told himself .	he
If all goes well , the following [MASK] will be the fourth .	day
But [MASK] is certain .	nothing
The [MASK] had long since passed for his call to Virginia Stillman , and he debated whether to go through with it .	hour
Could [MASK] abandon everything now , just like that ?	he
Yes , [MASK] said to himself , it was possible .	he
[MASK] could forget about the case , get back to his routine , write another book .	He
[MASK] could take a trip if he liked , even leave the country for a while .	He
[MASK] could go to Paris , for example .	He
Yes , [MASK] was possible .	that
But [MASK] would do , he thought , anywhere at all .	anywhere
[MASK] sat down in his living room and looked at the walls .	He
They had once been white , [MASK] remembered , but now they had turned a curious shade of yellow .	he
Perhaps one day [MASK] would drift further into dinginess , lasping into gray , or even brown , like some pieces of aging fruit .	they
A white wall becomes a yellow wall becomes a gray wall , [MASK] said to himself .	he
The [MASK] becomes exhausted , the city encroaches with its soot , the plaster crumbles within .	paint
[MASK] smoked a cigarette , and then another , and then another .	He
[MASK] looked at his hands , saw that they were dirty , and got up to wash them .	He
In the bathroom , with the water running in the sink , [MASK] decided to shave as well .	he
[MASK] lathered his face , took out a clean blade , and started scraping off his beard .	He
For some reason , [MASK] found it unpleasant to look in the mirror and kept trying to avoid himself with his eyes .	he
You 're getting old , [MASK] said to himself , you 're turning into an old fart .	he
Then [MASK] went into the kitchen , ate a bowl of cornflakes , and smoked another cigarette .	he
[MASK] was seven o'clock now .	It
Once again , [MASK] debated whether to call Virginia Stillman .	he
[MASK] saw the argument for making the call , and at the same time he saw the argument for not making it .	He
After that , [MASK] would be perfectly acceptable .	it
As long as you tell people what you are going to do , he reasoned , [MASK] does n't matter .	it
Then [MASK] are free to do what you want .	you
The [MASK] , however , was busy .	number
[MASK] waited five minutes and dialed again .	He
Again , the [MASK] was busy .	number
For the next hour [MASK] alternated between dialing and waiting , always with the same result .	Quinn
At last [MASK] called the operator and asked whether the phone was out of order .	he
[MASK] tried to imagine what the operators looked like .	Quinn
Then the first [MASK] spoke again : the number was busy .	woman
[MASK] did not know what to think .	Quinn
[MASK] turned on the television and watched the first two innings of the Mets game .	He
Then [MASK] dialed once again .	he
In the top of the third [MASK] Louis scored on a walk , a stolen base , an infield out , and a sacrifice fly .	St.
The [MASK] matched that run in their half of the inning on a double by Wilson and a single by Youngblood .	Mets
[MASK] realized that he did n't care .	Quinn
A beer [MASK] came on , and he turned off the sound .	commercial
For the twentieth time the same [MASK] happened .	thing
In the top of the fourth [MASK] Louis scored five runs , and Quinn turned off the picture as well .	St.
[MASK] found his red notebook , sat down at his desk , and wrote steadily for the next two hours .	He
[MASK] did not bother to read over what he had written .	He
Then [MASK] called Virginia Stillman and got another busy signal .	he
[MASK] slammed the receiver down so hard that the plastic cracked .	He

Then [MASK] went to bed .	he
In his dream , which he later forgot , [MASK] found himself walking down Broadway , holding Auster 's son by the hand .	he
Security [MASK] are strict on flights to Israel , the bags are searched , the men are frisked , and the women have an electronic hoop passed over them , fore-and-aft .	measures
[MASK] one is very patient .	No
[MASK] in the queue is poor because of the many Hasidim with their broad hats and beards and sidelocks and dangling fringes who have descended on Heathrow and are far too restless to wait in line but rush in and out , gesticulating , exclaiming .	Visibility
The [MASK] are jumping with them .	corridors
Some two hundred [MASK] are flying to Israel to attend the circumcision of the firstborn son of their spiritual leader , the Belzer Rabbi .	Hasidim
At the age of six , [MASK] myself wore a tallith katan , or scapular , under my shirt , only mine was a scrap of green calico print , whereas theirs are white linen .	I
[MASK] instructed Moses to speak to the children of Israel and to " bid them that they make them fringes in the borders of their garments . "	God
So [MASK] are still wearing them some four thousand years later .	they
[MASK] find our seats , two in a row of three , toward the rear of the aircraft .	We
" Do you speak Yiddish ? " [MASK] says .	he
" [MASK] can not be next to your wife .	I
Be so good , " [MASK] says .	he
[MASK] take the middle seat , which I dislike , but I am not really put out .	I
Our [MASK] is in his late twenties .	Hasid
[MASK] is pimply , his neck is thin , his blue eyes goggle , his underlip extrudes .	He
[MASK] does not keep a civilized face .	He
[MASK] and impulses other than civilized fill it by no means inferior impulses and thoughts .	Thoughts
And though he is not permitted to sit beside women unrelated to him or to look at them or to communicate with them in any manner ( all of which probably saves him a great deal of trouble ) , [MASK] seems a good-hearted young man and he is visibly enjoying himself .	he
All the [MASK] are vividly enjoying themselves , dodging through the aisles , visiting chattering standing impatiently in the long lavatory lines , amiable , busy as geese .	Hasidim

Le [MASK] gloated over this reversal .	Monde
[MASK] and South Africans , said Le Monde , were toasting the Israelis in champagne .	Rhodesians
But European [MASK] of the raid would endanger the plans of France for a new international order .	approval
On July 4-5 , again before the rescue , Le [MASK] had reported without comment wisecracks made by Amin in a speech at Port Louis .	Monde
Addressing the OAS , [MASK] had provoked laughter and applause among the delegates by saying that the hostages were as comfortable as they could be in the circumstances surrounded by explosives .	Amin
[MASK] broke everybody up .	This
[MASK] step into the street and my friend David Shahar , whose chest is large , takes a deep breath and advises me to do the same .	We
The [MASK] , the very air , is thought-nourishing in Jerusalem , the Sages themselves said so .	air
[MASK] know that it must have special properties .	I
The [MASK] of the light also affects me .	delicacy
[MASK] look downward toward the Dead Sea , over broken rocks and small houses with bulbous roofs .	I
The [MASK] of these is that of the ground itself , and on this strange deadness the melting air presses with an almost human weight .	color
The [MASK] interprets itself before your eyes in the openness of the rockjumbled valley ending in dead water .	universe
Elsewhere [MASK] die and disintegrate .	you
Here [MASK] die and mingle .	you

[MASK] find in Elie Kedourie 's Arabic Political Memoirs facts unknown to most about American diplomacy in the late forties .	I
Certainly [MASK] did n't know them .	I
In the Middle East and probably elsewhere , the [MASK] States relied heavily on management consultants and public-relations experts .	United
The American [MASK] of Booz , Allen &amp; Hamilton lent one of its specialists , Miles Copeland by name , to the State Department , where he was in 1955 a member of a group called the Middle East Policy Planning Committee , the main purpose of which was , in his own words , " to work out ways of taking advantage of the friendship which was developing between ourselves and Nasser . "	firm
Spreading democracy over the world , the [MASK] first fought rigged elections in Syria , but the old corruption continued despite all their power and money could do .	Americans
Frustrated , the [MASK] decided for the best of reasons , as always , to make a heavier move :	Americans
" The American [MASK] at Damascus decided to encourage a military coup-d'etat , so that Syria might enjoy democracy , " Kedourie writes .	Minister
[MASK] knows the Middle East will agree that such a quest was the political equivalent of the search for the philosophical stone . "	Whoever
Failing in Syria , the [MASK] went to work in Egypt .	Americans
[MASK] Roosevelt of the CIA " met a number of officers who were involved in the conspiracy which led to the coup-d'etat of 22 July , 1952 . "	Kermit

[MASK] believed that genuine democracy was now on its way .	They

[MASK] occasionally wonder whether that is why the world is so uncomfortable with them .	I

[MASK] say this remembering that Jacques Maritain once characterized European anti-Semitism of the twentieth century as an attempt to get rid of the moral burden of Christianity .	I

My friend [MASK] Auerbach comes up from Caesarea to see me .	John
A kibbutznik seaman , [MASK] has just returned from a voyage .	he

On the contrary , [MASK] find it much easier now at sixty to draw near to people .	I
[MASK] looks too much the writer slight in person , delicate to be a chief engineer .	John
[MASK] does , however , hold an engineer 's ticket and can do complicated emergency repairs in mid-ocean .	He
Boyish , bearded ( the beard is short and copper-brown ) , nervous , a bit high , thinner than when I saw him last , [MASK] carries a cardboard valise containing books and booze and pyjamas and a house present .	he
[MASK] is delighted to be here , and he is suffering the one activates the other .	He
[MASK] is grieving for his son .	He

At sixteen [MASK] escaped from the Warsaw ghetto , leaving behind his parents and his sister .	John
[MASK] somehow obtained Polish seaman 's papers , and for several years he worked in the engine rooms of German freighters .	John
When the war ended [MASK] came to Israel via Cyprus , joined Kibbutz Sdot Yam , married , and had two children .	he
His first [MASK] died of cancer about ten years ago and he has married again .	wife
[MASK] says , " I ask myself in what ways my life has not been typical .	He
For a Jew from Eastern Europe [MASK] has been completely typical war , death of mother , death of father , death of sister , four years in disguise among the Germans , death of wife , death of son .	it

Before I left Chicago , the art critic [MASK] Rosenberg said to me , " Going to Jerusalem ?	Harold
[MASK] 've got to be kidding , they 'll talk your head off . "	You
[MASK] spoke as a Jew to a Jew about Jewish powers of speech .	He
Here in Jerusalem , when you shut your apartment door behind you [MASK] fall into a gale of conversation exposition , argument , harangue , analysis , theory , expostulation , threat , and prophecy .	you
From diplomats [MASK] hear cagey explanations ;	you
[MASK] listen carefully , closely , more closely than I 've ever listened in my life , utterly attentive , but I often feel that I have dropped into a shoreless sea .	I
The [MASK] of all this talk is , ultimately , survival the survival of the decent society created in Israel within a few decades .	subject
At first [MASK] is hard to grasp because the setting is so civilized .	this
[MASK] are in a city like many another well , not quite , for Jerusalem is the only ancient city I 've ever seen whose antiquities are not on display as relics but are in daily use .	You
Still , the [MASK] is a modern city with modern utilities .	city
[MASK] shop in supermarkets , you say good morning to friends on the telephone , you hear symphony orchestras on the radio .	You
But suddenly the [MASK] stops and a terrorist bomb is reported .	music
Uneasy , [MASK] go out to your civilized dinner .	you
[MASK] are exploding everywhere .	Bombs
Yet here [MASK] sit at dinner with charming people in a dining room like any other .	you
[MASK] know that your hostess has lost a son ; that her sister lost children in the 1973 war ;	You
That in this Jerusalem street , coolly sweet with night flowers and dark green under the lamps , many other [MASK] have lost children .	families
And on the Jaffa Road , because of another bomb , six [MASK] two on a break from night school stopping at a coffee shop to eat buns , have just died .	adolescents
But in the domestic ceremony of passed dishes and filled glasses [MASK] of a destructive enemy are hard to grasp .	thoughts
[MASK] can ; you can not .	Others
[MASK] is not to say that everyone else is living pleasantly and well under a decent regime .	This
No , [MASK] means only that the Jews , because they are Jews , have never been able to take the right to live as a natural right .	it
To be sure , many [MASK] refuse to admit that this historic uneasiness has not been eliminated .	Israelis
[MASK] seem to think of themselves as a fixed power , immovable .	They
The [MASK] , a cruising yawl , swung to her anchor without a flutter of the sails , and was at rest .	Nellie
The [MASK] had made , the wind was nearly calm , and being bound down the river , the only thing for it was to come to and wait for the turn of the tide .	flood
The [MASK] of the Thames stretched before us like the beginning of an interminable waterway .	sea-reach
A [MASK] rested on the low shores that ran out to sea in vanishing flatness .	haze
The [MASK] was dark above Gravesend , and farther back still seemed condensed into a mournful gloom , brooding motionless over the biggest , and the greatest , town on earth .	air
The [MASK] of Companies was our captain and our host .	Director
[MASK] four affectionately watched his back as he stood in the bows looking to seaward .	We
[MASK] resembled a pilot , which to a seaman is trustworthiness personified .	He
Besides holding our hearts together through long periods of separation , [MASK] had the effect of making us tolerant of each other 's yarns  and even convictions .	it
The [MASK]  the best of old fellows  had , because of his many years and many virtues , the only cushion on deck , and was lying on the only rug .	Lawyer
The [MASK] had brought out already a box of dominoes , and was toying architecturally with the bones .	Accountant
