Ever any madness in your family ? ' [MASK] asked , in a matter-of-fact tone .	he
[MASK] felt very annoyed .	I
Are you an alienist ? [MASK] interrupted .	I

The mere wealth [MASK] leave to others .	I

[MASK] found her triumphant .	I
[MASK] had a cup of tea  the last decent cup of tea for many days  and in a room that most soothingly looked just as you would expect a lady 's drawing-room to look , we had a long quiet chat by the fireside .	I
and [MASK] was going to take charge of a two-penny-halfpenny river-steamboat with a penny whistle attached !	I
There had been a [MASK] of such rot let loose in print and talk just about that time , and the excellent woman , living right in the rush of all that humbug , got carried off her feet .	lot

Another [MASK] on the cliff went off , followed by a slight shudder of the soil under my feet .	mine
The [MASK] was going on .	work
And [MASK] was the place where some of the helpers had withdrawn to die .	this
[MASK] were dying slowly  it was very clear .	They
[MASK] were not enemies , they were not criminals , they were nothing earthly now ,  nothing but black shadows of disease and starvation , lying confusedly in the greenish gloom .	They
Brought from all the recesses of the coast in all the legality of time contracts , lost in uncongenial surroundings , fed on unfamiliar food , [MASK] sickened , became inefficient , and were then allowed to crawl away and rest .	they
These moribund [MASK] were free as air  and nearly as thin .	shapes
[MASK] began to distinguish the gleam of eyes under the trees .	I
Then , glancing down , [MASK] saw a face near my hand .	I
The black [MASK] reclined at full length with one shoulder against the tree , and slowly the eyelids rose and the sunken eyes looked up at me , enormous and vacant , a kind of blind , white flicker in the depths of the orbs , which died out slowly .	bones
The [MASK] seemed young  almost a boy  but you know with them it 's hard to tell .	man
[MASK] found nothing else to do but to offer him one of my good Swede 's ship 's biscuits I had in my pocket .	I
The [MASK] closed slowly on it and held  there was no other movement and no other glance .	fingers
[MASK] had tied a bit of white worsted round his neck  Why ?	He
Where did [MASK] get it ?	he

[MASK] looked startling round his black neck , this bit of white thread from beyond the seas .	It
Near the same tree two more [MASK] of acute angles sat with their legs drawn up .	bundles
While I stood horror-struck , [MASK] of these creatures rose to his hands and knees , and went off on all-fours towards the river to drink .	one
[MASK] lapped out of his hand , then sat up in the sunlight , crossing his shins in front of him , and after a time let his woolly head fall on his breastbone .	He
[MASK] did n't want any more loitering in the shade , and I made haste towards the station .	I
When near the buildings [MASK] met a white man , in such an unexpected elegance of get-up that in the first moment I took him for a sort of vision .	I
[MASK] saw a high starched collar , white cuffs , a light alpaca jacket , snowy trousers , a clear necktie , and varnished boots . No hat .	I
[MASK] was amazing , and had a penholder behind his ear .	He
[MASK] shook hands with this miracle , and I learned he was the Company 's chief accountant , and that all the bookkeeping was done at this station .	I
[MASK] had come out for a moment , he said , ' to get a breath of fresh air . '	He
The [MASK] sounded wonderfully odd , with its suggestion of sedentary desk-life .	expression
[MASK] would n't have mentioned the fellow to you at all , only it was from his lips that I first heard the name of the man who is so indissolubly connected with the memories of that time .	I
Moreover , [MASK] respected the fellow .	I
Yes ; [MASK] respected his collars , his vast cuffs , his brushed hair .	I
His [MASK] was certainly that of a hairdresser 's dummy ; but in the great demoralization of the land he kept up his appearance .	appearance
[MASK] 's backbone .	That
His starched [MASK] and got-up shirt-fronts were achievements of character .	collars
[MASK] had been out nearly three years ; and , later on , I could not help asking him how he managed to sport such linen .	He
[MASK] had just the faintest blush , and said modestly , I 've been teaching one of the native women about the station .	He
[MASK] was difficult . She had a distaste for the work .	It
This [MASK] had verily accomplished something .	man
[MASK] else in the station was in a muddle ,  heads , things , buildings .	Everything
[MASK] of dusty niggers with splay feet arrived and departed ; a stream of manufactured goods , rubbishy cottons , beads , and brass-wire set into the depths of darkness , and in return came a precious trickle of ivory .	Strings
[MASK] had to wait in the station for ten days  an eternity .	I
[MASK] lived in a hut in the yard , but to be out of the chaos I would sometimes get into the accountant 's office .	I
[MASK] was hot there too ; big flies buzzed fiendishly , and did not sting , but stabbed .	It
[MASK] sat generally on the floor , while , of faultless appearance ( and even slightly scented ) , perching on a high stool , he wrote , he wrote .	I
Sometimes [MASK] stood up for exercise .	he
When a truckle-bed with a sick man ( some invalided agent from up-country ) was put in there , [MASK] exhibited a gentle annoyance .	he
The groans of this sick person , [MASK] said , distract my attention .	he
And without that [MASK] is extremely difficult to guard against clerical errors in this climate .	it
One day [MASK] remarked , without lifting his head , ' In the interior you will no doubt meet Mr. Kurtz . '	he
On my asking who Mr. Kurtz was , [MASK] said he was a first-class agent ; and seeing my disappointment at this information , he added slowly , laying down his pen , ' He is a very remarkable person . '	he

The stale cool [MASK] of the room had heated ; yet weariness receded , his head was left high and dry of it .	air
A [MASK] separated , wound nearer , there was the starting up of a hiss ( a hose , he thought ) and he made out a word : not just as a particular combination of articulated sounds , but a meaning :	voice
[MASK] got up and went over to the main house for a bath .	He
The [MASK] in the garden was burning , dazzling , seizing .	sun
In the bathroom [MASK] were buzzing themselves to death against the windowpanes .	flies
[MASK] was a bachelor and his house was the particular mixture of tranquil luxury and unchangeable dreariness that is a condition of households where white men live indulged in the sole charge of black male servants .	Roly
The [MASK] of the lavatory drizzled into the pan constantly and could n't be flushed properly , and the towels were stiff as a dress-shirt ( Olivia had taken years to get people to learn to rinse the soap out of the washing ) , but an old fellow in a cook 's hat put tea under the trees for him and carried off his crumpled suit to be pressed without being asked .	cistern
A [MASK] was cutting the tough grass with a length of iron bent at the end .	youth
Coarse and florid [MASK] , hibiscus with its big flowers sluttish with pollen and ants and poinsettia oozing milky secretion , bloomed giving a show of fecundity to the red , poor soil running baked bald under the grass , beaten slimy by the rains under the trees , and friable only where ants had digested it and made little crusty tunnels .	shrubs
A rich [MASK] of dead animal rose self-dispersed , like a gas , every now and then as he drank his tea , and he got up and looked around , as he had done so many times before , and with as little success , to see if a rat or mole were rotting somewhere .	stink
[MASK] it was could never be found ; it was the smell of growth , they had long ago decided , at Gala , the process of decay and regeneration so accelerated , brought so close together that it produced the reek of death-and-life , all at once .	Whatever
[MASK] strolled to the limits of the garden and climbed through the barbed-wire fence , but the grasses and thornbush on the other side ( Dando 's place was eight miles out of town ) were too entangled for walking where there was no path .	He
[MASK] listened to the bush and had the old feeling , in the bush , of being listened for .	He
[MASK] walked a hundred yards or so up the road , and , meeting a man on a bicycle , greeted him in the language that had come back to him as he lay in the room .	He
At six [MASK] Dando came home .	Roland
[MASK] gazed anxiously from the car as if , despite the telephone call , he were not sure if Bray had been safely received , but once he set eyes on him behaved as if they had seen each other a week ago .	He
[MASK] was indiscreet , like many people who live alone , and brought back with him from the town  a child bulging with favours from a party  all the anecdotes and gossip of the Independence celebrations , producing , in a clinging fluff of supposition and rumour , bits and pieces of real information and opinion about Mweta 's position and the sort of team he had gathered around him .	He

[MASK] was gleeful .	Dando
Sir [MASK] Harvey was president of the consortium of the three mining concessionaire companies , and it was common knowledge that , as a personal friend of Redvers Ledley , the most unpopular governor the territory had ever had , he had influenced the governor to outlaw the miners ' union at a time when Mweta and Shinza were using it to promote the independence movement .	Reginald
The People 's Independence [MASK] , at the time , had taken Harvey 's remark as an insulting reference to Mweta 's hair ; he still had it all , and it certainly would be in evidence on Tuesday .	Party
[MASK] repeated what had been said to him at the airport that morning  that some of the white people still living in the capital would be more at home down South , in Rhodesia or South Africa .	Bray

The [MASK] was there in their conversation like a photograph come upon lying between the pages of a book ; Bray was not sure whether she was child or woman : thin collar-bones , a long neck with a face hardly wider , pale and sallow , a big , thin , unpainted mouth , black hair and glittering , sorrowful black eyes .	girl

Personal [MASK] of discrimination and bias have been the focus of much social science research . [ 1 - 3 ]	experiences
[MASK] have explored the adverse consequences of discrimination [ 3  5 ] ;	Sociologists
[MASK] have examined the mental processes that underpin conscious and unconscious biases [ 6 ] ;	psychologists
[MASK] have examined the neurobiological underpinnings of discrimination [ 7  9 ] ;	neuroscientists
and evolutionary [MASK] have explored the various ways that in - group / out - group biases emerged across the history of our species . [ 10 ]	theorists
In many respects , [MASK] already possess a wealth of knowledge concerning the origins and consequences of discrimination and bias . [ 11 ]	researchers
[MASK] also should not be lost in discussion of discrimination is the growing push to implement social policy aimed at reducing the occurrence of discriminatory practices .	What
Even so , [MASK] of the prevalence of perceived discrimination remains rare ( see [ 13  14 ] ) .	estimates
At least one prior [MASK] by Kessler and colleagues [ 15 ] , however , using measures of perceived discrimination in a large American sample , reported that approximately 33 % of respondents reported some form of discrimination ( see also , Gibbons et al. [ 4 ] ) .	study
The current [MASK] seeks to build on this research by estimating the prevalence of discrimination experiences among a large , nationally representative sample of adults from the United States .	study
Additionally , the [MASK] address the perceived reasons for reported discrimination experiences .	analysis
 What do [MASK] think was the main reason for these experiences ? 	you
Additionally , because this question was only asked of respondents who reported prior discrimination experiences , the built - in skip [MASK] resulted in a large number of cases scored as missing ( legitimate skip ) .	pattern
Because a race variable is not available from the Wave 4 interviews , [MASK] use the racial category reported by the respondent during the Wave 1 interview .	we
The logic is that ( nearly ) all Wave 4 [MASK] appeared in the Wave 1 sample , but not all would have been interviewed at Wave 3 due to differential patterns of temporary attrition .	respondents
First , [MASK] is a continuous measure created by subtracting the year of the respondents ' birth ( obtained from Wave 1 ) from the year of the interview at Wave 4 .	age
Our exploratory [MASK] included three basic steps .	study
Second , [MASK] examined the relative proportions of the two discrimination experience measures across each racial category .	we
Finally , [MASK] assessed the distribution of reported reasons for discrimination across the racial categories .	we
The p - [MASK] associated with the design - based F is thus more accurate ( than the associated with the 2 statistic ) given the adjustments and calculations take into account the weighted nature of the data .	value
This final [MASK] also included an examination of the relative distribution of racial categories across the various reported reasons for discrimination .	step
This [MASK] briefly presents the Gjjolaay Eegimaa ( Eegimaa for short ; Ethnologue code : ISO 639-3 : bqj ) , its speakers and its varieties .	section
[MASK] also discuss aspects of the contact situation of the Eegimaa language .	We
[MASK] is important , because as we will show in  6 below , some of the Eegimaa death prevention names and child - bearing names are given to Eegimaa people from other communities .	This
[MASK] is a Jola language spoken in the Basse Casamance area of Southern Senegal by a population estimated to be between 7,000 ( Bassne , 2007 ) and 11,200 speakers ( Lewis , Simons , & Fennig , 2014 ) .	Eegimaa
The [MASK] in Figure 1 , taken from Ethnologue , presents the languages of Senegal .	map
The [MASK] on the map points to the Eegimaa speaking area ( Bandial is the name used by Ethnologue for Eegimaa ) .	arrow
[MASK] is a peninsula bordered by the Casamance River to the north , which separates it from the Jola Bluf and Jola Fogny areas , and to the east by the villages Brin and Djibonker , where the speakers of Kujireray and Banounk Gubeher live .	Mof-vvi
In the south , the [MASK] known as Kamobeul Bolon separates Mof-vvi from the Bayot speaking area , while the west side of Mof-vvi coincides with the homeland of the Jola Kaasa Hluf and Jola Kaasa suulaalu .	river
The [MASK] in Figure 2 below , adapted from Palmeri and Gazio ( 1995 ) , shows a very approximate location of Mof-vvi in relation to other neighbouring speech communities .	map
For example , the [MASK] Kusiilay 1  the language of Essil  , is the name given by speakers of Kujireray to the Eegimaa language , because Essil , of which Bajjat was a district , is the village which has a border with their village .	name
[MASK] is the name given by Bayot speakers , but its meaning is not known .	Endungo
[MASK] ,  the language of village of Seleki / Sllagi  , is the name given by Jola Kaasa speakers who are more familiar with the village of Seleki / Sllagi  than all other villages of Mof-vvi .	Klaakiay
Finally , [MASK] / Bandial  the language of the village of Banjal  , the most popular of all those names , is the name given by the Jola Bluf and Jola Fogny speakers to Eegimaa people and their language , because people from the village of Banjal were the first to be in contact with them .	Banjal
Jola language [MASK] which are closely related to Eegimaa include Kujireray / Kuluunaay ( from the village of Brin with 76 % lexical similarity ) and Gufiamay ( from the village of Afiniam with 74 % lexical similarity ( based on Lewis et al. , 2014 eds. ) ) .	varieties
[MASK] ( from the village of Butam ) , Gulapaoray ( from the village Djilapaor ) and Gusiilay ( ISO 639-3 : bsl ) from the village of Thionk Essil are also other languages related to Eegimaa .	Gtaamay
Nowadays most Eegimaa [MASK] from Mof-vvi live outside their homeland , generally in urban areas like Ziguinchor and Dakar .	speakers
[MASK] of Eegimaa use the term Gjjolaay ( meaning Jola ) to refer to their language when they speak to each other , but Eegimaa to distinguish their Jola variety from that of other Jola peoples .	Speakers
[MASK] is an endangered language whose transmission to new generations has been declining significantly in the last decades .	Eegimaa
[MASK] Leopold Dvok ( / d()vrk , -k / d()-VOR-zha(h)k ; Czech : [ antoin lopolt dvorak ] ; 8 September 1841  1 May 1904 ) was a Czech composer .	Antonn
After Bedich Smetana , [MASK] was the next Czech Romantic - era composer to achieve worldwide recognition .	he
Following Smetana 's nationalist example , [MASK] frequently employed aspects , specifically rhythms , of the folk music of Moravia and his native Bohemia .	Dvok
[MASK] displayed his musical gifts at an early age , being an apt violin student from age six .	Dvok
The first public [MASK] of his works were in Prague in 1872 and , with special success , in 1873 , when he was aged 31 .	performances
Seeking recognition beyond the Prague area , [MASK] submitted a score of his First Symphony to a prize competition in Germany , but did not win , and the unreturned manuscript was lost until rediscovered many decades later .	he
In 1874 [MASK] made a submission to the Austrian State Prize for Composition , including scores of two further symphonies and other works .	he
Although Dvok was not aware of it , [MASK] Brahms was the leading member of the jury and was highly impressed .	Johannes
[MASK] recommended Dvok to his publisher , Simrock , who soon afterward commissioned what became the Slavonic Dances , Op. 46 .	Brahms
In his career , [MASK] made nine invited visits to England , often conducting performances of his own works .	Dvok
Visiting Russia in March 1890 , [MASK] conducted concerts of his own music in Moscow and Saint Petersburg . [ 3 ]	he
In 1890  91 , [MASK] wrote his Dumky Trio , one of his most successful chamber music pieces .	he
In 1892 , [MASK] moved to the United States and became the director of the National Conservatory of Music of America in New York City .	Dvok
While in the United States , [MASK] wrote his two most successful orchestral works : the Symphony From the New World , which spread his reputation worldwide , [ 4 ] and his Cello Concerto , one of the most highly regarded of all cello concerti .	Dvok
[MASK] also wrote his most appreciated piece of chamber music , the American String Quartet , during this time .	He
But [MASK] in payment of his salary , along with increasing recognition in Europe and an onset of homesickness , led him to leave the United States and return to Bohemia in 1895 .	shortfalls
[MASK] of Dvok 's nine operas but his first have librettos in Czech and were intended to convey Czech national spirit , as were some of his choral works .	All
By far the most [MASK] of the operas is Rusalka .	successful
[MASK] Otto Harry Jespersen or Otto Jespersen ( Danish : [ to jsbsn ] ; 16 July 1860  30 April 1943 ) was a Danish linguist who specialized in the grammar of the English language .	Jens
[MASK] entered the University of Copenhagen in 1877 when he was 17 , initially studying law but not forgetting his language studies .	He
In 1881 [MASK] shifted his focus completely to languages , and in 1887 earned his master 's degree in French , with English and Latin as his secondary languages .	he
[MASK] supported himself during his studies through part - time work as a schoolteacher and as a shorthand reporter in the Danish parliament .	He
In 1887  1888 , [MASK] traveled to England , Germany and France , meeting linguists like Henry Sweet and Paul Passy and attending lectures at institutions like Oxford University .	he
Following the advice of his mentor Vilhelm Thomsen , [MASK] returned to Copenhagen in August 1888 and began work on his doctoral dissertation on the English case system .	he
[MASK] successfully defended his dissertation in 1891 .	He
[MASK] was a professor of English at the University of Copenhagen from 1893 to 1925 , and served as Rector of the university in 1920  21 .	Jespersen
His early [MASK] focused primarily on language teaching reform and on phonetics , but he is best known for his later work on syntax and on language development .	work
[MASK] advanced the theories of Rank and Nexus in Danish in two papers : Sprogets logik ( 1913 ) and De to hovedarter af grammatiske forbindelser ( 1921 ) .	He
[MASK] in this theory of ranks removes the parts of speech from the syntax , and differentiates between primaries , secondaries , and tertiaries ; e.g. in " well honed phrase , " " phrase " is a primary , this being defined by a secondary , " honed " , which again is defined by a tertiary " well " .	Jespersen
[MASK] and nexus proved valuable in bringing the concept of context to the forefront of the attention of the world of linguistics .	Junction
Modern English [MASK] on Historical Principles ( 1909  1949 ) , concentrated on morphology and syntax , and Growth and Structure of the English Language ( 1905 ) is a comprehensive view of English by someone with another native language , and still in print , over 70 years after his death and more than 100 years after publication .	Grammar
Late in his life [MASK] published Analytic Syntax ( 1937 ) , in which he presents his views on syntactic structure using an idiosyncratic shorthand notation .	he
In The Philosophy of Grammar ( 1924 ) [MASK] challenged the accepted views of common concepts in Grammar and proposed corrections to the basic definitions of grammatical case , pronoun , object , voice etc. , and developed further his notions of Rank and Nexus .	he
[MASK] , Nation and Individual : from a linguistic point of view ( 1925 ) is one of the pioneering works on Sociolinguistics .	Mankind
[MASK] visited the United States twice :	Jespersen
[MASK] lectured at the Congress of Arts and Sciences in St. Louis in 1904 , and in 1909  1910 he visited both the University of California and Columbia University .	he
While in the U.S. , [MASK] took occasion to study the country 's educational system .	he
[MASK] was a proponent of phonosemanticism and wrote :	Jespersen
After his retirement in 1925 , [MASK] remained active in the international linguistic community .	Jespersen
In addition to continuing to write , [MASK] convened and chaired the first International Meeting on Linguistic Research in Geneva in 1930 , and acted as president of the Fourth International Congress of Linguists in Copenhagen in 1936 .	he
[MASK] was an important figure in the international language movement .	Jespersen
[MASK] was an early supporter of the Esperanto offshoot Ido and in 1927 published his own project Novial .	He
[MASK] also worked with the International Auxiliary Language Association .	He
[MASK] received honorary degrees from Columbia University in New York ( 1910 ) , St. Andrews University in Scotland ( 1925 ) , and the Sorbonne in Paris ( 1927 ) .	Jespersen
[MASK] was one of the first six international scholars to be elected as honorary members of the Linguistic Society of America .	He

[MASK] re on the 236th - level Kaiserstrasse moving sidewalk when you see her .	You
[MASK] re leaning on the railing , waiting to ask Derya about a job , watching the glittering stream of mites that arc over half the sky  flying up to rewind their nanosprings in the stratospheric sunlight , flying down to make Frankfurt run .	You
[MASK] never get tired of watching them .	You
[MASK] s on the Holbeinsteg bridge .	She
[MASK] s hung it up here  a hundred meters of clean gray and green twentieth - century modernism , plucked up from the river Main and suspended in the chilly air 2,360 meters up , between a lump of wooded parkland and a cluster of antique subway cars .	Someone
[MASK] s wearing a 1950s sundress and a broad - brimmed hat , and it s like an essay on the last century  the austere steel bridge , the bright blobs of subway graffiti , and her yellow dress , flapping against her legs as she climbs over the bridge s rail .	She
[MASK] s a strawberry blonde , slim , her skin blank and virginal as new butter .	She
[MASK] s beyond the rail now , hanging out over the mountain - high drop .	She

[MASK] wanted to be a dentist .	Steven
[MASK] was pretty much the first thing he told us when , as first years , we were all bunched together in the unfamiliar dusty classroom .	It
When , a couple of weeks later we were invited over to his house [MASK] saw that this was not an idle remark .	we
Where our bedroom walls were decorated with posters of pop stars and footballers , [MASK] had diagrams setting out tooth implementations , anatomical drawings of the jaw with brightly coloured nerves , muscle , blood vessels , bones , and , of course , teeth .	Steven
Where we had shelves of plastic dinosaurs and superhero figurines from cornflake boxes , [MASK] had plaster casts of jawbones , gums and teeth grinning down at us .	Steven
 They do nt exactly encourage my interest ,  [MASK] shrugged .	he
 [MASK] sort of tolerate it .	They
But [MASK] says they re a sort of collection , and too expensive for me to play with . 	Dad
Of course , [MASK] tried to pick the locks , but the spikes and saws and drillheads remained  tantalisingly  out of reach .	we
[MASK] did nt see Steven s interest as strange , well , not that much .	We
[MASK] all had our own interests  drawing , electronics , collecting beer caps  that each appeared obscure to anyone else .	We
DIY [MASK] was just something that had never crossed our horizon before .	Dentistry
And if Steven did nt see it as weird , or no weirder than Andy showing us his Eastern - Block beer caps all laid out neatly on cork boards with little hand - written labels , why should [MASK] bother us ?	it
[MASK] suppose that , in our own way , we were all collectively strange .	I
Besides , [MASK] had some really good stuff : sweets that stained your teeth bright red  well , technically , not your teeth , just the plaque , but the result was often the same .	Steven
[MASK] had effervescent tablets that turned the canteen drinking water into that exact same pink mixture that the dentist gave you to rinse your mouth out after scraping around inside , and guaranteed to make the other kids splutter and spit it out when the taste slowly percolated through and met the memory of their last checkup .	He
[MASK] was nt dangerous .	It
At least , [MASK] suppose so .	I
[MASK] was vaguely uncomfortable , and appeared sufficiently disturbing that we all volunteered each other in turn until , at last , Andy said he was game .	It
And [MASK] were off .	we
Your [MASK] filled with what you imagined were fumes from the warm paste .	nose
And [MASK] seemed to be suddenly drowning in your own saliva .	you
[MASK] generally got better when Steven reminded you that you could actually breathe , and swallow , normally .	Things
[MASK] watched the second hand trotting round the dial of his watch mouthing the quarters , before poking the setting goo to check its consistency .	He
Then , when he gave you the nod , [MASK] tried to prise your jaws apart .	you
As the seal around your gums and teeth was pretty solid , [MASK] thought it would never come off , as the others giggled at your expressions and grimaces .	you
[MASK] jiggled the handle that stuck out beyond your front teeth like some metallic duck s bill , turning and twisting it most professionally and murmuring encouragements .	Steven
And , then , with an awful sucking slurp , [MASK] came free .	it
The [MASK] then revelled in retelling the gross sensation of having this evil - smelling plastic slug invade your mouth , while the others waited their turn with mixed trepidation and excitement .	initiated
Raucous [MASK] greeted the suggestions of the other body parts that could receive the same treatment .	laughter
The next [MASK] of the proceedings was less thrilling .	part
[MASK] measured and mixed the plaster of Paris and prepared for the cast by using a bright blue putty to build up the form of the jaw , and shoring up gaps and holes .	Steven
[MASK] get even less exciting when he said we d have to wait an hour while the plaster set real solid .	It
But the next time we visited his room [MASK] got to marvel at our toothy grins labelled and lined up on the shelf .	we
[MASK] were all perfectly happy with the result , even wanting one as a trophy until Steven passed an expert eye over them , pointing out here a gap , here a filling , and there a completely misaligned incisor .	We
[MASK] were , he told us , mediocre specimens for his collection .	We
[MASK] did nt matter .	It
[MASK] were all friends , a group bonded by the common experience of being able to see our teeth on Steven s shelf .	We
[MASK] interviews Christopher Hill , U.S. Republican Party presidential candidate	Wikinews
What qualifications do [MASK] have that will assist you in executing the duties of president ?	you
[MASK] took the Oath to our Constitution at 22 years old .	I
[MASK] understood it was an Oath to ALL of our people .	I
[MASK] profess an Oath to this nation but once in office pursue their party agenda and reward their voters .	Politicians
As President , [MASK] will serve ALL of the people in America , guided by the Constitution .	I
The Air [MASK] only selected 180 Officers a year from the Academy , Squadron Officer School and ROTC to attend .	Force
[MASK] volunteered for that program because I knew I wanted to be a Fighter Pilot and at the " Top of the Spear . "	I
In those days [MASK] was all or nothing .	it
[MASK] has proven itself ineffective as a body .	Congress
To make a difference in America [MASK] must have the " Bully Pulpit " and speak to the People .	you
The [MASK] has that pulpit .	President
[MASK] never wanted to make politics a career .	I
Why did [MASK] choose to run in the Republican Party ?	you
My [MASK] to the Republican party date back to 1979 , when I volunteered for Ronald Reagan and his campaign in New Hampshire .	ties
In those days [MASK] believed there was a difference in the parties .	I
Today , like many Americans , [MASK] am skeptical .	I
[MASK] understand third party candidates have no success .	I
[MASK] hope to lead the Republican party in a new direction for working class Americans .	I
How do [MASK] plan to get into the Republican debates and make an impact on polls ?	you
In order to be invited to the debates , [MASK] must raise money and poll nationally .	we
[MASK] is an effort that is underway .	This
If you do not receive the Republican nomination , would [MASK] consider running as a third party candidate ?	you
No , [MASK] will back the nominee of the Republican party in 2016 .	I
After that , [MASK] may reconsider .	I
Other than yourself , which candidates have [MASK] supported for president in previous campaigns ?	you
Specifically , what would [MASK] have done differently ?	you
[MASK] Obama has an agenda that represents the far left wing of his party .	President
His [MASK] of the Presidency to further this agenda has in many ways been unconstitutional .	use
His [MASK] to Eric Holder to enforce some laws and not others is another example .	direction
If elected , [MASK] would constitute a successful presidency for you ?	what
What individuals would [MASK] like to see in a Hill administration ?	you
[MASK] would like to bring People from the heartland of America that make this nation work .	I
[MASK] have had too many decades of Ivy League elites and Professors immersed in theory .	We
Anything else [MASK] would like to add ?	you
[MASK] is a nation that will endure .	America
[MASK] believe it is our responsibility to pass on the same opportunities to future generations that were promised to us .	I
As President , [MASK] intend to keep that promise !	I
[MASK] interviews Robert Sarvis , Libertarian Party nominee for Governor of Virginia	Wikinews
[MASK] Robert Sarvis , the Libertarian Party 's nominee for Governor of Virginia , answered five questions submitted via e-mail by accredited Wikinews reporter William Saturn .	Attorney
[MASK] has garnered double digits in opinion polls for the 2013 Virginia gubernatorial election , an unusual feat for a third party candidate .	Sarvis
The latest Newsmax / Zogby [MASK] from late September placed him at 13 percent , 14 points behind Republican Party nominee Ken Cuccinelli , Virginia 's Attorney General , and 19 points behind Democratic Party nominee Terry McAuliffe , the former Democratic National Committee chairman , with 24 percent undecided .	poll
On his campaign website , [MASK] notes he favors parental school choice through student vouchers , simplification of Virginia 's Tax Code , US Second Amendment - gun - rights , same - sex marriage , and reform of the state 's drug laws .	Sarvis
With Wikinews , [MASK] discusses his background , views on McDonnell 's tenure , keys to campaign success , plan to implement his agenda , and the former Virginia governor he most admires .	Sarvis
[MASK] am the only candidate born and raised in Virginia , but also the only candidate who embodies both physically and philosophically the growing diversity of the commonwealth .	I
( [MASK] am mixed - race ( half - Chinese ) and in an interracial marriage . )	I
[MASK] am the only candidate who has studied both economics and law , and the only candidate with a background in technology entrepreneurship .	I
Because of my academic and professional background , [MASK] understand the issues and challenges facing Virginia much better than the other candidates , and I am offering real solutions that can be appreciated across the political spectrum .	I
[MASK] am the only candidate who believes in both economic freedom and personal liberty and the only candidate who stands on principle against cronyism and corporatism and in favor of the rule of law .	I
What would [MASK] have done differently than him ?	you
[MASK] did well early in his term pushing back against Senate Democrats who wanted huge tax increases in response to major revenue shortfalls during the recession .	McDonnell
Those early budget [MASK] are his highest achievements as Governor .	efforts
More recently , [MASK] erred in accepting a transportation bill that had huge flaws and huge tax increases , rather than prioritizing spending and seeking more rational , efficient , decentralized transportation decision - making .	he
[MASK] could have shown much greater leadership in pushing for tax reform , regulatory reform , and school choice .	He
Of course , [MASK] showed ethical lapses in judgment .	he
Compared to previous third party candidates at the gubernatorial level , [MASK] have done exceptionally well in opinion polling .	you
What do [MASK] attribute that success to ?	you
[MASK] see the two - party system for the sham it has become .	Voters
[MASK] are sick of the partisanship and nonsense and the total lack of substance in modern campaigns .	They
[MASK] see the two major party nominees as exemplifying what is worst about their respective parties , and they want something better .	Voters
[MASK] who meet me and hear me speak know that I am sincere , know that I understand the issues deeply and have workable solutions , and know that I stand on principle against cronyism and corporatism and in favor of the rule of law and the public interest .	Voters
[MASK] like the fact that I stand for a Virginia that is both Open - minded and Open for Business .	People
If elected governor , how will [MASK] be able to implement your agenda while dealing with a hostile legislature ?	you
[MASK] share many policy positions with each of the major parties .	Libertarians
Working together with both Republicans and Democrats , [MASK] can get the good aspects of each party while rejecting the bad parts of both .	we
Which previous Virginia Governor(s) do [MASK] most admire and why ?	you
[MASK] would be a Libertarian today .	He
[MASK] celebrates 30th anniversary of first shuttle launch ; announces new homes for retired shuttles	NASA
NASA [MASK] Charles Bolden announces where four space shuttle orbiters will be permanently displayed at the conclusion of the Space Shuttle Program during an event commemorating the 30th anniversay of the first shuttle launch on April 12 , 2011 .	Administrator
[MASK] celebrated the launch of the first space shuttle Tuesday at an event at the Kennedy Space Center ( KSC ) in Cape Canaveral , Florida .	NASA
On April 12 , 1981 , Space Shuttle [MASK] lifted off from the Kennedy Space Center on STS - 1 , the first space shuttle mission .	Columbia
[MASK] held a ceremony commemorating the date outside the hangar , known as Orbiter Processing Facility - 1 , for Space Shuttle Atlantis , which is being prepped for its final mission which will be STS - 135 , which will be the last Space Shuttle mission .	NASA
At the ceremony , NASA [MASK] Charles Bolden announced the locations that would be given the three remaining Space Shuttle orbiters following the end of the Space Shuttle program .	Administrator
Space Shuttle [MASK] will take the place of Enterprise at the Udvar - Hazy Center .	Discovery
[MASK] is undergoing decommissioning and currently being prepped for display by removing toxic materials from the orbiter .	Discovery
Finally , [MASK] will go on display at the Kennedy Space Center Visitor Complex following the orbiter 's last flight which launches June 28 .	Atlantis
" [MASK] was a very difficult decision , but one that was made with the American public in mind .	This
In the end , these [MASK] provide the greatest number of people with the best opportunity to share in the history and accomplishments of NASA 's remarkable Space Shuttle Program .	choices
These [MASK] we 've chosen have a noteworthy legacy of preserving space artifacts and providing outstanding access to U.S. and international visitors . "	facilities
[MASK] was a very difficult decision , but one that was made with the American public in mind .	This
In the end , these [MASK] provide the greatest number of people with the best opportunity to share in the history and accomplishments of NASA 's remarkable Space Shuttle Program .	choices
Not [MASK] were pleased with the final choice of locations .	all
U.S. [MASK] John Cornyn , Republican from Texas , issued a statement regarding the rejection of Johnson Space Center ( JSC ) in Houston , Texas as a location .	Senator
[MASK] has played a critical role throughout the life of the space shuttle , but it is clear political favors trumped common sense and fairness in the selection of the final locations for the orbiter fleet . "	Houston
Cornyn 's [MASK] added , " There is no question Houston should have been selected as a final home for one of the orbiters  even Administrator Bolden stated as much .	statement
Today 's [MASK] is an affront to the thousands of dedicated men and women at Johnson Space Center , the greater Houston community and the State of Texas , and I m deeply disappointed with the Administration 's misguided decision . 	announcement
However , the [MASK] will recieve pilot and commander seats from the flight deck .	JSC
In a statement , [MASK] of Washington Chris Gregoire said , " The Museum of Flight put a tremendous amount of effort into landing a retired shuttle in the Pacific Northwest .	Governor
As the home of modern day air travel and the 747 , which has gracefully transported shuttles for the last 30 years , [MASK] would have been a perfect fit .	Seattle
In 2008 , [MASK] and Atlantis await a journey on their respective launchpads .	Endeavour
" However , the full fuselage [MASK] , that every astronaut including [ former Museum of Flight CEO ] Bonnie Dunbar has been trained on , will soon call the Museum of Flight home .	trainer
The largest of the trainers , this [MASK] will allow visitors to actually climb aboard the trainer and experience the hands - on training that astronauts get .	addition
[MASK] will help inspire young people to the adventure of space and to the excitement of a career in science , technology , engineering and math . "	It
Today 's [MASK] is an affront to the thousands of dedicated men and women at Johnson Space Center , the greater Houston community and the State of Texas , and I m deeply disappointed with the Administration 's misguided decision .	announcement
Other [MASK] include various shuttle simulators which will be given to the Adler Planetarium in Chicago , Illinois , the Evergreen Aviation & Space Museum of McMinnville , Oregon , and Texas A&M 's Aerospace Engineering Department .	items
[MASK] is also offering shuttle heat shield tiles to schools and universities that want to share technology and a piece of space history with their students .	NASA
The 30th [MASK] of the first shuttle mission coincided with the 50th anniversary of the first manned space flight when Yuri Gagarin lifted off aboard Vostok 1 into space .	anniversary
The [MASK] which had the stamp Protected B on every page detailed various security vulnerabilities of the NEMISIS database which is used by officers to track and prosecute environmental law - breakers .	document
If someone were able to shut the system down , or hack inside and delete or corrupt the information , [MASK] could affect the prosecution of the lawbreakers .	it
However , on the document , [MASK] referred to the database as National Enforcement and Emergency Management Information System and Intelligence System , adding the words " and Emergency " to the name .	it
Protection B [MASK] are the second lowest grade of classified government documents .	documents
Environment Canada [MASK] Julie Hahn said they apply to letters of complaint , criticism or injury , research or scientific notes and findings that do n`t have any conclusion , and Treasury Board letters , agendas and minutes that do n`t deal with subjects of national interest .	spokesperson
Environment [MASK] John Baird has asked government officials how such documents that are supposed to be stored in " approved security cabinets " wound up on the street .	Minister
" I 'm told two things : that it 's neither classified nor secret and that it 's stuff that could be available under access to information , " [MASK] said .	Baird
Environment Canada [MASK] Sujata Raisinghani told CBC News the department will look into the incident .	spokeswoman
" We take document security seriously , " [MASK] said , but refused to give any more details about how the papers came to be on a road .	she
[MASK] Dewar , an Ottawa New Democrat MP , said the combined security lapses raise serious questions about the government 's ability to secure sensitive documents .	Paul
[MASK] says that bureaucrats of the Conservative government have complained to him about document security to the point that they ca n`t share the information with their own colleagues .	Dewar
However , when a government document has been found on the streets , the [MASK] then says it was n't particularly sensitive .	government
" This government is so consumed with control of information and secrecy yet they do n't seem to be able to get the fundamentals right , " [MASK] said .	Dewar
The [MASK] is a reminiscent of two other incidents .	incident
" [MASK] calls for probe into misplaced documents "  Edmonton Sun , August 16 , 2008	MP
This [MASK] has once again confirmed the importance of the United Nations as the truly indispensable multilateral forum for addressing today s global problems .	year
The humanitarian [MASK] in the Horn of Africa , ecological disasters such as Fukushima , political developments like the Arab Spring and terrorist attacks such as the assault on the United Nations building in Abuja last August require concerted action by the United Nations and its Member States .	crisis
Ten years after 9/11 , joint [MASK] in the fight against terrorism continues to remain central on the multilateral agenda .	action
In the past nine months , [MASK] have witnessed momentous changes in the Arab world that nobody expected when we met one year ago .	we
[MASK] are legitimate demands .	These
An overwhelming [MASK] of young people were at the forefront of this enormous tide , which started in Tunisia and Egypt .	number
[MASK] should pay tribute to their courage .	We
In Libya , [MASK] lost their lives in the struggle for freedom and democracy .	thousands
In Syria , and to some extent in Yemen , the [MASK] is ongoing .	suppression
[MASK] strongly condemns the systematic human rights violations and the violence against peaceful demonstrators .	Austria
[MASK] strongly urge those responsible to immediately stop the bloodshed and to engage in meaningful dialogue and reforms .	We
[MASK] supports the Libyan people in its struggle for freedom .	Austria
Both the Austrian [MASK] and private sector have provided medicine , relief supplies and desperately needed fuel to Libya .	Government
The international [MASK] and the United Nations have to support and assist the transition process in the Arab world as the United Nations does now in Libya .	community
This [MASK] of change may last for some time and will be full of challenges .	period
[MASK] welcomes all efforts undertaken by Governments in the region for peaceful and credible change .	Austria
[MASK] encourage the newly empowered authorities to create a constitutional framework based on democracy and human rights , in order to fulfil their mandate for democratic change responsibly and peacefully .	We
The events in the Arab world notwithstanding , [MASK] must continue to focus on the Middle East peace process .	we
The Middle [MASK] took centre stage this week here at the General Assembly  and rightly so .	East
[MASK] must build trust and we have to foster the belief among Israelis and Palestinians that a negotiated settlement can be achieved  a sustainable solution based on two States living side by side in a secure and peaceful neighbourhood within mutually recognized borders .	We
[MASK] have no choice but to return to direct negotiations between the two parties .	We
The [MASK] , in its statement yesterday , has shown a way to do that and has also proposed concrete timelines .	Quartet
[MASK] fully supports the Quartet statement .	Austria
[MASK] welcomes President Al - Nasser s choice of theme for this year s general debate .	Austria
[MASK] appreciate Qatar s strong track record in that regard .	We
Last year s tenth [MASK] of the adoption of Security Council resolution 1325 ( 2000 ) on women , peace and security reminded us that the promise of women s full and equal participation in all efforts of maintaining peace and security , including in mediation processes , has not yet come true and that we all need to intensify our efforts .	anniversary
By inviting political decision - makers from both Khartoum and Juba to Vienna in recent years , [MASK] has managed to offer the two sides a platform for discussion .	Austria
[MASK] are ready to continue to do so .	We
The [MASK] and South Sudan have a shared past and must resolve their remaining problems peacefully .	Sudan
The United Nations [MASK] in Vienna serves as a dynamic hub for the promotion of peace , security and sustainable development .	headquarters
[MASK] am proud to announce that a liaison office of the United Nations Office for Disarmament Affairs will open in Vienna soon .	I
Over the past year , the International Anti-Corruption [MASK] set up its headquarters near Vienna , and the Vienna Centre for Disarmament and Non-Proliferation and an office of the International Peace Institute were established .	Academy
[MASK] fully stands behind the campaign launched by the Secretary - General on Monday to achieve universal access to modern energy services .	Austria
[MASK] support doubling the rate of improvement in energy efficiency and the share of renewable energy in the global energy mix by 2030 .	We
[MASK] provides substantial support to the energy and environment efforts undertaken by the United Nations Industrial Development Organization .	Austria
Last June , [MASK] hosted the Vienna Energy Forum , where about 1,400 participants discussed alternative energy concepts to reach the energy goals of the United Nations .	we
The Fukushima nuclear [MASK] should become a turning point in our approach to nuclear safety .	catastrophe
[MASK] decided , in 1978 , to forgo the use of nuclear energy .	Austria
Some [MASK] have recently adopted a similar course , which we welcome .	countries
[MASK] wish to make a ministerial statement about the first confirmed case of COVID - 19 in New Zealand .	I
On Friday , 28 February , [MASK] Zealand recorded its first case of the COVID - 19 coronavirus , becoming the 48th country to have a confirmed case .	New
The [MASK] had entered the country two days earlier after spending some weeks in Iran , which is currently experiencing a sizable outbreak of the disease .	individual
[MASK] can report to the House that they are currently in a stable and improving condition at Auckland Hospital .	I
The good news in this instance is that the [MASK] had limited contact with people upon their return to the country , and their family took all the appropriate measures when presenting at the emergency department .	individual
As you would expect , our public health [MASK] is working hard to contain this first case and limit the risk of any spread of the disease .	service
Contact [MASK] began immediately and has gone to plan .	tracing
Public health [MASK] will remain in touch with individuals to monitor the situation and give ongoing advice .	staff
Internationally , the [MASK] with COVID - 19 continues to develop at pace .	situation
However , the [MASK] - General of the World Health Organization said , this morning , containment  is feasible and must remain the top priority for all countries .	Director
[MASK] is exactly the approach that New Zealand is taking , using three main tools : border controls ; self - isolation ; and good public health practices , including highlighting the importance of basic hygiene .	This
At every step , the [MASK] has taken decisions in the interests of health and safety of the wider public , and so far we have been among the best at keeping COVID - 19 at bay .	Government
Just yesterday , [MASK] decided to extend for another week the travel restrictions that have been in place for China since 3 February and for Iran since last Friday .	Cabinet
These [MASK] have played a key role in keeping COVID - 19 out of New Zealand for so long and have given us time to better understand the disease and ramp up our preparations .	restrictions
Of course , [MASK] will be aware that there are outbreaks in other regions as well .	members
So , as a further precaution , [MASK] have decided that anyone arriving in New Zealand who has been in northern Italy or South Korea who has been there in the last 14 days will be registered for self - isolation .	we
[MASK] recognises that while there are outbreaks in both countries , they also have well - developed health systems and the outbreaks are largely located in specific regions .	It
[MASK] know self - isolation works .	We
[MASK] is a longstanding and successful approach to managing infectious diseases and has proven its worth again in recent weeks .	It
[MASK] have also stepped up the health presence at our airports .	We
As a result of decisions taken on Friday , health [MASK] are meeting all direct international flights landing in New Zealand airports from Hong Kong , Japan , South Korea , Singapore , and Thailand .	staff
Our border [MASK] is further ramping up to have health staff available for all international flights into New Zealand .	response
At the same time , our health [MASK] continues its preparations in line with our comprehensive pandemic plan .	system
[MASK] want to thank our DHBs , public health staff , and primary care and health officials for the work they are doing to protect the public .	I
[MASK] have high confidence in our medical professionals .	I
[MASK] have a strong public health system .	We
[MASK] continue to work to keep COVID - 19 out , but we are ready if it arrives in our community .	We
By the end of this section , [MASK] will be able to :	you
The earliest recorded [MASK] of the basic structure of matter comes from ancient Greek philosophers , the scientists of their day .	discussion
In the fifth century BC , [MASK] and Democritus argued that all matter was composed of small , finite particles that they called atomos , a term derived from the Greek word for  indivisible . 	Leucippus
[MASK] thought of atoms as moving particles that differed in shape and size , and which could join together .	They
Later , [MASK] and others came to the conclusion that matter consisted of various combinations of the four  elements   fire , earth , air , and water  and could be infinitely divided .	Aristotle
Interestingly , these [MASK] thought about atoms and  elements  as philosophical concepts , but apparently never considered performing experiments to test their ideas .	philosophers
The Aristotelian [MASK] of the composition of matter held sway for over two thousand years , until English schoolteacher John Dalton helped to revolutionize chemistry with his hypothesis that the behavior of matter could be explained using an atomic theory .	view
First published in 1807 , [MASK] of Dalton s hypotheses about the microscopic features of matter are still valid in modern atomic theory .	many
An [MASK] is the smallest unit of an element that can participate in a chemical change .	atom
2. An [MASK] consists of only one type of atom , which has a mass that is characteristic of the element and is the same for all atoms of that element ( Figure 2.2 ) .	element
A macroscopic [MASK] of an element contains an incredibly large number of atoms , all of which have identical chemical properties .	sample
A pre-1982 copper [MASK] ( left ) contains approximately 3  10 22 copper atoms ( several dozen are represented as brown spheres at the right ) , each of which has the same chemical properties .	penny
3. [MASK] of one element differ in properties from atoms of all other elements .	Atoms
4. A [MASK] consists of atoms of two or more elements combined in a small , whole - number ratio .	compound
In a given compound , the [MASK] of atoms of each of its elements are always present in the same ratio ( Figure 2.3 ) .	numbers
Copper(II) [MASK] , a powdery , black compound , results from the combination of two types of atoms  copper ( brown spheres ) and oxygen ( red spheres )  in a 1 : 1 ratio .	oxide
When the elements copper ( a shiny , red - brown solid , shown here as brown spheres ) and oxygen ( a clear and colorless gas , shown here as red spheres ) react , their [MASK] rearrange to form a compound containing copper and oxygen ( a powdery , black solid ) .	atoms
Dalton s atomic [MASK] provides a microscopic explanation of the many macroscopic properties of matter that you ve learned about .	theory
And if atoms are neither created nor destroyed during a chemical change , then the total [MASK] of matter present when matter changes from one type to another will remain constant ( the law of conservation of matter ) .	mass
In the following drawing , the green [MASK] represent atoms of a certain element .	spheres
The purple [MASK] represent atoms of another element .	spheres
If the spheres touch , [MASK] are part of a single unit of a compound .	they
Does the following chemical [MASK] represented by these symbols violate any of the ideas of Dalton s atomic theory ?	change
The starting [MASK] consist of two green spheres and two purple spheres .	materials
The [MASK] consist of only one green sphere and one purple sphere .	products
[MASK] violates Dalton s postulate that atoms are neither created nor destroyed during a chemical change , but are merely redistributed .	This
( In this case , [MASK] appear to have been destroyed . )	atoms
In the following drawing , the green [MASK] represent atoms of a certain element .	spheres
The purple [MASK] represent atoms of another element .	spheres
If the spheres touch , [MASK] are part of a single unit of a compound .	they
Does the following chemical [MASK] represented by these symbols violate any of the ideas of Dalton s atomic theory ?	change
The starting [MASK] consist of four green spheres and two purple spheres .	materials
The [MASK] consist of four green spheres and two purple spheres .	products
[MASK] does not violate any of Dalton s postulates :	This
15.4 The [MASK] Triumphant	Union
By the end of this section , [MASK] will be able to :	you
By the outset of 1864 , after three years of war , the [MASK] had mobilized its resources for the ongoing struggle on a massive scale .	Union
The [MASK] had overseen the construction of new railroad lines and for the first time used standardized rail tracks that allowed the North to move men and materials with greater ease .	government
The North s [MASK] had shifted to a wartime model .	economy
The [MASK] also mobilized , perhaps to a greater degree than the Union , its efforts to secure independence and maintain slavery .	Confederacy
Yet the [MASK] experienced ever - greater hardships after years of war .	Confederacy
Without the population of the North , [MASK] faced a shortage of manpower .	it
The [MASK] of industry , compared to the North , undercut the ability to sustain and wage war .	lack
Rampant [MASK] as well as food shortages in the South lowered morale .	inflation
From the beginning of the war , the [MASK] placed great hope in being recognized and supported by Great Britain and France .	Confederacy
European [MASK] in the conflict remained a strong possibility , but when it did occur , it was not in a way anticipated by either the Confederacy or the Union .	intervention
[MASK] III of France believed the Civil War presented an opportunity for him to restore a French empire in the Americas .	Napoleon
With the United States preoccupied , the [MASK] seemed ripe for action .	time
Napoleon s [MASK] was Mexico , and in 1861 , a large French fleet took Veracruz .	target
The [MASK] then moved to capture Mexico City , but the advance came to an end when Mexican forces defeated the French in 1862 .	French
Despite this setback , [MASK] eventually did conquer Mexico , establishing a regime that lasted until 1867 .	France
Rather than coming to the aid of the Confederacy , [MASK] used the Civil War to provide a pretext for efforts to reestablish its former eighteenth - century colonial holdings .	France
Still , the [MASK] had great confidence that it would find an ally in Great Britain despite the antislavery sentiment there .	Confederacy
[MASK] hoped Britain s dependence on cotton for its textile mills would keep the country on their side .	Southerners
The [MASK] that the British proved willing to build and sell ironclad ships intended to smash through the Union naval blockade further raised Southern hopes .	fact
The [MASK] purchased two of these armored blockade runners , the CSS Florida and the CSS Alabama .	Confederacy
The Confederacy s staunch [MASK] to slavery eventually worked against British recognition and support , since Great Britain had abolished slavery in 1833 .	commitment
The 1863 Emancipation [MASK] ended any doubts the British had about the goals of the Union cause .	Proclamation
In the aftermath of the proclamation , [MASK] in Great Britain cheered for a Union victory .	many
Ultimately , Great [MASK] , like France , disappointed the Confederacy s hope of an alliance , leaving the outnumbered and out - resourced states that had left the Union to fend for themselves .	Britain
At the beginning of the war , in 1861 and 1862 , Union [MASK] had used contrabands , or escaped enslaved people , for manual labor .	forces
The Emancipation [MASK] , however , led to the enrollment of African American men as Union soldiers .	Proclamation
Huge [MASK] of formerly enslaved as well as free Black people from the North enlisted , and by the end of the war in 1865 , their numbers had swelled to over 190,000 .	numbers
[MASK] among White people in the Union army ran deep , however , fueling the belief that Black soldiers could never be effective or trustworthy .	Racism
The [MASK] also feared for the fate of captured Black soldiers .	Union
Although many Black soldiers saw combat duty , these [MASK] affected the types of tasks assigned to them .	factors
This 1865 [MASK] illustrates three of the Union s distinct advantages : African American soldiers , a stream of cannons and supplies , and an extensive railroad grid . ( credit : Library of Congress )	daguerreotype
African American [MASK] also received lower wages than their White counterparts : ten dollars per month , with three dollars deducted for clothing .	soldiers
White [MASK] , in contrast , received thirteen dollars monthly , with no deductions .	soldiers
[MASK] and their Republican supporters in Congress worked to correct this discriminatory practice , and in 1864 , Black soldiers began to receive the same pay as White soldiers plus retroactive pay to 1863 ( Figure 15.17 ) .	Abolitionists
African American and White [MASK] of the Union army pose together in this photograph , although in reality , Black soldiers were often kept separate and given only menial jobs .	soldiers
For their part , African American [MASK] welcomed the opportunity to prove themselves .	soldiers
Some 85 [MASK] were formerly enslaved people who were fighting for the liberation of all of the enslaved and the end of slavery .	percent
When given the opportunity to serve , many Black [MASK] did so heroically .	regiments
One such [MASK] , the Fifty - Fourth Regiment of Massachusetts Volunteers , distinguished itself at Fort Wagner in South Carolina by fighting valiantly against an entrenched Confederate position .	regiment
[MASK] willingly gave their lives for the cause .	They
The [MASK] , not surprisingly , showed no mercy to African American troops .	Confederacy
In April 1864 , Southern [MASK] attempted to take Fort Pillow in Tennessee from the Union forces that had captured it in 1862 .	forces
Confederate [MASK] under Major General Nathan Bedford Forrest , the future founder of the Ku Klux Klan , quickly overran the fort , and the Union defenders surrendered .	troops
Instead of taking the African American soldiers prisoner , as they did the White soldiers , the [MASK] executed them .	Confederates
The [MASK] outraged the North , and the Union refused to engage in any future exchanges of prisoners with the Confederacy .	massacre

Often overshadowed by San Francisco , its larger neighbor lying directly to the west , [MASK] has in recent years began to step out from under the shadows , playing upon the beautiful highlights of its own and its rise as the multicultural " hipster ' city of the Bay Area .	Oakland
Since the 1960s , [MASK] has been a hub of radical culture , and is the birthplace of both the Black Panther Party and the Hell 's Angels .	Oakland
Oakland 's [MASK] in the arts and entertainment arena is notable as well , as Oakland has nurtured or been a second home to novelists Gertrude Stein , Jack London , Amy Tan , and Maya Angelou ; actors Meryl Streep , Mark Hamill , Bruce Lee , and Tom Hanks ; architect Julia " Butterfly " Hill ; classical conductor Calvin Simmons ; rappers MC Hammer , 2Pac , Messy Marv , and several other notables in the liberal arts and sciences .	history
[MASK] as a city reflects the amazing diversity of its residents and long history .	Oakland
For many visitors , the first [MASK] they are likely to visit is Downtown , especially if they are in town on business , or simply do not know where to start .	place
The [MASK] of transportation by BART and by bus is there , if one wants to branch out .	center
And [MASK] is as simple as walking in a direction from there , for the first few neighborhoods , since Old Oakland is along 10th Street , just west of Broadway .	it
[MASK] of the buildings and streets of Chinatown reflect the diverse nature of its history , in architecture and in the bilingual signs seen throughout the neighborhood .	Many
The curious [MASK] can venture to take a bus southwards along Broadway , and come to Jack London Square .	traveler
The unlikely [MASK] of warehouses and very expensive restaurants and posh atmosphere alongside some of the landmarks of the city 's waterfront makes the Square an interesting place to visit and explore , even for locals .	mixture
[MASK] 's the home of the USS Potomac and the site of the namesake author 's residence , still preserved and humbly standing not far from a saloon from the same era .	It
In the evening [MASK] buzzes with art galleries , theaters and residents and Bay Area visitors coming into the area to see concerts .	it
[MASK] 's a burgeoning neighborhood of performing arts ranging from nightclubs to music halls , avant - garde performance art , and even an improv theater company .	It
[MASK] also has some of the best in the city 's vintage architecture , like the Gothic Revival Cathedral Building and the Art Deco Fox and Paramount Theaters , as well as several restaurants .	Uptown
North [MASK] is a sweeping term , referring to just about everywhere north of Uptown and Lake Merritt .	Oakland
[MASK] of the neighborhoods are commercial centers and absolute heaven for foodies or those who seek quieter surroundings than the hustle and bustle of Downtown and Chinatown .	Many
[MASK] is a neighborhood that lies north - northwest from Downtown , centered along the reach of Telegraph Avenue , at and near 51st Street .	Temescal
Until the 1960s , a dominantly Italian - American neighborhood , [MASK] is now a much more diversified neighborhood , home to many restaurants , including some of the city 's best Korean and Ethiopian establishments .	it
[MASK] has lots of local boutiques and a diverse range of food at all prices and styles .	It
Open - air [MASK] , bookstores , and a BART station all its own make Rockridge another of many pleasant stops in North Oakland .	markets
Grand [MASK] and Lakeshore both share a friendly , suburban sort of feel .	Lake
The Grand Lake [MASK] stands at the entrance to the neighborhood that bears its name , a matter of a few hundred feet from Lakeshore Avenue  both are diverse neighborhoods no matter what your budget , be it burgers or sandwiches or a full romantic evening , either of these twin - sister neighborhoods will make a pleasant time , by day or night .	Theater
West [MASK] was once a burgeoning working - class neighborhood with its roots tracing as far back as the opening decades of the 19th century .	Oakland
[MASK] has seen a period of decline between the 1960s and the more recent past .	It
Strangely , twice in its history the [MASK] has seen benefits from major earthquakes .	neighborhood
After the 1906 earthquake , many San [MASK] relocated there , and the industrial development of the 20s and 30s saw its population in the hundreds of thousands .	Franciscans
Though there are a few draws for the traveler , West [MASK] is dominantly a very poor working - class residential neighborhood with a less than spectacular reputation .	Oakland
[MASK] is a group of more than 50 islands in Tonga , about 150 miles north of Tongatapu .	Vavau
[MASK] are either raised coral limestone or coral atolls .	They
The beautiful [MASK] opposite the main town of Neiafu ( known as the Port of Refuge Harbour ) is a common destination for yachties sailing the South Pacific .	harbour
The [MASK] attracts many humpback whales between June and November and there are lots of companies organising tours to see them .	area
[MASK] of Lapita pottery suggest that early - Polynesians were on these islands close to 3000 years ago .	Findings
[MASK] and surrounding villages are home to about a third of the Group s overall population of around 20000 , with the majority of the population living in small villages on the other islands .	Neiafu
[MASK] is the official port of entry for yachts coming to Vava'u , which attracts over 500 yachts every winter sailing season between June and October .	Neiafu
A [MASK] of islands and reefs along the eastern edge of the Group shelters the area from strong winds and ocean swellS and humpback whales come to these protected waters to give birth .	string
[MASK] is the high season for tourism ;	This
between December and April few [MASK] visit and many tour companies and restaurants close down .	people
Neiafu [MASK] is the centre of activity .	town
[MASK] is on the southern point of the main island of Utu Vava'u and has an attractive setting on one of the world 's most beautiful harbours .	It
[MASK] offers all the usual amenities including banks , schools , tour companies , restaurants , cafes and bars , supermarkets , a market and a hospital .	Neiafu
[MASK] does n't have a beach but boats to one of the nearby coral atolls with superb sandy beaches are easily available .	It
[MASK] has a tropical climate with average temperatures up to 29  C in January and down to 24  C in June .	Vava'u
[MASK] is sunny throughout the year .	It
Between November and April , [MASK] is more humid and thunderstorms and cyclones do occur .	it
The main [MASK] are : Utu Vava'u .	islands
[MASK] is the largest island , where Neiafu is found .	This
[MASK] is a limestone island with heights up to 213 m in the west .	It
The [MASK] provides a home to eleven indigenous bird species and contains Mt. Talau national park , with some of the limited remaining native vegetation .	island
Tropical [MASK] includes the pandanus or screw pine , the casuarina , and the mulberry tree , the bark of which is used to make tapa cloth .	vegetation
[MASK] is the second largest island in the Group .	This
Avai'o'vuna [MASK] is a small coastal wetland on the island .	Swamp
[MASK] is some 35 minutes from Neiafu Harbour and provides the main concentration of humpback whales .	This
The [MASK] lies in deep water and has sheltered waters and bays which provide a resting place for humpbacks with calves .	island
The Beavertail [MASK] ( Opunitia basilares ) , found primarily in the Mojave Desert and northwest Mexico ; can grow to be about 24 inches ( 60 cm ) high ; has pads that look like beavertails ; and yields red or purple flowers from spring to early summer .	Cactus
Beavertail cacti [MASK] need shade to grow , whereas cuttings need plenty of direct sunlight .	seeds
[MASK] can take as long as 4 to 4 years before you get flowers .	It
[MASK] can purchase them online or at a local garden center .	You
If you already own a Beavertail cactus , [MASK] can make your own cuttings .	you
If you plant the cuttings too deep , [MASK] might rot .	they
[MASK] will prevent the cuttings from burning during the hottest part of the day .	This
The [MASK] in the pad will provide enough nutrients for roots to grow .	moisture
Too much [MASK] might cause rot .	water
After 1 month , [MASK] will have sprouted and you can water the cutting for the first time .	roots
Once fully rooted , [MASK] are extremely drought resistant .	they
During the spring , summer , and fall , the Beavertail [MASK] grows and will benefit from a balanced fertilizer .	cactus
From the first pad , many [MASK] will form .	more
The second or third [MASK] will bear some flowers , but wait before harvesting them or you might affect the size of future harvests .	pad
[MASK] can cause property damage , create a mess , and produce unpleasant smells .	They
[MASK] can also be dangerous if you use toxic chemicals and poisons .	It
If there is nothing to eat , [MASK] will be less likely to stay .	mice
Peppermint [MASK] is a natural deterrent .	oil
The [MASK] is simply too intense for rodents and they will not try to go near it .	smell
[MASK] also helps to mask the scent of any tasty morsels that have been missed when cleaning .	It
[MASK] also gives the house a lovely smell , and is not toxic , unlike many synthetic chemical treatments .	It
[MASK] can get peppermint oil in most health food stores and even some major grocery stores . [ 2 ]	You
Peppermint oil cotton [MASK] need to be replaced after 5 - 7 days , depending upon the quantity of oil you put on it .	balls
[MASK] can use the mint in cooking , as well as it serving a deterrent purpose .	You
[MASK] can also sometimes find someone who owns a pet snake .	You
[MASK] will keep mice away . [ 3 ]	This
[MASK] should be available at your local home improvement store or online .	They
[MASK] work only on a single line of sight , so you need to know the exact path the mice are taking .	These
The [MASK] may only work for a short time because mice can become used to them . [ 4 ]	units
Many [MASK] that specialize in organic garden and home products make mice repellents that are better for the environment than traditional poisons .	companies
[MASK] of these products use natural ingredients , such as peppermint , that are known to be disagreeable to mice .	Many
[MASK] will not kill mice but they should keep them out of areas where the product is applied .	They
These [MASK] should be available at your local gardening or home improvement center .	products
A house [MASK] can take care of the problem .	cat
[MASK] that spend time outdoors are more likely to hunt to find their own food and may track down that mouse .	Cats
[MASK] typically have to be taught by the mother to easily become a mouser .	Kittens
Well - food indoor [MASK] might just see the mouse as a toy , and grow quickly bored of it after scaring it half witless .	kitties
[MASK] and adoption agencies often do not know if a cat is a good mouse hunter , and generally do not test for this .	Shelters
Sometimes this [MASK] is available , but usually not .	information
While many mousers are great pets as well , not [MASK] are .	all
Even if you do not have a cat , [MASK] can use used kitty litter to deter mice .	you
The [MASK] will sniff the smell of cat urine and clear off in a jiffy .	mice
If you have a large infestation , a [MASK] may not be enough to totally get rid of it .	cat
However , once you eliminate the infestation , a [MASK] will probably prevent reinfestation . [ 5 ]	cat
[MASK] smell garbage and get attracted to your house .	Mice
If you keep the cans away from the house , [MASK] are less likely to take up residence in your home .	they
[MASK] may take some time , but it 's worth the effort if you can attract a wild mouse eater to your yard . [ 6 ]	This
A barn [MASK] is the best .	owl
A [MASK] of barn owls can eat many mice in a night !	family
However , [MASK] might attract other types of owls or birds of prey with your nesting box .	you

How do [MASK] look at and experience art ?	people
Which elements of specific artworks do [MASK] focus on ?	they
Do museum [MASK] have an impact on how people look at artworks ?	labels
The viewing [MASK] of art is a complex one , involving issues of perception , attention , memory , decision - making , affect , and emotion .	experience
Thus , the [MASK] it takes and the ways of visually exploring an artwork can inform about its relevance , interestingness , and even its aesthetic appeal .	time
This [MASK] describes a collaborative pilot project focusing on a unique collection of 17th Century Zurbarn paintings .	paper
The Jacob [MASK] at Auckland Castle is the only UK example of a continental collection preserved in situ in purpose - built surroundings .	cycle
In this paper , [MASK] report upon the novel insights eye - tracking techniques have provided into the unconscious processes of viewing the unique collection of Zurbarn artworks .	we
[MASK] will discuss the potential implications of these techniques and our understanding of visual behaviours on museum and gallery practice .	We
The [MASK] brings together established research strengths in Spanish art history , experimental psychology , digital humanities , and museum studies to explore , using eye - tracking techniques , aesthetic reactions to digital representations of the individual Zurbarn artworks as well as the significance of the collection as a whole .	project
Our [MASK] of art develops from the interaction of several cognitive and affective processes ; the beginning of which is a visual scan of the artwork .	experience
When regarding an artwork , a [MASK] gathers information through a series fixations , interspersed by rapid movements of the eye called saccades .	viewer
Previous eye tracking [MASK] has highlighted the potential to transform the ways we understand visual processing in the arts ( see for example Brieber 2014 ; Binderman et al. , 2005 ) and at the same time offers a direct way of studying several important factors of a museum visit ( Filippini Fantoni et al. , 2013 ; Heidenreich & Turano 2011 ; Milekic 2010 ) .	research
Zurbarn s [MASK] of Jacob and his Sons has been on display in the Long Room at Auckland Castle for over 250 years .	cycle
[MASK] is the only cycle to be preserved in purpose - built surroundings in the UK , and one of very few of its kind in the world .	It
[MASK] has a long history in scholarship ( Baron & Beresford 2014 ) , but many key aspects of its production and significance have not yet been fully understood .	It
In this study [MASK] used eye - tracking in the first stage of exploring audience experience of the extensive Spanish art collections of County Durham , of which the 13 Zurbarn artworks ( there are actually only 12 Zurbarn artworks , the 13th Benjamin , is a copy by Arthur Pond ) are a key part of , to investigate the ways in which audiences look at Spanish art , how aesthetic experience is evaluated and whether audiences can be encouraged to approach art in different ways .	we
This pilot [MASK] primarily investigated how participants visually explore artworks and provides new insights into the potential eye - tracking has to transform the ways we understand visual processing in arts and culture and at the same time offer a direct way of studying several important factors of a museum visit , namely to assess the effects of label characteristics on visitor visual behaviour .	project
Tenured and tenure - track university [MASK] play a special role in determining the speed and direction of scientific progress , both directly through their research and indirectly through their training of new researchers .	faculty
Past [MASK] establish that each of these efforts is strongly and positively influenced through various forms of faculty diversity , including ethnic , racial , and gender diversity .	studies
As an example , [MASK] shows that greater diversity within a community or group can lead to improved critical thinking [ 1 ] and more creative solutions to complex tasks [ 2 , 3 ] by pairing together individuals with unique skillsets and perspectives that complement and often augment the abilities of their peers .	research
Further , [MASK] of adoption of services like GoogleScholar and ResearchGate vary within , and across disciplines .	rates
For instance , gender [MASK] in computing is an important issue with broad implications [ 5 ] , but without a full census of computing faculty , the degree of inequality and its possible sources are difficult to establish [ 6 ] .	representation
Most [MASK] , on the other hand , including computer science , lack a single all - encompassing organization and membership information is instead distributed across many disjoint lists , such as web - based faculty directories for individual departments .	fields
Because assembling such a full census is difficult , past [MASK] have tended to avoid this task and have instead used samples of researchers [ 8  11 ] , usually specific to a particular field [ 12  16 ] , and often focused on the scientific elite [ 17 , 18 ] .	studies
Although useful , such [MASK] are not representative of the scientific workforce as a whole and thus have limited generalizability .	samples
[MASK] of the largest census efforts to date assembled , by hand , a nearly complete record of three academic fields : computer science , history , and business [ 19 ] .	One
