[MASK] felt compelled to demonstrate her classical literary training .	Higuchi
The [MASK] were thin , there was little development of character and they were loaded down by excessive sentiment , especially when compared to what she was writing concurrently in her diary .	plots
But [MASK] was developing rapidly .	she
[MASK] of her trademark themes appear ; for example , the triangular relationship among a lonely , beautiful , young woman who has lost her parents , a handsome man who has abandoned her ( and remains in the background ) , and a lonely and desperate ragamuffin who falls in love with her .	Several
Another [MASK] Higuchi repeated was the ambition and cruelty of the Meiji middle class .	theme
The [MASK] " Umoregi " ( " In Obscurity " ) signaled Higuchi 's arrival as a professional writer .	story
In 1893 , [MASK] , her mother and her sister abandoned their middle class house and , with a grim determination to survive , moved to a poor neighborhood where they opened a stationery store that before long failed .	Higuchi
Their new [MASK] was a five - minute walk from Tokyo 's ill - famed red - light district , the Yoshiwara .	dwelling
Her [MASK] living in this neighborhood would provide material for several of her later stories , especially " Takekurabe " , ( literally , " Comparing heights " ; " Child 's Play " in the Robert Lyons Danly translation ; also called " Growing Up " in the Edward Seidensticker translation . )	experience
His [MASK] lay in great part in his acceptance of low - life characters as worthwhile literary subjects .	distinctiveness
[MASK] Higuchi added was a special awareness of suffering and sensitivity .	What
With these last stories her [MASK] spread throughout the Tokyo literary establishment .	fame
But between constant interruptions and frequent headaches , [MASK] stopped writing .	Higuchi
As her father and one of her brothers had before her , [MASK] had caught tuberculosis .	she
[MASK] died on November 23 , 1896 , at the age of twenty - four .	She
Higuchi 's [MASK] adorns the Japanese 5000 yen banknote as of fall 2004 , becoming the third woman to appear on a Japanese banknote , after Empress Jing in 1881 and Murasaki Shikibu in 2000 .	likeness
Batting [MASK] .265	average
Home [MASK] 19	runs
[MASK] batted in 171	Runs
[MASK] Wyatt Holt ( born June 11 , 1988 ) is an American professional baseball second baseman , shortstop and outfielder for the Boston Red Sox of Major League Baseball ( MLB ) .	Brock
While primarily used as an infielder , [MASK] has started in and played at every position for the Red Sox , except for pitcher and catcher .	he
Listed at 5 feet 10 inches ( 1.78 m ) and 180 pounds ( 82 kg ) , [MASK] bats left - handed and throws right - handed .	Holt
[MASK] first played in MLB for the Pittsburgh Pirates in 2012 , but has played for the Red Sox every season since .	He
[MASK] graduated in 2006 from Stephenville High School in Texas .	Holt
In 2003 , his freshman year , [MASK] made the District 8 - 4A All - District baseball team despite batting just .227 , and shared the league 's Newcomer of the Year award . [ 1 ]	he
[MASK] was a second - team All - District 8 - 4A inclusion his sophomore year , batting .324 for the season . [ 2 ]	Holt
[MASK] attended Navarro College in 2007 and 2008 . [ 5 ]	Holt
After transferring to Rice University in 2009 , [MASK] posted a .348 batting average with 12 home runs and 43 RBIs in 59 games for the Rice Owls .	he
[MASK] also led the Owls with 67 runs scored and shared the team lead with 11 stolen bases .	He
[MASK] began his professional career with the Pittsburgh Pirates ' short season , Class - A affiliate , the State College Spikes , before advancing to the High - A Bradenton Marauders in 2010 .	Holt
[MASK] began the 2011 season with the Pirates ' Double - A affiliate , the Altoona Curve .	He
[MASK] opened 2012 with Altoona and later joined Triple - A Indianapolis Indians .	Holt
[MASK] made his Major League debut on September 1 , 2012 .	Holt
At the time of his promotion , [MASK] had hit a .322 average in 102 games with Altoona and .432 in 24 games for Indianapolis . [ 10 ]	he
On September 4 , against the Houston Astros , [MASK] became only the second Pirates player since 1900 to have a four - hit game within his first four career games in the majors .	Holt
The only other Pirates [MASK] to have a four - hit game so early in his career was Jack Merson , who went 4 - for - 5 in his second major league game on September 15 , 1951 . [ 11 ]	player
In 24 games , [MASK] batted .292 with a triple and 3 RBI .	Holt
[MASK] started the 2013 season with the Triple - A Pawtucket Red Sox .	Holt
[MASK] debuted for Boston after getting called up on July 6 in Anaheim .	He
In 2013 , [MASK] played in 26 games , hitting .203 with 11 RBI .	Holt
[MASK] received his first championship ring when the Red Sox won the World Series over the St. Louis Cardinals in six games , despite not playing in the postseason .	Holt
[MASK] again started 2014 in Triple - A , but was called up May 17 after an injury to Will Middlebrooks and hit leadoff for the rest of the season .	Holt
On May 31 , 2014 , against the Tampa Bay Rays at Fenway Park , [MASK] hit his first Major League home run .	Holt
On June 8 , 2014 , in order to allow Xander Bogaerts to play 3rd base , [MASK] moved to left field .	Holt
[MASK] immediately impressed , making a sensational catch on the warning track to rob Ian Kinsler of a hit .	He
On July 9 , 2014 , against the Chicago White Sox , [MASK] drove in Daniel Nava in the bottom of the 9th inning for the first walk - off hit of his career . [ 13 ]	Holt
On June 1 , 2015 , while starting at first base for the first time in his career , [MASK] went 4 - for - 4 with four doubles , a walk , and two RBI against the Tampa Bay Rays to win 4 to 0 . [ 14 ]	Holt
By the end of the season , [MASK] had started games at every position except pitcher and catcher . [ 15 ]	Holt
[MASK] ( / drom / ; Latin : Eusebius Sophronius Hieronymus ; Greek :    ; c. 347  30 September 420 ) was a Latin Catholic priest , confessor , theologian , and historian , commonly known as Saint Jerome .	Jerome
His [MASK] of writings is extensive . [ 6 ]	list
In many cases , [MASK] focused his attention on the lives of women and identified how a woman devoted to Jesus should live her life .	he
This [MASK] stemmed from his close patron relationships with several prominent female ascetics who were members of affluent senatorial families . [ 7 ]	focus
His feast [MASK] is 30 September .	day
[MASK] was of Illyrian ancestry , [ 10 ] although his ability to speak the Illyrian languages causes controversy .	He
[MASK] studied under the grammarian Aelius Donatus .	He
There [MASK] learned Latin and at least some Greek , [ 11 ] though probably not the familiarity with Greek literature he would later claim to have acquired as a schoolboy . [ 12 ]	Jerome
As a student in Rome , [MASK] engaged in the superficial escapades and sexual experimentation of students there , which he indulged in quite casually but for which he suffered terrible bouts of guilt afterwards . [ 13 ] [ better source needed ]	Jerome
To appease his conscience , [MASK] would visit on Sundays the sepulchres of the martyrs and the Apostles in the catacombs .	he
This [MASK] would remind him of the terrors of hell :	experience
Often [MASK] would find myself entering those crypts , deep dug in the earth , with their walls on either side lined with the bodies of the dead , where everything was so dark that almost it seemed as though the Psalmist 's words were fulfilled , Let them go down quick into Hell . [ 14 ]	I
Here and there the [MASK] , not entering in through windows , but filtering down from above through shafts , relieved the horror of the darkness .	light
But again , as soon as you found yourself cautiously moving forward , the black [MASK] closed around and there came to my mind the line of Vergil , " Horror ubique animos , simul ipsa silentia terrent " . [ 15 ] [ 16 ]	night
[MASK] used a quote from Virgil  " On all sides round horror spread wide ; the very silence breathed a terror on my soul " [ 17 ]  to describe the horror of hell .	Jerome
[MASK] initially used classical authors to describe Christian concepts such as hell that indicated both his classical education and his deep shame of their associated practices , such as pederasty which was found in Rome . [ citation needed ]	Jerome
After several years in Rome , [MASK] travelled with Bonosus to Gaul and settled in Trier where he seems to have first taken up theological studies , and where , for his friend Tyrannius Rufinus , he copied Hilary of Poitiers ' commentary on the Psalms and the treatise De synodis .	he
[MASK] of these accompanied Jerome when about 373 , he set out on a journey through Thrace and Asia Minor into northern Syria .	Some
At Antioch , where he stayed the longest , [MASK] of his companions died and he himself was seriously ill more than once .	two
During one of these illnesses ( about the winter of 373 - 374 ) , [MASK] had a vision that led him to lay aside his secular studies and devote himself to God .	he
[MASK] seems to have abstained for a considerable time from the study of the classics and to have plunged deeply into that of the Bible , under the impulse of Apollinaris of Laodicea , then teaching in Antioch and not yet suspected of heresy .	He
Seized with a desire for a life of ascetic penance , [MASK] went for a time to the desert of Chalcis , to the southeast of Antioch , known as the " Syrian Thebaid " , from the number of eremites inhabiting it .	Jerome
During this period , [MASK] seems to have found time for studying and writing .	he
[MASK] made his first attempt to learn Hebrew under the guidance of a converted Jew ; and he seems to have been in correspondence with Jewish Christians in Antioch .	He
Around this time [MASK] had copied for him a Hebrew Gospel , of which fragments are preserved in his notes , and is known today as the Gospel of the Hebrews , and which the Nazarenes considered to be the true Gospel of Matthew . [ 19 ]	he
[MASK] translated parts of this Hebrew Gospel into Greek . [ 20 ]	Jerome
[MASK] Nicole Mourey ( born September 15 , 1986 [ 1 ] [ 2 ] ) , better known by her pseudonym Jenna Marbles , is an American YouTube personality , vlogger , comedian and actress .	Jenna
As of March 2019 , her [MASK] has approximately 3.1 billion video views and 19.5 million subscribers , [ 3 ] and is the 86th most subscribed channel on YouTube and the eighth - most - popular channel operated by a woman . [ 4 ]	channel
[MASK] is the first social media star to have a wax figure displayed in Madame Tussauds Museum , located in New York City . [ 5 ]	Marbles
Her [MASK] is a chemist who holds several patents and she has one older brother . [ 6 ]	father
[MASK] then moved to Boston , where she attended Suffolk University .	She
At Suffolk [MASK] obtained a Bachelor of Science in Psychology , and later attended Boston University for a Master of Education in Sport Psychology and Counseling . [ 7 ]	she
In the summer of 2010 , [MASK] was sharing a three - bedroom apartment in Cambridge , Massachusetts .	Marbles
[MASK] paid $ 800 rent by working various jobs , like bartending , working at a tanning salon , blogging , and go - go dancing at nightclubs . [ 8 ]	She
That year , [MASK] started her career with Barstool Sports , where she wrote for their female - oriented site StoolLaLa .	Marbles
[MASK] left Barstool Sports in 2011 . [ 9 ]	She
[MASK] uploads a new video to her YouTube channel every Wednesday / Thursday .	Marbles
In the video , [MASK] stated , " I 'm sick and tired of guys thinking that just because I showed up at a club or a dance or a bar , that I want to have their genitalia touching my backside " ; [ 12 ] [ 13 ] the video had approximately 36.2 million views as of March 2018 . [ 14 ]	she
The [MASK] " Jenna Marbles " comes from her mother 's complaint that " Mourey " , their legal surname , pulled up only Jenna 's videos on Google .	pseudonym
Jenna 's [MASK] was unemployed at the time that Jenna 's first video went viral , and was concerned that their content might put off potential employers . [ 7 ]	mother
The [MASK] " Marbles " comes from her dog " Mr. Marbles " .	name
As of January 2019 , Marbles 's YouTube [MASK] had about 19 million subscribers and 2.9 billion video views . [ 15 ] [ 16 ]	channel
[MASK] appeared as Eve in season 2 of Epic Rap Battles of History , episode 13 , " Adam vs. Eve " [ 17 ]	Marbles
[MASK] played a banana in The Annoying Orange episode " Fake n' Bacon " .	She
[MASK] played Miley Cyrus in a " Wrecking Ball " - inspired segment of YouTube Rewind 2013 .	She
On January 30 , 2014 , [MASK] appeared in season four of Ridiculousness .	she
[MASK] appeared as herself in Smosh : The Movie . [ 18 ]	Marbles
In 2015 , [MASK] unveiled a wax figure of herself at Madame Tussauds New York .	Marbles
[MASK] was the first ever YouTube star to be immortalized at Madame Tussauds New York and her figure is the first selfie - taking wax figure at this location . [ 19 ]	She
[MASK] has also professionalized her business affairs by expanding her business and bringing in people to help , including , a personal assistant , a business manager , and her mother ( the chief executive officer ) . [ 8 ]	Marbles
[MASK] does a weekly podcast with her boyfriend Julien Solomita called " The Jenna Julien Podcast " ( formerly called " The Jenna and Julien Podcast " ) .	Marbles
[MASK] include stories of growing up , conspiracy theories , YouTubers and other general topics .	Topics
[MASK] sometimes feature other YouTubers as guests on their podcast , including Shane Dawson . [ 20 ]	They
[MASK] released a brand of dog toys called Kermie Worm & Mr. Marbles .	Marbles
[MASK] has also created items with some of her most memorable quotes printed on them ( e.g. " what are this " ) .	She
[MASK] also hosts a weekly pop countdown on SiriusXM Hits 1 called " YouTube 15 " . [ 21 ] [ 22 ]	Marbles
In 2016 , [MASK] became an executive producer for Maximum Ride , a film based on the series of novels of the same name by James Patterson . [ 23 ]	Marbles
In 2015 , [MASK] became a full - time vegan . [ 24 ] [ 25 ]	Marbles
[MASK] has been in a relationship with fellow YouTuber Julien Solomita since 2013 , and the two live together in California with their four dogs , Marbles , Kermit , Peach and Bunny , who regularly appear in her videos . [ 26 ]	Marbles
Resting [MASK] Montmartre Cemetery , Paris , France	place
[MASK] mater Conservatoire de Paris	Alma
[MASK] Actress , screenwriter , film director	Occupation
[MASK] active 1947  2012	Years

[MASK] Moreau ( French pronunciation : [ an mo ] ; 23 January 1928  31 July 2017 ) was a French actress , singer , screenwriter and director .	Jeanne
[MASK] won the Cannes Film Festival Award for Best Actress for Seven Days ... Seven Nights ( 1960 ) , the BAFTA Award for Best Foreign Actress for Viva Maria ! ( 1965 ) , and the Csar Award for Best Actress for The Old Lady Who Walked in the Sea ( 1992 ) .	She
[MASK] was also the recipient of several lifetime awards , including a BAFTA Fellowship in 1996 , Cannes Golden Palm in 2003 and Csar Award in 2008 .	She
[MASK] made her theatrical debut in 1947 , and established herself as one of the leading actresses of the Comdie - Franaise .	Moreau
[MASK] began playing small roles in films in 1949 , with impressive performances in the Fernandel vehicle Meurtres ? ( Three Sinners , 1950 ) and alongside Jean Gabin as a showgirl / gangster 's moll in the film Touchez pas au grisbi ( 1954 ) .	She
[MASK] achieved prominence as the star of Elevator to the Gallows ( 1958 ) , directed by Louis Malle , and Jules et Jim ( 1962 ) , directed by Franois Truffaut .	She
Most prolific during the 1960s , [MASK] continued to appear in films into her 80s .	Moreau
Moreau 's [MASK] was French ; her mother was English , a native of Oldham , Lancashire , England [ 3 ] and of part Irish descent . [ 2 ] [ 4 ] [ 5 ]	father
Moreau 's [MASK] was Catholic and her mother , originally a Protestant , converted to Catholicism upon marriage . [ 2 ]	father
When a young girl , " the [MASK] moved south to Vichy , spending vacations at the paternal ancestral village of Mazirat , a town of 30 houses in a valley in the Allier .	family
" It was wonderful there " , [MASK] said .	Moreau
" Every [MASK] in the cemetery was for a Moreau " .	tombstone
[MASK] ultimately lost interest in school at age 16 , and after attending a performance of Jean Anouilh 's Antigone , found her calling as an actor .	Moreau
[MASK] later studied at the Conservatoire de Paris .	She
Her [MASK] separated permanently while Moreau was at the conservatory and her mother , " after 24 difficult years in France , returned to England with Jeanne 's [ 6 ] sister , Michelle . " [ 6 ]	parents
In 1947 , [MASK] made her theatrical debut at the Avignon Festival .	Moreau
[MASK] debuted at the Comdie - Franaise in Ivan Turgenev 's A Month in the Country [ 6 ] and , by her 20s , was already one of leading actresses in the theatre 's troupe . [ 2 ]	She
After 1949 , [MASK] began appearing in films with small parts but continued primarily active in the theatre for several years  a year at the Thtre National Populaire opposite among others Grard Philipe and Robert Hirsch , then a breakout two years in dual roles in The Dazzling Hour by Anna Bonacci , then Jean Cocteau 's La Machine Infernale and others before another two - year run , this time in Shaw 's Pygmalion . [ 6 ]	she
From the late 1950s , after appearing in several successful films , [MASK] began to work with the emerging generation of French film - makers .	she
[MASK] went on to work with many of the best known New Wave and avant - garde directors . [ 2 ]	Moreau
[MASK] also worked with a number of other notable directors such as Michelangelo Antonioni ( La notte and Beyond the Clouds ) , Orson Welles ( The Trial , Chimes at Midnight and The Immortal Story ) , Luis Buuel ( Diary of a Chambermaid ) , Elia Kazan ( The Last Tycoon ) , Rainer Werner Fassbinder ( Querelle ) , Wim Wenders ( Until the End of the World ) , Carl Foreman ( Champion and The Victors ) , and Manoel de Oliveira ( Gebo et l' Ombre ) .	She
In 1983 , [MASK] was head of the jury at the 33rd Berlin International Film Festival . [ 8 ]	she
[MASK] was also a vocalist .	Moreau
[MASK] released several albums and once performed with Frank Sinatra at Carnegie Hall in 1984 . [ 2 ]	She
In addition to acting , [MASK] worked behind the camera as a writer , director and producer . [ 2 ]	Moreau
Her [MASK] were the subject of the film Calling the Shots ( 1988 ) by Janis Cole and Holly Dale . [ citation needed ]	accomplishments
[MASK] A. Nida ( November 11 , 1914  August 25 , 2011 ) was a linguist who developed the dynamic - equivalence Bible - translation theory and one of the founders of the modern discipline of Translation Studies .	Eugene
[MASK] became a Christian at a young age , when he responded to the altar call at his church " to accept Christ as my Saviour . "	He
[MASK] graduated summa cum laude from the University of California in 1936 .	He
After graduating [MASK] attended Camp Wycliffe , where Bible translation theory was taught .	he
[MASK] ministered for a short time among the Tarahumara Indians in Chihuahua , Mexico , until health problems due to an inadequate diet and the high altitude forced him to leave .	He
Sometime in this period , [MASK] became a founding charter member of Wycliffe Bible Translators , a related organization to the Summer Institute of Linguistics .	Nida
In 1937 , [MASK] undertook studies at the University of Southern California , where he obtained a master 's degree in New Testament Greek in 1939 .	Nida
In that same year [MASK] became interim pastor of Calvary Church of Santa Ana , California following the resignation of its founding pastor .	he
Despite his conservative background , in later years [MASK] became increasingly ecumenical and New Evangelical ( clarification needed ) in his approach .	Nida
In 1943 , [MASK] received his Ph.D. in Linguistics from the University of Michigan .	Nida
[MASK] married Althea Lucille Sprague , who died in 1993 .	He
In 1997 , [MASK] married Mara Elena Fernandez - Miranda , a lawyer and diplomatic attache .	he
[MASK] retired in the early 1980s , although he continued to give lectures in universities all around the world , and lived in Alpine , Arizona , USA ; Madrid , Spain and Brussels , Belgium .	Nida
[MASK] died in Madrid on August 25 , 2011 aged 96 .	He
[MASK] has been a pioneer in the fields of translation theory and linguistics .	Nida
His Ph.D. [MASK] , A Synopsis of English Syntax , was the first full - scale analysis of a major language according to the " immediate - constituent " theory .	dissertation
His [MASK] Morphology : The Descriptive Analysis of Words was one of the major works of American Structuralism .	textbook
[MASK] remained the only thorough introduction to the field for decades and is still valuable for its many examples and exercises .	It
His most notable [MASK] to translation theory is Dynamic Equivalence , also known as Functional Equivalence .	contribution
[MASK] also developed the componential analysis technique , which split words into their components to help determine equivalence in translation ( e.g. " bachelor " = male + unmarried ) .	Nida
[MASK] is , perhaps , not the best example of the technique , though it is the most well - known .	This
[MASK] then sets forth the differences in translation , as he would account for it , within three basic factors :	Nida
[MASK] brings in the reminder that while there are no such things as " identical equivalents " in translating , what one must in translating seek to do is find the " closest natural equivalent " .	Nida
Here [MASK] identifies two basic orientations in translating based on two different types of equivalence :	he
[MASK] - E focuses attention on the message itself , in both form and content .	F
The [MASK] governing an F - E translation would then be : reproduction of grammatical units ; consistency in word usage ; and meanings in terms of the source context .	principles
[MASK] Tristan Padalecki ( born July 19 , 1982 ) [ 1 ] is an American actor .	Jared
[MASK] grew up in Texas and rose to fame in the early 2000s after appearing on the television series Gilmore Girls as well as the films New York Minute and House of Wax .	He
His [MASK] is of Polish descent , while his mother has German , Scottish , French , and English ancestry . [ 3 ]	father
[MASK] was a 2000 candidate for the Presidential Scholars Program . [ 1 ]	He
In 1998 , [MASK] and his partner Chris Cardenas won the National Forensic League national championship in Duo Interpretation . [ 4 ]	Padalecki
Although he had originally planned to attend the University of Texas after graduating from high school in 2000 , [MASK] decided to move Los Angeles , California instead to pursue an acting career . [ 1 ]	Jared
[MASK] won Fox Broadcasting 's 1999 " Claim to Fame Contest " ; he subsequently appeared at the Teen Choice Awards , where he met an agent . [ 5 ]	Padalecki
His first [MASK] was a minor role in the 1999 film A Little Inside .	role
Throughout the early 2000s [MASK] appeared in several made - for - television films , including Silent Witness , Close to Home , and the Disney Channel Original Movie A Ring of Endless Light . [ 6 ] [ 7 ]	he
[MASK] had an uncredited role as a high school bully in 2003 's comedy Cheaper by the Dozen , which he played after being asked by fellow actor and friend Tom Welling , who played Charlie Baker , and the director of the movie , who wanted someone larger than Charlie to pick on him .	Padalecki
[MASK] originally auditioned for Welling 's role , but gave it up in order to film a pilot titled Young MacGyver which was never picked up . [ 8 ]	Padalecki
In 2004 , [MASK] appeared in the Mary - Kate and Ashley Olsen comedy New York Minute as Trey Lipton , a cute boy to whom the Olsens ' characters are attracted .	he
[MASK] also landed a short role in the thriller Flight of the Phoenix alongside Dennis Quaid and Hugh Laurie .	He
In 2005 , [MASK] starred opposite Elisha Cuthbert , Chad Michael Murray , and Paris Hilton in House of Wax as Wade .	Padalecki
In 2005 , [MASK] appeared in Cry Wolf , another horror film , as Tom . [ 9 ]	he
[MASK] and his brother Dean ( Jensen Ackles ) drive throughout the United States hunting paranormal predators , fighting demons and angels , and dealing with all manner of fantasy & sci - fi genre .	Sam
The [MASK] is currently in its fourteenth season on the CW .	show
[MASK] owns the title of the longest - running North American sci - fi series in history . [ 10 ]	It
In 2007 , [MASK] served as the host of MTV 's horror reality series , Room 401 , which was discontinued after only eight episodes due to poor ratings . [ 11 ]	Jared
[MASK] had the lead role in 2008 's The Christmas Cottage as Thomas Kinkade , alongside acclaimed actor Peter O'Toole .	He
[MASK] also had the lead role in the 2009 version of Friday the 13th as Clay Miller , a character who heads out to Camp Crystal Lake in search of his sister who has gone missing . [ 12 ]	He
[MASK] met when Cortese guest starred as Ruby on the show 's fourth season .	They
[MASK] proposed to her in front of their favorite painting , " Joan of Arc " , by French realist Jules Bastien - Lepage at New York 's Metropolitan Museum of Art in October 2009 . [ 13 ] [ 14 ] [ 15 ] [ 16 ]	Padalecki
The [MASK] married on February 27 , 2010 , in Cortese 's hometown of Sun Valley , Idaho .	pair
On October 10 , 2011 , the [MASK] announced that they were expecting their first child together .	couple
On December 22 , 2013 , [MASK] gave birth to their second son , Austin Shepherd " Shep " Padalecki .	Cortese
The [MASK] resides in Austin , Texas with their three children .	couple
[MASK] and Supernatural co-stars Jensen Ackles and Misha Collins supported Beto O'Rourke for the 2018 Senate election in Texas . [ 19 ]	Padalecki
In March 2015 , [MASK] launched his Always Keep Fighting campaign through Represent.com .	Padalecki
His first [MASK] raised funds for To Write Love On Her Arms , which supports people struggling with depression , addiction , self - injury , and suicide .	campaign
The [MASK] is particularly close to Padalecki , who has been candid about his own struggles with depression . [ 20 ]	cause
For the second campaign in the Always Keep Fighting series in April 2015 , [MASK] partnered with co-star Jensen Ackles to release a shirt featuring both of their faces , to benefit their newly formed joint charitable fund .	Padalecki
Most recently , [MASK] launched a third campaign selling a further 40,000 shirts . [ 23 ]	Padalecki
During San Diego Comic - Con 2015 , more than 6,000 [MASK] surprised Padalecki at the Supernatural panel by holding up candles for him , after having revealed his battle with depression earlier in the year . [ 24 ]	fans
[MASK] of Tabennese ( c. 314  368 ) , also known as Abba Theodorus and Theodore the Sanctified was the spiritual successor to Pachomius and played a crucial role in preventing the first Christian cenobitic monastic federation from collapsing after the death of its founder .	Theodorus
Early in life [MASK] denied the excesses of his parents , and at the age of fourteen joined a monastery in the diocese of Sne , near the modern town of Esna , Egypt .	he
A [MASK] from Theodorus  monastery stayed with Pachomius in Tabennese while traveling and preached of the virtues of the Koinonia upon his return to Sne .	brother
Praying and weeping , [MASK] became determined that his destiny lay with Pachomius .	Theodorus
Although initially denied passage to Tabennese by a Pachomian monk due to his wealthy background , [MASK] opted to follow the visiting monk , and his persistence ( and lack of obedience ) paid off .	Theodorus
Quickly becoming a favorite of Pachomius , [MASK] lived an enviably ascetic life in the monastery , and took on the title of the " brothers  comforter " .	Theodorus
[MASK] asserted his influence openly ( which resulted in reprimands from Pachomius ) and generally maintained himself as a prominent figure at Tabennese for several years , despite never being given a position of power in the monastic hierarchy .	Theodorus
Finally , [MASK] called on him to preach to the brothers despite his youth , and eventually appointed him steward of Tabennese after several new monasteries had been built .	Pachomius
Retiring to the monastery of Phbow , [MASK] gave Theodorus complete control over Tabennese , though recalled him from the position after witnessing several monks under Theodorus  watch violating the monastic rules without reprimand .	Pachomius
Having failed to prove his governing ability and once more in a position no higher than when he had entered the monastery , [MASK] became a personal assistant to Pachomius and remained relatively quiet for some years .	Theodorus
Despite his clear potential and popularity , [MASK] refused to grant Theodorus any kind of authority ; though the old man 's failing health soon changed things forever .	Pachomius
After Theodorus had been assisting Pachomius at Tabennese for several years following his demotion , [MASK] became very ill and seemed to be on the verge of death .	Pachomius
[MASK] had not named a successor , and several brothers pleaded with Theodorus to assert himself as head of the Koinonia when the sickly man died .	Pachomius
Despite the assertion that Theodorus apparently did not want the rank of a father or this world 's glory , [MASK] consented .	he
Unfortunately for the would - be leader , [MASK] recovered , and upon hearing of Theodorus  decision , exiled the ambitious young man .	Pachomius
After living a life of constant weeping and prayer in solitude , [MASK] forgave Theodorus and allowed him to live among the brothers once more .	Pachomius
[MASK] returned , though never again would Pachomius fully trust his former protg .	Normalcy
In 348 [MASK] died , naming the brother Petronios as his successor rather than the clearly qualified Theodorus .	Pachomius
The [MASK] of Petronios later that year would leave Apa Horsiesios in charge , and the popular Theodorus would retreat to the distant monastery of Phnoum .	death
Although it seems Theodorus practiced complete submission to the new leader of the Koinonia , [MASK] soon arose in several Pachomian monasteries that viewed Horsiesios as a weak leader .	problems
Refusing to work or communicate and demanding a new leader , [MASK] of the elder monks completely abandoned any notion of obedience to Horsiesios .	many
The [MASK] of monasteries was falling apart , and Theodorus rushed to Tabennese to placate the rebels .	federation
Soon after his arrival , [MASK] was the new de facto leader , though he claimed to be only acting on behalf of Horsiesios .	Theodorus
For eighteen years [MASK] administered from Pachomius  old headquarters in Phbow , using techniques far more assertive than his predecessors , such as constantly shuffling the offices and locations of the most ambitious monks .	Theodorus
Within a few months his [MASK] came true , and Apa Horsiesios once more took his place as the head of the communities in both title and authority . [ 1 ]	prediction

Even though these pronouncements are Biblically based , and may be acceptable within an exclusively theological system , [MASK] do not appear reconcilable with the dignity of man-  dignity of man .	they
[MASK] , and semi-pelagianism , with all of its emphasis on on the role of prevenient grace , finally views free will as the decisive factor in attaining salvation , thereby conceptualizing free will , as similar to a healthy man-  healthy human understanding .	Catholic
For how can a [MASK] , be responsible for his deeds , if he possesses no free will ?	person
[MASK] is what Erasmus asked .	This
How can [MASK] decide between good and evil ?	he
Such [MASK] , long known to Luther , and many times presented to him , impressed him not in the least .	arguments
[MASK] alone is salvation .	God
[MASK] alone measures guilt .	God
[MASK] alone condemns .	He
[MASK] alone grants grace .	He
[MASK] can do nothing against the divine prerogative .	Man
[MASK] can only accept the divine judgment .	Man
[MASK] is in fact best .	This
For [MASK] alone is infallible , and his being is grace and mercy .	God
This [MASK] , that man is divinely elected to salvation , or to damnation , is the center of the predestination dogma , that later , the Geneva reformer Calvin , made the center of his teaching , and that subsequently , under other historical preconditions and circumstances , could be linked closely with a prosperous middle class , in the Netherlands , and in England .	concept
[MASK] is the paragraph though .	This
Therefore , [MASK] did not accept rational arguments against predestination doctrine .	Luther
Such [MASK] , on the contrary , necessarily appeared to Luther , given his theological orientation , as suspicious , from the very start , because they originated from human nature , which exalted itself against God .	arguments
The [MASK] reason prefers to submit to the Devil , adjusts to all situations , and proves everything , that is demanded of her .	whore
Human [MASK] , does not possess free will .	nature
[MASK] is like a horse , ridden by God or the Devil .	It

[MASK] was thirty - eight and still believed in Santa Claus .	Betty
But sometimes [MASK] could be such an asshole .	he
[MASK] leaned against the kitchen counter , picking dried glaze from the wrinkles in the back of her hand .	She
From the wireless headset that dangled from her neck , her old marine [MASK] called to her with joyous profanity and the bass of digital gunfire .	buddies
The [MASK] was upstairs .	Xbox
Her [MASK] were in San Diego and Cleveland .	buddies
Satellite [MASK] in Santa s Village was just another Christmas miracle , like faster - than - light travel and stuffing oneself through gas fireplaces with neither explosions nor lawsuits nipping at your heels .	coverage
[MASK] was six oclock .	It
[MASK] had said he needed to leave at eight .	Santa
So [MASK] had made Christmas Eve dinner while listening to  instead of participating in  the big special ops campaign game online .	Betty
[MASK] d garlic - salted the yams to the tune of Gomez unloading his Glock into a drug dealer .	She
[MASK] d painted the ham with maple glaze while Williams punctuated Patty Smyth s  Goodbye to You  with bursts from his assault rifle .	She
 Her [MASK] ,  as she called them , did nt take a lot of eggnog in their rum .	boys
[MASK] had spent his day opening envelopes from North American children and falling asleep watching the Pittsburgh - Cleveland game in the media room .	Santa
Now [MASK] was in the kitchen , awake and on his way out the door , because suddenly spending fifteen minutes eating dinner with his wife had become too much of a burden on this most wonderful night of the year .	he
[MASK] stretched the neckhole halfway down to his happy trail .	It
His [MASK] were finding their way through the armholes of his robe .	hands
 It s just that there are more children in the world now ,  [MASK] said .	he
 And [MASK] s not getting any younger , ho ho ho . 	Santa
 Do nt get much older either ,  [MASK] said .	Betty
Santa s first [MASK] had died centuries ago , but he always just dismissed the question of his own mortality .	wife
[MASK] never knew how naughty she should feel about wanting to strangle him sometimes .	Betty
 [MASK] re seriously going to let me eat alone again on Christmas Eve ? 	You
 Do nt think of it like that , doll ,  [MASK] said .	Santa
[MASK] slung his belt around his back , and gave it a quick tug .	He
His [MASK] shrunk from dangerously obese to barely jolly .	waist
A few crumpled [MASK] in American currency fell out of his pocket .	bills
[MASK] bent down to pick them up , mumbling about  emergency money . 	Santa
 Ca nt you get dressed in the bedroom like a normal person ?  [MASK] asked .	Betty
Distorted [MASK] erupted from Betty s headset .	shouting
[MASK] imagined red and yellow mosaic bursts lighting up the sunless snowscape outside , as if there was an HDTV behind the blinds instead of their kitchen window .	She
[MASK] of her boys probably stepped on a landmine .	One
Williams , [MASK] guessed .	she
[MASK] thought she could hear Gomez laughing .	She
[MASK] picked up the pans in which she d made the potatoes and maple glaze .	She
[MASK] put them in the sink to soak .	She
The gingerbread batter [MASK] could wait a day , even though it would take longer to clean tomorrow .	bowl
For now , [MASK] appreciated its fight to cover the ham - stink that coated the room .	she

When Tyler was very young , his [MASK] was his favorite person in the world because , unlike his parents , who believed that children should always be told the truth as adults understood it , she would fill in the gaps in his knowledge  Santa Claus , the Easter Bunny , God .	grandmother
His [MASK] were always too busy and often a little too serious , but his grandmother had a sense of peace about her , a lightness that lifted his spirit .	parents
A few times , when Tyler s parents were away , [MASK] took him with her to church .	she
[MASK] remembered liking the singing and the colorful windows , and how safe he felt there , in that large , empty space , sitting on a hard bench next to her warmth .	He
When she died , [MASK] overwhelmed Tyler .	grief
But like most adults , when he grew older [MASK] could only recall the intensity of that love in childhood in an abstract way .	he
[MASK] made the common error of identifying maturity with worth , and assumed that the love he had for her as a young child must have been lacking in strength and depth .	He
[MASK] was five or so , and they were playing some board game at the kitchen table .	He
As he swung his legs in his excitement , [MASK] kicked her repeatedly in the shins .	he
[MASK] asked him to stop , and he refused , giggling .	She
When she finally frowned at him and threatened to stop playing if he did nt stop [MASK] told her to go to Hell .	he
In Tyler s mind [MASK] could see her face grow taut , lose color , and then , for the only time he could remember , she began to cry .	he
[MASK] also remembered his own utter confusion .	He
His [MASK] did not have much use for religion and so for him Hell was a word without much mystery or power .	parents
At that time [MASK] knew only vaguely that Hell was a place you did not want to go , like the dark basement or the even darker attic .	he
[MASK] remembered feeling resentful that she was crying and he did not even understand why .	He
[MASK] felt the guilt of this memory even in his teenage years .	Tyler
For him [MASK] summed up all his insecurities and fears about his own cruelty , ignorance , and the possibility that he was , in reality , not a good person .	it
The [MASK] that he had caused someone who loved him such pain with so little effort and understanding troubled him deeply .	fact
One day [MASK] looked through an old family photo album , and in it was a picture of the kitchen in the house they used to live in .	Tyler
Now [MASK] remembered that they always ate in the dining room , and when they did play board games , it was always on the coffee table in the living room .	he
The [MASK] that had caused him such pain over the years could not possibly have occurred .	memory
Somehow , [MASK] must have manufactured the whole scene in his imagination .	he
The [MASK] of his grandmother had probably caused in him feelings of abandonment and guilt .	death
In his confusion [MASK] had taken elements from storybooks and imagined out of nothing this memory to punish himself .	he
[MASK] was the sort of fantasy that could have occurred to any young child who lost an important relative .	This
With that realization , the [MASK] of his grandmother crying faded in his memory and became less and less believable .	image
[MASK] thought he was very lucky to have discovered the single error in his false memory , which enabled him to reason his way into distinguishing between reality and fantasy .	Tyler
[MASK] felt that it was a coming - of - age moment .	He
Nonetheless , [MASK] admitted to himself that he was a little sad also at the discovery .	he
For however imaginary that memory was , [MASK] was also a part of his love for his grandmother .	it
When that memory lost its compelling aura of truth , it was like another [MASK] of her died with it .	part
[MASK] had no name for the emptiness that remained .	He

The first [MASK] of rain fell onto the parched stones from a cloudless blue sky .	drops
[MASK] disappeared immediately , drunk down into the mineral silence .	They
The [MASK] paused , and everything held its breath and waited .	garden
More [MASK] would come .	rain
[MASK] knew , beyond belief or necessity that the time had come .	Everyone
Heavy oily [MASK] bounced from leaf to grass to dusty ground , gathering in stems and folds on the way .	drops
Yet still the [MASK] was a hard polished blue with not a cloud in sight .	sky
Still the [MASK] held its breath .	garden
[MASK] would not be long now .	It
A [MASK] of drops plucked memories from deep in the roots , shivering through shoots and tendrils , humus and stone .	spattering
Wispy vapour [MASK] marbled the blue surface above .	trails
[MASK] sat on the porch watching , no longer daring to dart out and leap around in the downfall as drops turned to torrents and the staccato tapping on the roof climaxed to a thunderous roar .	We
[MASK] erupted and overflowed along the edges of the lawn , cascading around the raspberry canes and over the flower beds .	Pools
[MASK] rose up from the water - laden earth where they could no longer breath and wriggled and struggled fro air on the surface , writhing and swimming for a safe haven .	Earthworms
[MASK] burst over the barrels and cans standing under the eaves and gutters , flooding the pathways , carrying away all that was nt fixed solid and licking at the stairs to the back porch before climbing each step and lapping against the planks we were sitting on , a wooden raft surrounded by angry water and martial beat drum , drum , drumming on the roof above .	Water
[MASK] slipped out feet over the sides and when we felt the fish , some as big as logs , some as small as leaves , nibble at our feet , we leant over to watch them fraying and frolicking under the choppy surface .	We
[MASK] lapped at the porch , washing away the boxes , and bowls , and the dog s basket .	Waves
The rocking [MASK] , the watering can , boxes of cuttings , and tied - up newspapers , all floated away as we slammed the kitchen door shut and retreated to the front room we gazed out at the river that the street had become .	chair
The [MASK] was pewter smeared with charcoal now , and pressed down hard on the rooftops , slowly dissolving everything below .	sky
When the water rippled into the hallway , [MASK] splashed our way to the staircase and then up as it nipped at our heels .	we
Outside the other [MASK] were rocks surrounded by sea with mermaids swimming all around , flapping their scaly tails and hauling themselves up , to fall backwards into the crest of the oncoming waves .	houses
And as they swam [MASK] sang , their voices born on the winds and the salt and the rain , and we could hear them singing , He is coming , He is coming .	they
And [MASK] combed their long hair in preparation .	they
[MASK] waved and called , and they laughed and played , tantalising , their seaweed locks just out of reach .	We
With a flick of the tail [MASK] were off , still singing , He is coming , He is coming , until their voices were lost in the noise of the rain and the water .	they
A great whiskered [MASK] arose , then a belly , wet and sleek , long enough to wrap itself twice around the world .	head
 Is it him ?  [MASK] asked each other , nudging elbows and climbing onto the chairs .	we
[MASK] pulled off wet socks and shoes , letting them float away on the tide , before the great worm turned and the wake engulfed the creaking , cracking house .	We
[MASK] clambered up onto the roof , sliding on the tiles and clinging to chimney stacks , sheltering our eyes from the driving downpour .	We
The [MASK] was black , and the stormy sea all the deepest , darkest blues and greens and greys and flecked with white where the sea - horses galloped .	sky
The [MASK] broke making way for the gnarled head of a whale , spouting water high against the clouds before opening its whiskered maw and in a looming , booming voice called : He is coming , He is coming .	waters
The [MASK] washed away , so we scrambled onto the blue - black back encrusted with barnacles and cockles like stars in a night sky and held on tight as he rode the waves , dipping and blowing , dipping and blowing .	chimneys
The [MASK] and the rain tugged at our hair .	wind
[MASK] heard a fearsome creaking and cracking and before our eyes a great patch of sky peeled away , deeping down in the troughs and riding the crests with torn sails set against the wind .	We
[MASK] was a galleon with masts like a dead man s fingers , tarred timbers groaning and a mermaid sat on the bow as he ship dipped and passed .	It
He is coming , He is coming , [MASK] sang out .	she
And just as the wash hit us , prising us from the whale s speckled back and down into the sea , [MASK] threw down a knotted rope and we hung on for dear life .	someone
The singing [MASK] hauled us aboard chanting , He s a coming - ha ! He s a coming - ha !	sailors
And [MASK] fell onto the deck like fish bursting from a net .	we
The [MASK] stood above us dressed in jewels and finery from a thousand pillagings .	Captain
[MASK] had buried my parents in their gray marble mausoleum at the heart of the city .	I
[MASK] had buried my husband in a lead box sunk into the mud of the bottom of the river , where all the riverboatmen lie .	I
And after the war , [MASK] had buried my children , all four , in white linen shrouds in the new graveyards plowed into what used to be our farmland : all the land stretching from the river delta to the hills .	I
[MASK] had one granddaughter who survived the war .	I
[MASK] saw her sometimes : in a bright pink dress , a sparkling drink in her hand , on the arm of some foreign officer with brocade on his shoulders , at the edge of a marble patio .	I
[MASK] never looked back at me  poverty and failure and political disrepute being all , these days , contagious and synonymous .	She
The [MASK] were mostly dead , and the old men had been taken away , they told us , to learn important new things and to come back when they were ready to contribute fully .	young
So [MASK] was a city of grandmothers .	it
And [MASK] was in a grandmother bar by the waterfront  sipping hot tea with rum and watching over the shoulders of dockworkers playing mah - jongg  that I first heard of the valley of giants .	it
[MASK] all laughed at the idea , except for a chemist with a crooked nose and rouge caked in the creases of her face , who was incensed .	We
 We live in the modern era !  [MASK] cried .	she
 [MASK] should be ashamed of yourself ! "	You
The [MASK] stood up from the table .	traveler
[MASK] was bony and rough - skinned and bent like an old crow , with a blue silk scarf and hanks of hair as black as soot .	She
 Nonetheless ,  the [MASK] said , and she walked out .	traveler
[MASK] were laughing at the chemist as well as at the traveler .	They
The [MASK] of the bar was acrid with triumph .	air
Finding someone even more vulnerable and foolish than we were , after everything had been taken from us  [MASK] was a delight .	that
But [MASK] followed the traveler , into the wet streets .	I
The [MASK] of fish oozed from the docks .	smell
[MASK] caught her at her door .	I
[MASK] invited me in for tea and massage .	She
Her [MASK] were weathered and ringed , like the branches of trees in the dry country .	limbs
[MASK] smelled like honey that has been kept a while in a dark room , a little fermented .	She
In the morning , brilliant [MASK] scoured the walls and the floor , and the traveler and her pack were gone .	sunlight
[MASK] hurried home .	I
My [MASK] had survived the war with all its brown clay walls intact , though the garden and the courtyard were a heap of blackened rubble .	house
My [MASK] was empty and cold .	house

A [MASK] hurtled through the scattered metal , the pilot desperate to find a way to stop himself from joining the ever growing population of this interstellar graveyard .	starfighter
[MASK] Chalmers was not alone in his frustration with the current situation , but he was doubtless one of the most panicked .	Jacques
[MASK] tried to steady himself as he began cycling once again through the available display options for his starfighter 's radar system .	He
His [MASK] continued to grow with each passing second , every change of the screen doing nothing to abate it .	anxiety
[MASK] stopped midway through the calibration and glanced out of his cockpit .	He
The [MASK] was the same as it had been a few moments ago and it brought him no comfort .	scene
[MASK] could n't count the number of capital ships that dominated the Enemy 's frontline .	He
In his years of service to the Imperial Naval Forces [MASK] had never seen anything like it , not even in archive war footage .	he
The enormous [MASK] of the battleships loomed like giants atop a hill , staring down upon a tiny village below .	forms
Knowing that he had already been flying straight for longer than was advisable , [MASK] altered his course to attempt to throw off any pursuers .	Chalmers
Not long before [MASK] had been standing on the flight deck of his deployment carrier , amongst the other pilots , his heart pumping in his ears , his hands sweating as he awaited the order to board his fighter .	he
[MASK] saw his friends run forward as their names were called out , scrambling into cockpits , pulling on helmets and performing last - minute safety checks .	Chalmers
As he watched his friends ' fighters hurtle down the catapult , his commanding [MASK] had addressed the last remaining pilots still standing on the flight deck .	officer

[MASK] ran over to the waiting starfighter , threw on his helmet and begun ascending the ladder into the cockpit .	He

[MASK] hate the moon - I am afraid of it - for when it shines on certain scenes familiar and loved it sometimes makes them unfamiliar and hideous .	I
[MASK] was in the spectral summer when the moon shone down on the old garden where I wandered ; the spectral summer of narcotic flowers and humid seas of foliage that bring wild and many - coloured dreams .	It
And as I walked by the shallow crystal stream [MASK] saw unwonted ripples tipped with yellow light , as if those placid waters were drawn on in resistless currents to strange oceans that are not in the world .	I
Silent and sparkling , bright and baleful , those moon - cursed [MASK] hurried I knew not whither ; whilst from the embowered banks white lotos - blossoms fluttered one by one in the opiate night - wind and dropped despairingly into the stream , swirling away horribly under the arched , carven bridge , and staring back with the sinister resignation of calm , dead faces .	waters
And as I ran along the shore , crushing sleeping flowers with heedless feet and maddened ever by the fear of unknown things and the lure of the dead faces , [MASK] saw that the garden had no end under that moon ; for where by day the walls were , there stretched now only new vistas of trees and paths , flowers and shrubs , stone idols and pagodas , and bendings of the yellow - litten stream past grassy banks and under grotesque bridges of marble .	I
And the [MASK] of the dead lotos - faces whispered sadly , and bade me follow , nor did I cease my steps till the stream became a river , and joined amidst marshes of swaying reeds and beaches of gleaming sand the shore of a vast and nameless sea .	lips
Upon that sea the hateful [MASK] shone , and over its unvocal waves weird perfumes breeded .	moon
And as I saw therein the lotos - faces vanish , [MASK] longed for nets that I might capture them and learn from them the secrets which the moon had brought upon the night .	I
But when that moon went over to the west and the still tide ebbed from the sullen shore , [MASK] saw in that light old spires that the waves almost uncovered , and white columns gay with festoons of green seaweed .	I
And knowing that to this sunken place all the dead had come , [MASK] trembled and did not wish again to speak with the lotos - faces .	I
Yet when I saw afar out in the sea a black condor descend from the sky to seek rest on a vast reef , [MASK] would fain have questioned him , and asked him of those whom I had known when they were alive .	I
This [MASK] would have asked him had he not been so far away , but he was very far , and could not be seen at all when he drew nigh that gigantic reef .	I
So [MASK] watched the tide go out under that sinking moon , and saw gleaming the spires , the towers , and the roofs of that dead , dripping city .	I
And as I watched , my [MASK] tried to close against the perfume - conquering stench of the world 's dead ; for truly , in this unplaced and forgotten spot had all the flesh of the churchyards gathered for puffy sea - worms to gnaw and glut upon .	nostrils
Over these horrors the evil [MASK] now hung very low , but the puffy worms of the sea need no moon to feed by .	moon
And as I watched the ripples that told of the writhing of worms beneath , [MASK] felt a new chill from afar out whither the condor had flown , as if my flesh had caught a horror before my eyes had seen it .	I
Nor had my [MASK] trembled without cause , for when I raised my eyes I saw that the waters had ebbed very low , shewing much of the vast reef whose rim I had seen before .	flesh
And when I saw that the reef was but the black basalt crown of a shocking eikon whose monstrous forehead now shown in the dim moonlight and whose vile hooves must paw the hellish ooze miles below , [MASK] shrieked and shrieked lest the hidden face rise above the waters , and lest the hidden eyes look at me after the slinking away of that leering and treacherous yellow moon .	I
And to escape this relentless thing [MASK] plunged gladly and unhesitantly into the stinking shallows where amidst weedy walls and sunken streets fat sea - worms feast upon the world 's dead .	I

Even then , at the tender age of eight and with half my mind gone , [MASK] was becoming a superlative observer .	I
