New [MASK] emerge as veteran politicians step down in Hong Kong legislative election	faces
The [MASK] show the anti-establishment camp successfully maintained a majority in the geographical constituencies ' seats thus veto power to any members ' bills , and also a minority larger than a third to veto any bills featuring major political reforms .	results
Young and new [MASK] emerged in the new council members , as veteran politicians stepped down in both the anti-establishment and pro-Beijing campus .	faces
[MASK] Chu received the largest vote in any geographical constituency	Eddie
Other anti-establishment [MASK] elected in this district were localist camp 's Cheng Chung - tai of Civic Passion , pan - democracy camp 's Kwok Ka-ki and Andrew Wan of respectively Civic Party and the Democratic Party .	candidates
The pro-Beijing camp [MASK] elected were New People Party 's Michael Tien , DAB 's Ben Chan and Leung Che - cheung , FTU 's Alice Mak and pro-establishment nonpartisan Junius Ho .	candidates
Pan - [MASK] Lam Cheuk - ting from the Democratic Party and localist group Youngspiration 's Baggio Leung were successfully elected newcomers .	democrat
Other pro-Beijing [MASK] elected in this constituency were Gary Chan of DAB and Eunice Yung of New People 's Party .	candidates
Pan - [MASK] Gary Fan of the Neo Democrats failed to get re-elected in this constituency , and resigned from his leadership in his party due to its election defeat .	democrat
Other [MASK] elected were FTU 's Kwok Wai-keung and DAB 's Horace Cheung .	pro-Beijing
Demosisto 's [MASK] Law earned a surprise victory as second place in the constituency with 50,818 votes , and becomes the youngest Legislative Council member in Hong Kong 's history .	Nathan
The other two anti-establishment camp [MASK] were Hui Chi-fung from the Democratic Party and Tanya Chan of the Civic Party , both considered to be in the pan - democracy camp .	elects
Pan - democrat [MASK] Cyd Ho from the Labour Party lost her seat in this constituency .	veteran
The [MASK] of the candidates elected in this constituency were young and relatively new activists from the localist camp , Lau Siu-lai and Youngspiration 's Yau Wai-ching .	rest
[MASK] Wai-ching defeated another localist camp candidate , veteran politician Raymond Wong of the Proletariat Political Institute , by 424 votes .	Yau
In the District Council ( Second ) functional constituency , commonly know as " Super District Council " seats , pan - democracy camp 's [MASK] Chun - yu of the Democratic Party received 491,667 votes , the highest in this constituency .	Kwong
Other [MASK] elected were Leung Yiu-chung of NWSC and James To of the Democratic Party .	pan-democrats
In traditional functional constituencies , the pan - democracy [MASK] gained a seat from the pro-Beijing camp .	camp
[MASK] Ka-chun of the Social Welfare constituency defeated their opponents , hence the pan-democrats ' seats in the functional constituencies increased from 9 to 10 .	Shiu
Also , an [MASK] who does not claim to belong to either camp , Edward Yiu of the Architectural , Surveying , Planning and Landscape constituency , defeated his opponents and was elected .	independent
The [MASK] of this election was the highest in the history of Legislative Council elections , with around 2 million voters voted and a turnout rate of 58 % .	turnout
The previous general legislative [MASK] in Hong Kong was before the 2014 protests .	election
The [MASK] elects 70 members of the Legislative Council .	election

Crossing between the genres of science fiction , horror , anime , fantasy and comics , the [MASK] sprawled throughout all corners of the facility .	event
[MASK] of vendors offered products new and old , joined by celebrity guests like Stan Lee , Mark Hamill , and Margaret Atwood .	Hundreds
Various local fan [MASK] were there in a charitable capacity , and thousands of fans donned costumes , many of which they themselves created .	organizations
[MASK] , a Booker Prize - winner , was there to launch her graphic novel Angel Catbird , with illustrator Johnnie Christmas .	Atwood
[MASK] was making his final Canadian convention appearance , part of a larger farewell tour .	Lee
Hamill 's [MASK] included a panel with Kevin Conroy , the voice of Batman in Batman : The Animated Series , in which the Star Wars lead played the Joker .	schedule
[MASK] , Microsoft , and PlayStation VR all had large areas set up for attendees to try their latest games .	Ubisoft
From there , the [MASK] took players to investigate the murder of Nightwing .	demonstration
The Northern Arena Esports [MASK] ran throughout the weekend , facing off teams of video gamers in a packed hall .	Championship
The [MASK] saw US team Cloud9 and Immortals , from Brazil , face off in Counter-Strike : Global Offensive .	finals
Both unbeaten teams going in , the Brazillian [MASK] won the championship and $ 50,000 .	team
The Canadian [MASK] of 501st Legion returned with their setup of photo - ops , with proceeds to the Make - A - Wish Foundation .	garrison
Volunteer organization [MASK] Corps of Canada collects donations of comics , to distribute to children and youth in the hospital .	Comic
Along with collecting comics on - site , the [MASK] was fundraising through raffles and button sales .	group
Other charitable fan - based [MASK] included The Ontario Ghostbusters , Doctor Who Society of Canada , and Klingon Assault Group .	groups

[MASK] Zealand begins process to consider changing national flag design	New
On Tuesday , the New Zealand [MASK] announced the start of a public process to suggest designs for a new national flag , and determine whether their citizens would prefer a different national flag over the current one .	government
the new [MASK] would be unique to New Zealand .	one
The government 's Flag Consideration [MASK] has planned a number of conferences and roadshows as part of this process , with the first meeting set to take place in Christchurch on May 16 .	Project
According to the New Zealand Herald , [MASK] Professor John Burrows , the chairman of the project 's panel of twelve , said New Zealand 's flag has never before been open to public choice .	Emeritus
[MASK] Burrows also said resources and kits would be accessible for schools and communities , " For example , schools can run their own flag discussions and referendums to mirror the formal process as part of their own learning exercise " .	Professor
New Zealand 's Prime [MASK] John Key said he believes redesigning the flag now has a " strong rationale " .	Minister
[MASK] Key promoted the campaign for a unique New Zealand flag on Waitangi Day - February 6 - this year .	Mr
Of the public process , [MASK] said , " In the end I 'll have one vote in each referendum just like every other New Zealander on the electoral roll " .	he
The New Zealand [MASK] intends to hold two referendums to reach a verdict on the flag , at an estimated cost of NZ $ 26 million , although a recent poll found only a quarter of citizens favoured changing the flag .	government
[MASK] is a decrease from the year before , when it was forty percent .	This
[MASK] would then choose between the new flag and their current flag early in 2016 .	Voters
[MASK] attack Church of Scientology website	Hackers
[MASK] has learned that according to an Internet posting made just over 24 hours ago , the Church of Scientology 's website is being attacked by hackers , causing the site to shut down .	Wikinews
The " History " [MASK] of the site explains , in a satirical fashion , that the incident was prompted by the Church of Scientology 's attempts to remove a promotional video featuring Scientologist Tom Cruise from YouTube .	section
Though YouTube is complying with the Church of Scientology 's requests to take down the video , other [MASK] such as Gawker.com have stated that they will keep hosting the video .	sites
" So far , [MASK] 's the Internet : 1 , Scientology : 0 . But it 's a long game . " - Matthew Ingram	it
Writing in a blog post , [MASK] Ingram of The Globe and Mail dubbed the ongoing conflict involving the Church of Scientology 's attempts to remove the Cruise video from the Internet : " Scientology vs. the Internet , part XVII " .	Matthew
[MASK] characterized the conflict between the Church of Scientology and anonymous posters of the Cruise video as " another small skirmish in a war that Scientology has been waging for almost 15 years , since the early days of newsgroups such as alt.religion.scientology , which posted internal church documents in 1994 .	He
" Prompted I think by the Tom Cruise video , a new [MASK] is taking hold on the internet . An insurgency against The Church of Scientology . " Anonymous blogger , " Anon declares war on Church of Scientology "	obsession
One [MASK] admitted to being a part of the effort , writing in a blog post " I have myself , as per instructions , loaded up Gigaloader and started bombarding the Scientology homepage .	poster
The [MASK] wrote that " Prompted I think by the Tom Cruise video , a new obsession is taking hold on the internet . An insurgency against The Church of Scientology . "	poster
" [MASK] emailed me earlier today talking about a tool a group s been using to attack the scientology website .	Someone
The Church 's [MASK] is currently unreachable .	website
Some [MASK] reported that when they are able to reach the site , all they get is a message stating , " The word scientology means search for truth ... " .	individuals
As of 15:11 GMT the [MASK] was accessible again , but only loads at relatively slow speeds , and by the end of the day Saturday the site was not loading at all .	site
[MASK] on the message board for the Scientology - critic site Operation Clambake from Friday theorized that a denial - of - service attack had occurred , and wrote that as of Friday the Scientology.org site was either not loading at all , or loading very slowly .	Posts
[MASK] of Scientology at the Internet newsgroup alt.religion.scientology were critical of the attacks to the Church of Scientology website , with one poster writing " How can people look at both sides if one side is gone ? "	Critics
[MASK] to the Scientology website had already increased 18 - fold prior to the attack , following increased attention after the Tom Cruise video appeared on the Internet .	Traffic
At that time , one in three [MASK] to the site came from BBC News , and the website increased to number 3 in the company Hitwise UK 's Lifestyle - Religion category .	visits
[MASK] waits for death of Internet Explorer 6	Microsoft
With development of Microsoft 's Internet Explorer 9 ( IE9 ) browser almost complete , [MASK] announced on Friday that it is time for IE6 users to move away from the antiquated 10 - year - old browser .	Microsoft
[MASK] has replaced it with three newer versions .	Microsoft
On a new website , " The Internet Explorer 6 Countdown " , [MASK] has launched an aggressive campaign to persuade users to stop using IE6 and update to a newer IE .	Microsoft
Its [MASK] was Internet Explorer 6 .	name
Now that we re in 2011 , in an era of modern web standards , it s time to say goodbye , " [MASK] says on " The Internet Explorer 6 Countdown " .	Microsoft
Internet Explorer 's market [MASK] is slipping .	share
IE 's various [MASK] accounted for 70 percent of the market in 2009 ; this has dropped to approximately 56 percent today .	versions
[MASK] Firefox , its main rival , has been actively increasing its market share while the recently released Google Chrome is also quickly gaining users .	Mozilla
PC World 's recent [MASK] of its own web traffic statistics concluded , " Usually , Internet Explorer is the # 2 browser after Firefox , but over the past 30 days it 's been # 3 , a couple of points behind Safari - and nearly tied with Chrome .	analysis
[MASK] might be a statistical blip .	It
But if it is n't , and Chrome continues to surge , [MASK] could fall to fourth place . "	IE
Web [MASK] face big problems with IE6 .	developers
The Internet security [MASK] Secunia.com , has said that as of March 4 , 2011 , IE6 has 277 vulnerabilities ; 39 percent of these are rated " highly critical " .	firm
[MASK] says that the latest versions of Internet Explorer provide the user with enhanced protection from these attacks and threats .	Microsoft
Microsoft 's Internet [MASK] 6 is one of the most successful software products ever as measured by its durability and the massive numbers of people who have used it .	Explorer
[MASK] shipped with Windows XP , nearly a decade ago .	IE6
But [MASK] has outlived its usefulness , and Microsoft no longer wants to support it .	it
Australian [MASK] claims Church of Scientology imprisoned her for twelve years	woman
[MASK] Paris , an Australian woman and former Scientologist , has claimed that the Church of Scientology imprisoned her for twelve years aboard the Scientology - owned cruise ship , Freewinds .	Valeska
[MASK] joined the Sea Org aged 14 .	She
[MASK] claims she was first sent to the ship aged eighteen for two weeks as a teenager but ended up spending twelve years there .	Paris
[MASK] also claims that her passport was taken away from her and she was forced to work in the engine room .	Paris
Her [MASK] had spoken out against Scientology on French television after her ex-husband and Paris 's father , Albert Jaquier , committed suicide after he lost his fortune to Scientology .	mother
[MASK] claims that she was kept at Flag Land Base in Clearwater , Florida until she was eighteen and then transferred to the Freewinds .	Paris
On board the Freewinds , [MASK] claims that she was working from 6:00 am to midnight and due to lack of sleep ended up being a walking zombie .	Paris
[MASK] also claims that in 1997 and 1998 , she was tasked with removal of asbestos from the ship .	She
In 2007 , [MASK] left the ship after a confrontation with the ship 's management .	Paris
Here , [MASK] met her future husband and subsequently left the church .	she
In a statement to the Australian Broadcasting Corporation , the [MASK] denied these allegations :	Church
[MASK] also claimed Paris was a volunteer and claim she has a vested interest for misrepresenting her experiences with the Church .	They
The [MASK] also claims that Paris not having her passport was maritime procedure .	Church
North [MASK] puts military in ' quasi - state of war '	Korea
The [MASK] comes after North and South Korea exchanged artillery fire yesterday .	report
" War [MASK] of the South Korean puppet military made another grave provocation to the DPRK in the central western sector of the front on Thursday afternoon .	maniacs
[MASK] perpetrated such reckless action as firing 36 shells at KPA civil police posts under the absurd pretext that the KPA fired one shell at the south side .	They
" Foolhardy provocation deserves harsh punishment " , [MASK] added ; and , later , " Kim Jong - un issued an order of the supreme commander of the Korean People 's Army [ KPA ] that the front - line large combined units of the KPA should enter a wartime state to be fully battle ready to launch surprise operations " .	it
Yesterday , North [MASK] fired artillery rounds aimed at a loudspeaker in South Korea that broadcasts anti-Pyongyang propaganda into the North .	Korea
The [MASK] retaliated by firing dozens of rounds of artillery into the north .	South
South [MASK] had recently started to broadcast propaganda from loudspeakers after an 11 - year lull .	Korea
The [MASK] began on August 10 and South Korea says the broadcasts will continue .	broadcasts
After the exchange of fire , North [MASK] stated it would attack any loudspeakers broadcasting propaganda and would respond , militarily , within 48 hours if the broadcasts do not stop .	Korea
Both [MASK] have put their militaries on high levels of alert .	countries
Lantern [MASK] in Taipei lights up the night	Festival
Taipei , Taiwan  The Taipei City Lantern [MASK] was off to a bright start on Saturday Night as hundreds of thousands of people crowded onto the Chiang Kai Shek Memorial near downtown Taipei to witness city mayor Hau Lung - bin and other dignitaries ceremoniously flip the switch to light hundreds of colorful lantern scenes in and around the 240,000 square meter memorial park .	Festival
The [MASK] of this rock concert - like performance is a 15 meter high rotating pig equipped with a fog machine , laser light show and theme music .	centerpiece
The [MASK] of this year s lantern festival revolves around the 12 year Chinese zodiac cycle s year of the pig .	theme
Its round [MASK] symbolizes wealth and good fortune and is believed to bring good luck .	shape
Started in 1990 , the Taipei lantern [MASK] continues a 2000 year old tradition of light related festivals marking the end of the Chinese New Year celebrations .	festival
This particular [MASK] grows in popularity every year .	event
Last Year over 4 million [MASK] attended the event and this year the city expects about 6 million visitors according to the event website .	visitors
Colorful lantern [MASK] not only fill the central square but also the surrounding 2 km circumference of the memorial .	scenes
Each [MASK] has a theme .	section
One [MASK] of the memorial is scenes made by student groups while other areas represent the counties of Taiwan .	side
The Malaysia Tourism [MASK] was quite prominent at the main entrance to the grounds .	board
[MASK] flock to see the lantern scenes and enjoy the festival atmosphere as they carry lanterns , given away by the city and bought from street vendors at the event .	People
The many light [MASK] such a swords , devil ears , and lanterns turn the milling crowd into a unique light show that can be observed by climbing the steps of the 70 meter memorial hall on the grounds .	toys
The station [MASK] at Chiang Kai Shek Memorial Hall Station do an excellent job of crowd control but lines for the subway can still be hours long and very exhausting .	staff
A sudden rain [MASK] on Sunday night ( March 4 ) caused a mass exodus of people to head for the station prompting lines that backed up into the street .	storm
[MASK] of these stops are only about a 20 minute walk from the event and have no crowds at all .	Both
[MASK] visited the festival on Saturday night , the opening night , and there was a sea of people in the square .	I
[MASK] went back the next Tuesday night and there was almost no one there , just a few stray photographers taking advantage of the unimpeded views of the lanterns .	I
The [MASK] runs through March 11 this year .	festival
Yesterday , day five of the 2018 FIFA football World Cup , [MASK] defeated South Korea 1  0 ; Belgium defeated debutants Panama 3  0 ; and Tunisia lost 1  2 to England , with a late goal from English captain Harry Kane .	Sweden
In the first game of the day , [MASK] faced South Korea at the Nizhny Novgorod Stadium .	Sweden
[MASK] had higher ball possession in the game .	Sweden
In the 20th minute , [MASK] Berg missed a chance to put Sweden in the lead .	Marcus
[MASK] substituted Park Joo-Ho in the 28th minute of the game due to injury and was replaced by Kim Min-Woo .	Korea
Despite their attempts , neither [MASK] could open the scoring in the first half as it ended 0  0 .	side
In the 62nd minute [MASK] Min-Woo conceded a penalty which the match referee Joel Aguilar awarded Sweden after confirming with the video assistant referee .	Kim
Swedish [MASK] Andreas Granqvist scored from the penalty spot , putting Sweden 1  0 up .	captain
In the injury time , Hwang Hee-Chan 's [MASK] went wide to the left , missing a chance to equalise for Korea .	header
The [MASK] ended with Sweden winning three points .	match
Swedish [MASK] Andreas Granqvist won the Budweiser Man of the Match award .	captain
[MASK] was Sweden 's first victory in the opening match of the World Cup since 1958 .	This
In the first game of Group G , [MASK] faced Panama at the Fisht Stadium in Sochi .	Belgium
[MASK] had greater ball possession in the match .	Belgium
[MASK] started the game with attacking style with Romelu Lukaku , Yannick Carrasco , and Dries Mertens making early attempts to put Belgium into the lead against debutans Panama .	Belgium
Dries Mertens 's [MASK] in the 18th minute failed .	attempt
The first [MASK] ended with 0  0 on the scoreboard .	half
Just two minutes in the second half , [MASK] Mertens scored a goal from a volley , putting the Belgians in the lead .	Dries
In the 69th minute , [MASK] Lukaku doubled the lead for Belgium , scoring a header from Kevin De Bruyne 's assist .	Romelu
Six minutes later , [MASK] scored a third goal for Belgium , this time from Eden Hazard 's assist .	Lukaku
In the 90th minute , [MASK] made a change , as Nacer Chadli replaced Axel Witsel .	Belgium
The second [MASK] ended with the Belgians winning three points .	half
[MASK] won the Budweiser Man of the Match award .	Lukaku
After the match , [MASK] Dario Gomez , Panama coach , said , " I think we have learned a lot from today 's game .	Hernan
[MASK] was a very emotional day .	It
[MASK] is the fifth time I 've been at a World Cup but it felt like the first .	This
The [MASK] was still very emotional at the start of the match but as time went by , they were able to focus better . "	team
In the last match of the day , [MASK] faced England at the Volgograd Arena .	Tunisia
[MASK] had better ball possession in the game .	England
[MASK] started the match with attacking style , with attempts from Jesse Lingard , Harry Maguire , Harry Kane , and John Stones early in the game .	England
Then [MASK] opened the scoring , when Harry Kane scored a close - ranged shot .	England
[MASK] won a penalty kick in the 33rd minute .	Tunisia
The first [MASK] ended 1  1 on the scoreboard .	half
In the second half , both [MASK] had attempts for goals , but none crossing the goal line .	sides
In the injury time , English [MASK] Harry Kane scored a second goal as England won a corner kick .	captain
The [MASK] came to end with England winning 2  1 and collecting three points .	match
[MASK] Kane won the Budweiser Man of the Match award .	Harry
[MASK] said , " In the first half it felt good out there .	He
[MASK] could 've scored two or three goals in the first half and put the game to bed early . "	We
After the match , Tunisia 's [MASK] Nabil Maaloul said , " We were playing against a highly - skilled and highly co-ordinated team in terms of their forward players .	coach
If we were to get a draw [MASK] would have been an excellent result for us .	it
But hopefully [MASK] will lead to higher levels of concentration in the coming games . "	this
The [MASK] at Islam 's most holy site happened at Jamarat Bridge , during an event where pebbles are thrown at a pillar to represent the stoning of Satan as part of the final rites of the Hajj .	stampede
The [MASK] began when luggage from a bus tripped pilgrims at the eastern end of the wall , causing a bottleneck .	stampede
Saudi [MASK] had already provided safeguards by installing an oval wall with padded edges to protect pilgrams from a crush , installed security cameras and placed over 60,000 security personnel in the area .	officials
[MASK] is not the first time deadly stampedes have taken place during the Hajj , with the deadliest stampede during the 1991 Hajj , in which 1,426 pilgrims were trampled .	This
Local [MASK] in Italy ask taxes from religious schools	municipalities
In the past few days in Italy , several [MASK] have started asking religious schools to pay taxes for property and local services , despite the resistance of the Catholic Church .	municipalities
The [MASK] of the municipalities results from the sentence of the Italian Supreme Court of Cassation on July 8 , recognising as legitimate the request of the Municipality of Livorno asking religious schools to pay property taxes .	request
[MASK] have come from the Municipality of Bogliasco , next to Genova , and from the deputies of Movimento 5 Stelle ( M5S ) of the regional counsel of Lombardy .	Requests
The first [MASK] is of the mayor Luca Pastorino that in last years received several refusals of his requests for payment because of the religious nursery school and retirement home .	case
In the second case , the M5S [MASK] asks to the regional government to assure the local administrations of the region regularly apply the sentence of the Supreme Court .	party
The [MASK] on which the Court has ruled was of the religious schools Santo Spirito and Immacolata in Livorno , Tuscany , to pay over 422,000 euros in arrears for the period from 2004 to 2009 .	case
The [MASK] reasoned , " because the users of the private schools pay a frequency fee , this kind of activity is considered as a commercial one " ( ( it ) ) .	city
In 2014 the Italian municipal tax [MASK] has changed from the ICI system to the IMU system by the Monti government .	discipline
The new [MASK] is not retroactive , so the taxes requested in arrears from 2006 to 2009 are under the ICI system .	law
[MASK] of Education Stefania Giannini said a " more general reflection " ( ( it ) ) is needed .	Minister
[MASK] De Vincenti , undersecretary to the prime minister , said " a discussion table will be opened with the non-profit associations , religious association included " ( ( it ) ) .	Claudio
[MASK] for Education Mr. Toccafondi says " many schools will increase their fees or they will quit . Then the State will have to find new resources to build new structures and manage them " ( ( it ) ) .	Undersecretary
Also the [MASK] of the Lombardy region , Roberto Maroni , has reacted by proposing some regional counter-measures to finance private schools .	president
The secretary [MASK] of CEI ( Italian Episcopal Conference ) , Nunzio Galantino , has called the sentence " dangerous " ( ( it ) ) and " ideological " ( ( it ) ) :	general
" [MASK] face a dangerous sentence .	We
Because [MASK] have the clear sensation that with this way of thinking , they wait the praise of some ideologized supporters .	I
Indeed , [MASK] do n't understand what kind of good service private schools held " ( ( it ) ) .	they
The secularist [MASK] MicroMega describe the court 's judgement as historic .	magazine
The [MASK] of Rationalist Atheists and Agnostics ( UAAR ) has launched a petition which now has more than 11,000 signatures , asking the government to respect and execute the sentence of the Supreme Court .	Union
[MASK] is also encouraging citizens to ask for application of the law in their local municipalities .	It
This past [MASK] marked the opening night of an Andy Warhol exhibit at the University of Southern Indiana .	week
USI 's art [MASK] , like 189 other educational galleries and museums around the country , is a recipient of a major Warhol donor program , and this program is cultivating new interest in Warhol 's photographic legacy .	gallery
Wikinews [MASK] attended the opening and spoke to donors , exhibit organizers and patrons .	reporters
The USI art [MASK] celebrated the Thursday opening with its display of Warhol 's Polaroids , gelatin silver prints and several colored screen prints .	gallery
USI 's [MASK] , which is located in Evansville , Indiana , is to run from January 23 through March 9 .	exhibit
The McCutchan Art [MASK] / Pace Galleries at USI bases its exhibit around roughly 100 Polaroids selected from its collection .	Center
The Andy Warhol [MASK] for the Visual Arts made two donations to USI Art Collections , in 2007 and a second recently .	Foundation
[MASK] Waters , director of the gallery , expressed interest in further donations from the foundation in the future .	Kathryn
Since 2007 the Andy Warhol Photographic Legacy [MASK] has seeded university art galleries throughout the United States with over 28,000 Andy Warhol photographs and other artifacts .	Program
The [MASK] takes a decentralized approach to Warhol 's photography collection and encourages university art galleries to regularly disseminate and educate audiences about Warhol 's artistic vision , especially in the area of photography .	program
[MASK] provides additional video , audio and photographs so our readers may learn more .	Wikinews
[MASK] observed that the 2007 starting date of the donation program , which is part of the Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts , coincided with the 20th anniversary of Andy Warhol 's death in 1987 .	Wilkins
[MASK] was not alone in receiving a donation .	USI
[MASK] Maurer , chief financial officer and treasurer at the Andy Warhol Foundation , said 500 institutions received the initial invitation and currently 190 universities have accepted one or more donations .	K.C.
[MASK] have received Polaroids from the foundation .	All
University [MASK] can reach out and attract large audiences .	exhibits
For example , the Weatherspoon Art [MASK] at the University of North Carolina at Greensboro saw attendance levels reach 11,000 visitors when it exhibited its Warhol collection in 2010 , according to curator Elaine Gustafon .	Museum
That [MASK] was part of a collaboration combining the collections from Duke University , located in Durham , North Carolina , and University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill , which also were recipients of donated items from the Andy Warhol Photographic Legacy Program .	exhibit
Each [MASK] donated by the Andy Warhol Photographic Legacy Program holds Polaroids of well - known celebrities .	collection
The successful UNC Greensboro [MASK] included Polaroids of author Truman Capote and singer - songwriter Carly Simon .	exhibit
[MASK] explained Warhol 's obsession with celebrities began when he first collected head shots as a kid and continued as a passion throughout his life .	Wilkins
" He 's hanging out with the celebrities , and has kind of become the same sort of celebrity he was interested in documenting earlier in his career " , [MASK] said .	Wilkins
The [MASK] at USI includes Polaroids of actor Dennis Hopper ; musician Nick Rhodes of Duran Duran ; publishers Jann Wenner of Rolling Stone Magazine and Carlo De Benedetti of Italy 's la Repubblica ; disco club owner Steve Rubell of Studio 54 ; photographers Nat Finkelstein , Christopher Makos and Felice Quinto ; and athletes Vitas Gerulaitis ( tennis ) and Jack Nicklaus ( golf ) .	exhibit
[MASK] observed the USI exhibit identifies and features Polaroids of fashion designer Halston , a former resident of Evansville .	Wikinews
University [MASK] across the United States also include Polaroids of " unknowns " who have not yet had their fifteen minutes of fame .	collections
[MASK] Thompson , curator and director of exhibits at the University of Arkansas , Fayetteville , said , " These images serve as documentation of people in his every day life and art - one which many of us enjoy a glimpse into . "	Cynthia
[MASK] was close to important touchstones of the 1960s , including art , music , consumer culture , fashion , and celebrity worship , which were all buzzwords and images Wikinews observed at USI 's opening exhibit .	Warhol
[MASK] was also an influential figure in the pop art movement .	He
" Pop art was about what popular American culture really thought was important " , [MASK] Waters said .	Kathryn
" [MASK] 's why he did the Campbell Soup cans or the Marilyn pictures , these iconic products of American culture whether they be in film , video or actually products we consumed .	That
So even back in the sixties , [MASK] was very aware of this part of our culture .	he
[MASK] as we all know in 2014 , has only increased probably a thousand fold . "	Which
" I think everybody knows Andy Warhol 's name , even non-art people , that 's a name they might know because he was such a personality " , [MASK] said .	Water
[MASK] Braysmith , USI associate professor of art history , said , " I think his photography is equally influential as his graphic works , his more famous pictures of Marilyn .	Hilary
In terms of the evolution of photography and experimentation , like painting on them or the celebrity fascination , [MASK] think he was really ground - breaking in that regard . "	I
The Polaroid [MASK] is not what made Warhol famous , however , he is in the company of other well - known photographers who used the camera , such as Ansel Adams , Chuck Close , Walker Evans , Robert Mapplethorpe , and Helmut Newton .	format
[MASK] said , " [ Warhol ] liked the way photo booths and the Polaroid 's front flash looked " .	Wilkins
[MASK] explained how Warhol 's adoption of the Polaroid camera revealed his process .	She
According to Wilkins , [MASK] was able to reproduce the Polaroid photograph and create an enlargement of it , which he then could use to commit the image to the silk screen medium by applying paint or manipulating them further .	Warhol
[MASK] of the silk screens exhibited at USI this time was the Annie Oakley screen print called " Cowboys and Indians " from 1987 .	One
[MASK] also said Warhol was both an artist and a businessperson .	Wilkins
" As a way to commercialize his work , [MASK] would make a blue Marilyn and a pink Marilyn and a yellow Marilyn , and then you could pick your favorite color and buy that .	he
[MASK] was a very practical salesman approach to his work .	It
[MASK] was very prolific but very business minded about that . "	He
" He wanted to be rich and famous and he made lots of choices to go that way " , [MASK] said .	Wilkins
[MASK] Perkins , a second year USI art major , admitted she was willing to skip class Thursday night to attend the opening exhibit but then circumstances allowed for her to attend the exhibit .	Kiara
Why did [MASK] so badly want to attend ?	she
" [MASK] 's Warhol .	It
[MASK] is a legend . "	He
For Kevin Allton , a USI instructor in English , [MASK] was also a legend .	Warhol
[MASK] said , " Andy Warhol was the center of the Zeitgeist for the 20th century and everything since .	He
[MASK] is a post-modern diety . "	He
[MASK] said he had only seen the Silver Clouds installation before in film .	Allton
The Silver Clouds [MASK] were silver balloons blown up with helium , and those balloons filled one of the smaller rooms in the gallery .	installation
" I thought that in real life it was really kind of magical , " [MASK] said .	Allton
" [MASK] smacked them around . "	I
In her opening remarks for attendees , [MASK] pointed out those features to attendees , noting the touches of the Warhol Factory , or the studio where he worked , that were present around them .	Waters
[MASK] pointed to the refreshment table with Campbell 's Soup served with " electric " Kool Aid and tables adorned with colorful gumball " pills " .	She
The [MASK] in the background was from such bands as The Velvet Underground .	music
The big [MASK] of the evening , Wikinews observed from the long line , was the Polaroid - room where attendees could wear a Warhol - like wig or don crazy glasses and have their own Polaroid taken .	hit
The [MASK] were ready in an instant and immediately displayed at the entry of the exhibit .	Polaroids
Exhibit [MASK] then became part of the very exhibit they had wanted to attend .	goers
In fact , many [MASK] Wikinews observed took out their mobiles as they left for the evening and used their own phone cameras to make one further record of the moment - a photo of a photo .	people
Perhaps [MASK] had learned an important lesson from the Warhol exhibit that cultural events like these were ripe for use and reuse .	they
[MASK] might even call these exit instant snap shots , the self selfie .	We
[MASK] analyse effects of global warming , atmospheric ozone on crops	Scientists
A research [MASK] from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and Colorado State University of the US and the University of Sheffield of the UK has analysed effects of global warming and ozone pollution over 2000 - 2050 on the worldwide production of wheat , rice , maize and soybean .	team
The [MASK] found reduction of crop yields by 2050 exceeded 10 % of 2000 levels , substantially decreasing food security , in all cases examined .	scientists
[MASK] estimated by 2050 , increasing population and changing diet would increase world food needs by 50 percent .	They
As coauthor Colette Heald told The Huffington Post , " The climate [MASK] are quite consistent [...]	projections
the [MASK] of ozone pollution is very different [...] leading to either offsetting or reinforcing effects [ of climate change ] on crops " .	future
By 2050 , [MASK] would increase by either 49 percent or by 27 percent , depending on the scenario .	undernourishment
The [MASK] focuses on ozone - temperature covariation : ground - level ozone increases with temperatures .	study
[MASK] said although temperature and ozone are separately known to impact crop yields , " nobody has looked at these together " .	Heald
Depending on region and crops , the [MASK] may be primarily sensitive to ozone - in the case of wheat - or heat - in the case of maize - alone , providing a local estimation of relative benefits of climate change adaptation versus ozone regulation .	yields
The U.S. [MASK] of Agriculture notes , " Ground - level ozone causes more damage to plants than all other air pollutants combined " , highlighting the importance of air quality for agriculture .	Department
[MASK] of NCLAN studies , published in a paper by AS Heagle in 1989 , show dicot species , such as soybean , cotton , and peanut , lose more yield from ozone than do monocot species such as sorghum , field corn , and winter wheat .	Results
The [MASK] found that ozone pollution caused 46 percent of previously heat - attributed damage to soybean crops .	researchers
The [MASK] does not include the effect of rising carbon dioxide concentration , which has complex and potentially offsetting impacts on global food supply .	model
The U.S. Environmental Protection [MASK] says some crops may have higher yields with increased levels of carbon dioxide .	Agency
However , global [MASK] also increases probability of extreme crops - damaging weather events such as floods , droughts , and extreme temperatures .	warming
Climate [MASK] affects distribution of weeds , pests , and diseases .	change
[MASK] noted the findings show pollution reduction is also important .	Heald
" An air - quality [MASK] would improve crop yields [...]	cleanup
[MASK] is something that we understand the causes of , and the steps that need to be taken to improve air quality . "	Ozone
As Heald told The Huffington Post , US surface [MASK] has dropped partly due to the Clean Air Act .	ozone
" Despite an increase in vehicle miles driven and energy consumption , surface [MASK] has declined by 25 percent on average across the U.S. from 1980 to 2012 [...]	ozone
However , the [MASK] of ozone air quality in the U.S. and around the world will depend on local emissions , the use of pollution control technology , regulations , and air quality policy . "	future
Greek [MASK] rules worship of ancient Greek deities is legal	court
Greek [MASK] has ruled that worshippers of the ancient Greek religion may now formally associate and worship at archeological sites .	court
Due to that , the [MASK] was relatively secretive .	religion
The Greek Orthodox [MASK] , a Christian denomination , is extremely critical of worshippers of the ancient deities .	Church
Today , about 100,000 [MASK] worship the ancient gods , such as Zeus , Hera , Poseidon , Aphrodite , and Athena .	Greeks
The Greek Orthodox [MASK] estimates that number is closer to 40,000 .	Church
Many neo - pagan [MASK] , such as Wicca , use aspects of ancient Greek religions in their practice ; Hellenic polytheism instead focuses exclusively on the ancient religions , as far as the fragmentary nature of the surviving source material allows .	religions
This universal [MASK] has enabled the peoples of the world to coordinate and harmonize their efforts in preserving peace and security , in achieving prosperity and upholding the values of human civilization .	forum
[MASK] would like to congratulate you , Mr. President , on being elected to preside over this august body and to express my confidence in your successful leadership .	I
[MASK] would also like , on behalf of Albania , to convey to the Secretary - General our highest appreciation for his leading contribution to the fulfilment of the historical mission of the United Nations and to the aspirations of our peoples for a better world in which only peace , democracy and economic prosperity reign .	I
This [MASK] of the General Assembly takes place in a milestone year for Europe .	session
Only a few months ago , a historic [MASK] vitalized the dream of a more united and stronger Europe .	event
[MASK] is working to strengthen the democratic institutions and capacities of its central and local government with a view to bringing its legislation and conditions into line with European Union standards , progressively achieving concrete and measurable results , as previously defined .	Albania
Determined to make our contribution to regional and global security , the Albanian [MASK] considers the country 's integration into NATO to be one of its major objectives .	Government
The NATO Istanbul [MASK] last June commended the progress made by my country in this regard and encouraged the deepening of reforms .	Summit
[MASK] welcomed Albania 's contribution to regional stability and cooperation and committed to assess our further progress at the next NATO summit , which would hopefully mark the start of negotiations for our full membership in the alliance .	It
[MASK] believe that the commitments set up in the framework of the Adriatic Charter are also contributing to meet NATO standards , to the benefit of regional stability and security .	We
[MASK] remain truly convinced that the respect and protection of human rights and freedoms are the main pillars of a pluralist democratic society .	We
The [MASK] of the Republic of Albania will continue to constantly demonstrate its commitment to a full implementation of the standards enshrined in the United Nations and Council of Europe conventions , as well as the relevant documents of regional organizations , such as the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe , in which we are playing a very active role .	Government
[MASK] will continue to do so in the future as well .	We
By adopting contemporary legislation and by becoming a party to other recently adopted international instruments on human rights , [MASK] has associated itself with countries that are enforcing a number of national strategies and programmes focusing on specific population groups , especially women , children , persons in need and minorities , among others .	Albania
In recent years , the Albanian [MASK] has started to periodically submit reports to the committees of the six main United Nations human rights treaties and is taking their recommendations into serious consideration .	Government
[MASK] , as one of the 191 signatory countries of the Millennium Declaration , remains fully committed to implementation of the Millennium Development Goals , which have been properly reflected in a national strategy for social and economic development .	Albania
The [MASK] of our sustained economic growth , which is at 6 to 7 per cent for the seventh consecutive year , is a good support base for the whole society to maintain higher standards of respect for human rights and to fight poverty and crime .	pattern
[MASK] would like to take this opportunity to thank the United Nations specialized agencies for their valuable assistance in support of the implementation of these objectives nationwide and on a central and local level .	I
The Albanian [MASK] is pleased to note that an ever - healthier climate of confidence and relations of bilateral and multilateral cooperation are prevailing in the South - Eastern European region .	Government
In implementing this policy , [MASK] is cooperating as never before with all the countries of the region by making borders less relevant , opening up to one regional market the implementation of free trade agreements and free movement corridors , and stimulating foreign direct investment .	Albania
[MASK] are especially cooperating with the common fight against organized crime and all kinds of illegal trafficking .	We
In the meantime , [MASK] is reinforcing its border management and control , guided by the European Union and NATO standards .	Albania
My [MASK] will hold general parliamentary elections by the middle of next year .	country
For us , the [MASK] and standards are more important than the results of the elections .	process
On its path towards European integration , the South - East European [MASK] is still facing pending challenges , such as the future of Kosovo .	region
[MASK] greatly appreciates the recent democratic and integration developments in Kosovo , thanks to the efforts of the respective peoples and the partnership of its self - governing institutions with the United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo ( UNMIK ) .	Albania
When I tour around Taiwan , of course , [MASK] also find people taking action without even waiting for the ministries to take action .	I
[MASK] is another of the g0v projects the environmental agency .	This
If you change the O to a zero , [MASK] get into them , considering environmental agency .	you
[MASK] is what people care about , the air quality , PM 2.5 in Taiwan .	This
More than 2,000 [MASK] , actually , installed these in their balconies , in their schools and so on , to get a real - time sensor of their IoT devices but not just IoT .	people
[MASK] also upload it to the public cloud , which then uploads it to a distributed ledger to make sure that nobody can modify those numbers after the fact .	They
After that , [MASK] see this kind of innovation is very rare in Asia .	we
When I talk to all the UN - related bodies , many other Asian [MASK] tell me that they wo n't let this network grow to be 2,000 nodes strong .	countries
If it 's 200 nodes strong , [MASK] will try to poach the leader to the government .	they
If the environmental agency group reports one number and your neighbors report another number , of course , [MASK] 're going to trust the one that you participated yourself , even though it 's a lower quality sensor .	you
Because of that , [MASK] 's very rare in Taiwan because we have an expanding civic space .	it
The [MASK] takes the approach of , " we ca n't beat them , let 's join them " .	government
[MASK] manufacture low - cost , high - precision sensors for them , but we also see this as a map of digital gap in Taiwan , a digital divide .	We
[MASK] set up points when the people do n't have the resource to go to , indigenous places , places in the mountains .	We
[MASK] also talk to the citizen scientists and they say they really want a point here to tell the air pollution from outside Taiwan or from inside Taiwan , domestically .	We
[MASK] can because we have wind turbines .	We
[MASK] 's electricity generators , power plants , over there .	That
[MASK] can install those sensor networks as part of the complementary action .	We
The [MASK] is this , it 's all open hardware .	beauty
[MASK] 's all open source .	It
[MASK] 's on GitHub .	It
[MASK] just download , put it onto Raspberry Pi , and then , you can do it yourself , as people have done over the world .	You
If you do n't change the source code , [MASK] uploads to the Taiwan network by default , so we kind of have the numbers of all the atmosphere and meteorological data .	it
[MASK] have a website dedicated for this , the Civil IoT project at CI.taiwan.gov.tw , that is basically , collective intelligence , meteorological , air quality , earthquake , and disaster prevention , and things like that .	We
[MASK] have single websites like this , CI for Collective Intelligence , AI for AI Taiwan , SI for Social Innovation , Smart Taiwan for the Smart Taiwan plan , and also , Bio Taiwan .	We
The medical [MASK] says , " You really should call it biomed.taiwan because bio and med are different things . "	industry
Biomed [MASK] goes to the same website as Bio Taiwan .	Taiwan
In any case , [MASK] we 're doing is now is breaking across ministry and municipality and national government because this says nothing about the level of the government or the departments .	what
[MASK] is one , single message that is collaboratively curated by everybody .	It
Through this , [MASK] solved not just our local social and environmental issues through economic approaches but using the SDGs as a map to unite the efforts together .	we
Just by saying " Taiwan can help " , [MASK] mean specifically , 17 , 18 , which is the availability of reliable data that people from across sectors , across jurisdictions , can trust the data .	we
Then , based on the data , [MASK] encourage cross-sectoral partnerships .	we
Then , based on that , [MASK] make open innovations that we , then , export , not as colonizers but , really , co-creators .	we
When I joined the cabinet two years ago , based on these ideas -- with a contract -- the [MASK] asked me for a job description , because they 've never seen anything like this before .	administration
Instead of a job description , [MASK] just wrote them a poem , a prayer , which I 'm going to read to you as a conclusion .	I
To me , [MASK] means the shift from IT or ICT to digital , the shift from the sectors separately as attack or an innovation , or whatever , into the humanity as a whole .	it
[MASK] is digital transformation for me .	This
[MASK] is , literally , my job description .	This
[MASK] goes like this .	It
Long years ago [MASK] made a tryst with destiny , and now the time comes when we shall redeem our pledge , not wholly or in full measure , but very substantially .	we
At the stroke of the midnight hour , when the world sleeps , [MASK] will awake to life and freedom .	India
A [MASK] comes , which comes but rarely in history , when we step out from the old to the new , when an age ends , and when the soul of a nation , long suppressed , finds utterance .	moment
At the dawn of history , [MASK] started on her unending quest , and trackless centuries are filled with her striving and grandeur of her success and failures .	India
Through good and ill fortune alike , [MASK] has never lost sight of that quest , forgotten the ideals which gave her strength .	she
[MASK] end today a period of misfortunes and India discovers herself again .	We
The [MASK] we celebrate today is but a step , an opening of opportunity to the greater triumphs and achievements that await us .	achievement
Are [MASK] brave enough and wise enough to grasp this opportunity and accept the challenge of the future ?	we
[MASK] and power bring responsibility .	Freedom
The [MASK] rests upon this Assembly , a sovereign body representing the sovereign people of India .	responsibility
Before the birth of freedom , [MASK] have endured all the pains of labour and our hearts are heavy with the memory of this sorrrow .	we
[MASK] of those pains continue even now .	Some
Nevertheless , the [MASK] is over and it is the future that beckons us now .	past
That [MASK] is not one of ease or resting but of incessant striving so that we may fulfill the pledges we have so often taken and the one we shall take today .	future
The [MASK] of India means , the service of the millions who suffer .	service
[MASK] means the ending of poverty and ignorance and poverty and disease and inequality of opportunity .	It
[MASK] may be beyond us , but as long as there are tears and suffering , so long our work will not be over .	That
And so [MASK] have to labour and to work , and to work hard , to give reality to our dreams .	we
Those [MASK] are for India , but they are also for the world , for all the nations and peoples are too closely knit together today for any one of them to imagine that it can live apart .	dreams
To the people of India , whose representatives we are , [MASK] make an appeal to join us with faith and confidence in this great adventure .	we
[MASK] is no time for petty and destructive criticism , no time for illwill or blaming others .	This
[MASK] have to build the noble mansion of free India where all her children may dwell .	We
The appointed [MASK] has come - the day appointed by destiny - and India stands forth again , after long slumber and struggle , awake , vital , free and independent .	day
The [MASK] clings on to us still in some measure and we have to do much before we redeem the pledges we have so often taken .	past
Yet the turning - [MASK] is past , and history begins anew for us , the history which we shall live and act and others will write about .	point
[MASK] is a fateful moment for us in India , for all Asia and for the world .	It
A new [MASK] rises , the star of freedom in the East , a new hope comes into being , a vision long cherished materializes .	star
May the [MASK] never set and that hope never be betrayed !	star
[MASK] rejoice in that freedom , even though clouds surround us , and many of our people are sorrowstricken and difficult problems encompass us .	We
But [MASK] brings responsibilities and burdens and we have to face them in the spirit of a free and disciplined people .	freedom
On this day our first [MASK] go to the architect of this freedom , the Father of our Nation , who , embodying the old spirit of India , held aloft the torch of freedom and lighted up the darkness that surrounded us .	thoughts
[MASK] have often been unworthy followers of his and have strayed from his message , but not only we but succeeding generations will remember this message and bear the imprint in their hearts of this great son of India , magnificent in his faith and strength and courage and humility .	We
[MASK] shall never allow that torch of freedom to be blown out , however high the wind or stormy the tempest .	We
Our next [MASK] must be of the unknown volunteers and soldiers of freedom who , without praise or reward , have served India even unto death .	thoughts
[MASK] think also of our brothers and sisters who have been cut off from us by political boundaries and who unhappily can not share at present in the freedom that has come .	We
[MASK] are of us and will remain of us whatever may happen , and we shall be sharers in their good [ or ] ill fortune alike .	They
The [MASK] beckons to us .	future
Whither do [MASK] go and what shall be our endeavour ?	we
[MASK] have hard work ahead .	We
[MASK] are citizens of a great country on the verge of bold advance , and we have to live up to that high standard .	We
[MASK] of us , to whatever religion we may belong , are equally the children of India with equal rights , privileges and obligations .	All
[MASK] can not encourage communalism or narrow - mindedness , for no nation can be great whose people are narrow in thought or in action .	We
To the nations and peoples of the world [MASK] send greetings and pledge ourselves to cooperate with them in furthering peace , freedom and democracy .	we
And to India , our much - loved motherland , the ancient , the eternal and the ever - new , [MASK] pay our reverent homage and we bind ourselves afresh to her service .	we
[MASK] thank the gentleman from New York , the distinguished Chair of the Judiciary Committee , for yielding and for his leadership in bringing this important legislation to the Floor .	I
And [MASK] commend Congresswoman Karen Bass , Madam Chair , for your great leadership in this important legislation .	I
Madam Speaker , nearly one year ago , [MASK] Floyd gasped his last words ,  I ca n't breathe ,  and ignited a nationwide reckoning on the racial injustice and police brutality in America .	George
[MASK] from every corner of the country took to the streets to peacefully protest violence against Black Americans , waving Black Lives Matter flags , chanting the names of the murdered , repeating George Floyd 's dying words ,  I ca n't breathe . 	Americans
[MASK] turned their agony into action , but tragically , despite these mass protests , the injustice , killings continued .	They
Those [MASK] were global .	protests
[MASK] were all over the world .	They
Here , as Members of Congress and as Americans , [MASK] can not accept this epidemic of injustice .	we
[MASK] can not stay silent when one  when our most vulnerable and historically marginalized communities , people of color , those living in poverty , Americans with disabilities are being targeted and sometimes killed .	We
[MASK] is why , today , the House will again pass the George Floyd Justice in Policing Act and send it to the Senate and the President 's desk so that it can finally become the law of the land .	That
[MASK] salute Congresswoman Karen Bass who has been relentless , persistent and absolutely courageous in her leadership on this legislation .	I
The George Floyd Justice in Policing [MASK] fundamentally transforms the culture of policing with strong , unprecedented reforms .	Act
This [MASK] will not erase centuries of systemic racism and excessive policing in America .	legislation
[MASK] will not bring back George Floyd , Breonna Taylor  say her name , Breonna Taylor  Ahmaud Arbery , or the countless other men and women who died or were senselessly injured .	It
But [MASK] will make a tremendous  take a tremendous step toward  or to stop the violence , stem the suffering and start to build a healthier , better relationship between law enforcement and communities that they respect .	it
[MASK] of us here salute and are proudly , profoundly grateful to our law enforcement heroes .	All
[MASK] grew up in a family , public service family .	I
My [MASK] , my whole life at home , was Mayor of Baltimore .	father
My [MASK] was Mayor later , Thomas DAlesandro , in Baltimore .	brother
And [MASK] had a motto about the police :  Be true to the men in blue . 	they
Of course [MASK] was a long time ago and they were all men .	this
[MASK] of us here , again , salute and profoundly grateful for our law enforcement heroes .	All
As the National Organization of Black Law Enforcement Executives writes ,  The [MASK] of this act is paramount in achieving the fundamental principle of a police force that protects and serves every citizen of their community with fairness , accountability and transparency in their actions . 	passage
The Democratic [MASK] , together with the Biden - Harris Administration , is committed to not only ensuring that this legislation becomes law , but to take further action to end violence and advance justice in America .	Congress
[MASK] could n't be in your committee room because of COVID , but they came and they asked me that day , they said ,  Madam Speaker , will you name this bill for our brother ? 	We
[MASK] , his brother , asked that question .	Philonise
[MASK] said ,  Only if you think it is worthy of your brother . 	I
[MASK] think of George Floyd at least once a day  sometimes more .	I
And [MASK] know why ?	you
As I 'm washing my hands for 20 seconds , after about eight or nine seconds , [MASK] 'm thinking	I
 [MASK] is taking forever .	This
[MASK] ca n't do this for 20 seconds .	I
