And then [MASK] think of George Floyd .	I
[MASK] 's a long time .	That
[MASK] 's a long time , as Congresswoman Dean said , calling out for his mother , extending love to his family .	It
With that , Madam Speaker , [MASK] urge a strong , bipartisan vote on the George Floyd Justice in Policing Act .	I
[MASK] thank Karen Bass again , Madam Chair .	I
And [MASK] yield back the balance of my time .	I
The [MASK] of the United Nations sends a clear message to us all : put people first .	Charter
The first [MASK] of the Charter ,  We the peoples  , are a summons to place people at the centre of our work  every day , everywhere .	words
Those [MASK] are not a favour to be rewarded or withheld ; they are an endowment for simply being human .	rights
Throughout the first half of my mandate , [MASK] have had the good fortune to meet people around the world , not in gilded meeting rooms but where they live , work and dream .	I
And [MASK] have listened .	I
[MASK] have heard families in the South Pacific who fear their lives being swept away by rising seas ; young refugees in the Middle East yearning for a return to school and home ; Ebola survivors in North Kivu struggling to rebuild their lives ; women demanding equality and opportunity ; people of all beliefs and traditions who suffer simply because of who they are ; and so many others .	I
[MASK] are living in a world of disquiet .	We
A great many [MASK] fear getting trampled , thwarted , left behind .	people
[MASK] take their jobs , traffickers take their dignity , demagogues take their rights , warlords take their lives , fossil fuels take their futures .	Machines
And yet [MASK] believe in the spirit and ideas that bring us to this Hall .	people
[MASK] believe in the United Nations .	They
But do [MASK] believe in us ?	they
Do [MASK] believe that , as leaders , we will put people first ?	they
[MASK] the leaders must deliver for we the peoples .	We
[MASK] have the right to live in peace .	People
One year ago in this Hall , [MASK] spoke of winds of hope despite the chaos and confusion of our world ( see A/73/PV.6 ) .	I
Since then , [MASK] of those currents have continued to move in promising directions .	some
Against the expectations of many , [MASK] unfolded peacefully in Madagascar , the Maldives and the Democratic Republic of the Congo , to name just a few places .	elections
[MASK] and the Republic of North Macedonia resolved their decades - long name dispute .	Greece
Political [MASK] in the Sudan and the peace process in the Central African Republic have brought renewed hope .	dialogue
My Special [MASK] just left Damascus after finalizing the last details with the Government and the opposition .	Envoy
The United [MASK] looks forward to convening the committee in Geneva in the coming weeks .	Nations
However , across the global landscape , [MASK] see conflicts persisting , terrorism spreading and the risk of a new arms race growing .	we
Outside [MASK] , often in violation of Security Council resolutions , make peace processes more difficult .	interferences
Many [MASK] remain unresolved , from Yemen and Libya to Afghanistan and beyond .	situations
A [MASK] of unilateral actions threatens to thwart a two - State solution between Israel and Palestine .	succession
In Venezuela , 4 million [MASK] have fled the country  one of the largest displacements in the world .	people
Above all , [MASK] are facing the alarming possibility of armed conflict in the Gulf , the consequences of which the world can not afford .	we
The recent [MASK] on Saudi Arabia s oil facilities was completely unacceptable .	attack
In a context where a minor miscalculation can lead to a major confrontation , [MASK] must do everything possible to push for reason and restraint .	we
[MASK] hope for a future in which all the countries of the region can live in a state of mutual respect and cooperation , without interference in each other s affairs .	I
[MASK] hope equally that it will still be possible to preserve the progress on nuclear non-proliferation represented by the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action .	I
From the first day , [MASK] have emphasized prevention , mediation and a surge in diplomacy for peace in order to address the crises that we face .	I
Across some of the most troubled corners of the world , some 100,000 United Nations [MASK] protect civilians and promote peace .	peacekeepers
Through the Action for Peacekeeping initiative , [MASK] are strengthening our effectiveness and efficiency and we are renewing partnerships with troop - and police - contributing countries , host countries and regional organizations , such as the African Union and the European Union .	we
[MASK] am also proud of the work of our humanitarian workers , easing suffering around the world .	I
This year alone , in brutal attacks and other circumstances , [MASK] have lost at least 80 peacekeepers , humanitarian workers and others , all of whom gave their lives serving the United Nations and trying to better the lives of others .	we
[MASK] honour their service and their sacrifice .	I
[MASK] have bolstered our counter-terrorism architecture and defined new strategies to tackle violent extremism and to address root causes , while respecting human rights .	We
[MASK] have put forward a new disarmament agenda to advance global peace .	I
[MASK] must work to address the heightened threat posed by ballistic missiles and ensure a successful 2020 Review Conference of the Parties to the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons .	We
The [MASK] of the Korean peninsula remains uncertain .	situation
[MASK] fully support the efforts towards a new summit between the President of the United States and the leader of the Democratic People s Republic of Korea .	I
[MASK] fear the possibility of a great fracture  the world splitting in two , with the two largest economies on Earth creating two separate and competing worlds , each with their own dominant currency , trade and financial rules , their own Internet and artificial intelligence capacities and their own zero - sum geopolitical and military strategies .	I
[MASK] must do everything possible to avert the great fracture and maintain a universal system  a universal economy with universal respect for international law , a multipolar world with strong multilateral institutions .	We
Mr. President , [MASK] need to catch my breath , so much has happened .	I
[MASK] have turned the page to a new chapter in the history of our democracy , and I am full of hope .	We
[MASK] would challenge anyone not to feel hopeful today after listening to Amanda Gorman , the amazing 22  year - old poet , wise far beyond her years , who told us that :	I
Somehow [MASK] ve weathered and witnessed a nation that is nt broken but simply unfinished	we
The [MASK] she spoke about  the strong and happy hope  the hope we feel today , is a hope , of course , that is tempered by reality .	hope
[MASK] was an inauguration unlike most others .	This
The [MASK] that customarily line the National Mall were absent , a reminder that our Nation is still in the throes of a deadly pandemic .	crowds
The [MASK] of thousands of National Guardsmen , police , and Secret Service was a reminder that 2 weeks ago , in this very room and on those very steps where President Biden took the oath , a mob of violent criminals tried to dismantle our democracy  our sacred democracy  brick by brick and would try again if they could .	presence
But , as President Biden said a few hours ago , today , [MASK] has prevailed , the will of the people was heeded , and the peaceful transfer of power fulfilled .	democracy
[MASK] Biden is now the 46th President of the United States .	Joe
[MASK] HARRIS is now the 49th Vice President of the United States .	KAMALA
But , of course , in more ways than one , [MASK] is not the 49th but the first  the first African - American woman , the first Asian - American woman , and the first woman , period , to hold the Office of Vice Presidency in our Nation s history .	she
Today , the [MASK] to our democracy from the Presidency itself has ended , but the challenges we face as a nation remain .	threat
In the wake of violence and division , hatred and mistruth , in the shadow of disease and economic hardship , a warming planet and unequal society , [MASK] begin the work of the 117th Congress .	we
In his inaugural address , [MASK] Biden spoke to this moment  a moment of great challenge  and told us two simple truths : One , that our responsibilities are numerous , and , two , it will take unity  unity of spirit , unity of purpose  to fulfill them .	President
President Biden , [MASK] heard you loud and clear .	we
[MASK] have a lengthy agenda , and we need to get it done together .	We
[MASK] Biden pointed the way to our Nation s recovery and renewal .	President
[MASK] reminded us of who we are and where we need to go , but we must now turn the spirit of his words into action .	He
The [MASK] must immediately set to work on the mission President Biden described  restoring the greatness and goodness of America .	Senate
[MASK] will be an exceptionally busy and consequential period for the U.S. Senate .	This
A few moments ago , the [MASK] welcomed three new Members to this Chamber .	Senate
[MASK] can now happily and proudly call them Senator PADILLA , Senator OSSOFF , and Senator WARNOCK .	I
[MASK] join Senators KELLY , HICKENLOOPER , and Lujn as part of a six - Member class of Democratic Senators and a new Democratic Senate majority .	They
[MASK] mention the historic nature of Vice President HARRIS  ascendance , but let s not forget that her successor , ALEX PADILLA , is the first Latino Senator to represent California ; that RAFAEL WARNOCK , born while Georgia was represented in this Chamber by two staunch segregationists , is now the first African - American Senator Georgia has ever elected ; and that JOHN OSSOFF is the first Jewish Senator from his State , sworn in today on a book of Hebrew Scripture once owned by the rabbi , who , decades ago , formed a bond between the Jewish and African - American communities of Georgia .	I
With the swearing in of these three Senators , the [MASK] will turn to Democratic control , for which I deeply thank my colleagues .	Senate
[MASK] will return to Democratic control under the first New York - born majority leader in American history  a kid from Brooklyn , the son of an exterminator and a housewife , and a descendant of victims of the Holocaust .	We
Today , [MASK] feel the full weight of that responsibility , a sense of reverence and of awe at the trust placed in me .	I
[MASK] intend to honor that trust with all of my energy and with joy .	I
And as the majority changes in the Senate , the [MASK] will do business differently .	Senate
The [MASK] will address the challenges our country faces head on and without delay , not with timid solutions but with boldness and with courage .	Senate
The [MASK] will tackle the perils of the moment , a once - in - a - generation health and economic crisis , and it will strive to make progress on generations - long struggle for racial justice , economic justice , equality of opportunity , and equality under the law .	Senate
This [MASK] will legislate .	Senate
[MASK] will be active , responsive , energetic , and bold .	It
And to my Republican colleagues , when and where we can , the Democratic [MASK] will strive to make this important work bipartisan .	majority
The [MASK] works best when we work together .	Senate
[MASK] have no choice .	We
The [MASK] we face are great .	challenges
The [MASK] in the country are real .	divisions
[MASK] have no choice but to try to work together every day to reward the faith the American people have placed in us .	We
[MASK] yield the floor .	I
[MASK] is the 37th time I have spoken to you from this office , where so many decisions have been made that shaped the history of this Nation .	This
Each time [MASK] have done so to discuss with you some matter that I believe affected the national interest .	I
In all the decisions I have made in my public life , [MASK] have always tried to do what was best for the Nation .	I
Throughout the long and difficult period of Watergate , [MASK] have felt it was my duty to persevere , to make every possible effort to complete the term of office to which you elected me .	I
As long as there was such a base , [MASK] felt strongly that it was necessary to see the constitutional process through to its conclusion , that to do otherwise would be unfaithful to the spirit of that deliberately difficult process and a dangerously destabilizing precedent for the future .	I
But with the disappearance of that base , [MASK] now believe that the constitutional purpose has been served , and there is no longer a need for the process to be prolonged .	I
[MASK] would have preferred to carry through to the finish , whatever the personal agony it would have involved , and my family unanimously urged me to do so .	I
But the [MASK] of the Nation must always come before any personal considerations .	interests
From the discussions I have had with Congressional and other leaders , [MASK] have concluded that because of the Watergate matter , I might not have the support of the Congress that I would consider necessary to back the very difficult decisions and carry out the duties of this office in the way the interests of the Nation will require .	I
[MASK] have never been a quitter .	I
But as President , [MASK] must put the interests of America first .	I
[MASK] needs a full - time President and a full - time Congress , particularly at this time with problems we face at home and abroad .	America
Therefore , [MASK] shall resign the Presidency effective at noon tomorrow .	I
As I recall the high hopes for America with which we began this second term , [MASK] feel a great sadness that I will not be here in this office working on your behalf to achieve those hopes in the next 2 1/2 years .	I
But in turning over direction of the Government to Vice President Ford , [MASK] know , as I told the Nation when I nominated him for that office 10 months ago , that the leadership of America will be in good hands .	I
In passing this office to the Vice President , [MASK] also do so with the profound sense of the weight of responsibility that will fall on his shoulders tomorrow and , therefore , of the understanding , the patience , the cooperation he will need from all Americans .	I
As he assumes that responsibility , [MASK] will deserve the help and the support of all of us .	he
By taking this action , [MASK] hope that I will have hastened the start of that process of healing which is so desperately needed in America .	I
[MASK] regret deeply any injuries that may have been done in the course of the events that led to this decision .	I
[MASK] would say only that if some of my judgments were wrong -- and some were wrong -- they were made in what I believed at the time to be the best interest of the Nation .	I
To those who have stood with me during these past difficult months -- to my family , my friends , to many others who joined in supporting my cause because they believed it was right -- [MASK] will be eternally grateful for your support .	I
[MASK] shall leave this office with regret at not completing my term , but with gratitude for the privilege of serving as your President for the past 5 1/2 years .	I
These [MASK] have been a momentous time in the history of our Nation and the world .	years
[MASK] have been a time of achievement in which we can all be proud , achievements that represent the shared efforts of the Administration , the Congress , and the people .	They
But the [MASK] ahead are equally great , and they , too , will require the support and the efforts of the Congress and the people working in cooperation with the new Administration .	challenges
[MASK] have ended America 's longest war , but in the work of securing a lasting peace in the world , the goals ahead are even more far - reaching and more difficult .	We
[MASK] must complete a structure of peace so that it will be said of this generation , our generation of Americans , by the people of all nations , not only that we ended one war but that we prevented future wars .	We
[MASK] have unlocked the doors that for a quarter of a century stood between the United States and the People 's Republic of China .	We
[MASK] must now ensure that the one quarter of the world 's people who live in the People 's Republic of China will be and remain not our enemies , but our friends .	We
[MASK] am proud to come here to Philadelphia and join my fellow Democrats .	I
In 1960 , the [MASK] of this city produced a margin in the presidential race that was in this city three times as large as it was in the whole United States .	Democrats
So [MASK] am proud to be back here again , and I am very happy to be introduced by your distinguished chairman , Bill Green .	I
[MASK] can understand why some Republicans may not like it , but , as a Democrat , as one who believes in the Democratic Party , as one who believes that the Democratic Party has meant progress for this city , this State , and this country , I am proud to be here in Philadelphia .	I
And [MASK] am proud to be here with your mayor .	I
[MASK] do not come from Philadelphia , and I would not interfere , but I am hopeful and confident that when we come to the Army - Navy game in a month from now , we will be greeted by the new mayor of Philadelphia , Mayor Tale .	I
[MASK] have n't given a political speech for about 3 years , so I am a little out of practice , but I am gradually getting back into it .	I
And [MASK] am glad to be here with a mayor who follows two other distinguished mayors of this city , who carries on their tradition - Joe Clark , your United States Senator who was a great mayor of Philadelphia , and Dick Dilworth , who followed him , who was a great mayor of Philadelphia .	I
[MASK] is the tradition of honest , progressive democratic government that Mayor Tate carries on .	That
And [MASK] am glad to be here with Judge Hoffman and Senator Mahady who also run this fall in the State of Pennsylvania .	I
[MASK] expects things of Presidents , but I am not sure that they realize how much depends upon the Members of the House and the Members of the Senate who must make the final judgment on what kind of laws a President must execute .	Everyone
The [MASK] from this city as well as the Senator from this State - Bill Barrett and Bob Nix and Herman Toll and Jim Byrne and Chairman Green - have , with Joe Clark supported legislation month in and month out that benefited this city and this State and this country and , what is more , has helped make the United States meet its responsibilities around the globe .	Congressmen
And [MASK] am also proud to be here with your former Governor who is now working for us in Washington as our adviser on fair housing , Governor Dave Lawrence , of the State of Pennsylvania .	I
Three years ago tomorrow night , [MASK] spoke in this hall in the closing days of the 1960 campaign , and I asked the people of this city to give us their support to help this country move again .	I
The [MASK] of Philadelphia gave that support , and the support I received from this city and this State was , as it was in the 1960 convention , the key to our victory across the country .	people
[MASK] am back in Philadelphia to express my thanks for that support and also to express appreciation for the help we received from those Democrats in this city and State , and to report to you on the progress that this country has made on the goals that were outlined 3 years ago .	I
[MASK] did not promise on that October night that life would be easy in the Great Republic .	I
[MASK] did not say we would not have new pressures and new problems .	I
Nor did [MASK] speak of swift solutions in 100 days in office .	I
[MASK] talked instead about the kind of America that I wanted for my family and for your family and all those who are citizens of this country in these difficult and changing years , the kind of America in which I believed , not as a Democrat or as a candidate , but as a citizen .	I
Today , in many ways , the [MASK] looks very different , and the revolutionary change of pace is even more rapid than it has been in the past .	world
[MASK] still believe in the kind of America which I described in this hall 3 years ago , and I am still determined that this Nation shall continue to strive to meet those goals .	I
And [MASK] am gratified to be able to report some progress in the last 33 1/2 months .	I
[MASK] said , first of all , that I believed in America where work was available to those who were willing and able to work , where the waste of idle men and machines could be avoided , and where greater economic growth could provide the new jobs and the new markets that our growing Nation needed .	I
And our high wartime tax [MASK] still prevent our economy from growing as fully and as freely as it must .	rates
But one fact is that 2 1/2 million [MASK] more are working in the United States than were working 33 months ago .	people
And if we can obtain the early passage of an effective tax cut which the House of Representatives has already passed -- and which the Ways and Means Committee , on which Bill Green serves , wrote -- [MASK] shall be sailing this country next year on the longest and strongest peacetime expansion of our economy in the history of the United States .	we
[MASK] is well within our reach .	It
[MASK] would like to begin by sincerely thanking Creative Commons Africa community and under the able coordination of Alex Gakuru and Tobias Schonwetter , and the global Creative Commons Community for inviting me to preside over this launch .	I
[MASK] am happy to note the enthusiasm demonstrated by School of Open Africa in transforming education along Sustainable Development Goals proposed for post - 2015 ( Goal No. 4 :  Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote life - long learning opportunities for all  ) and in line with the Kenya Vision 2030 which seeks to transform Kenya into a middle - income country that offers high quality of life to all citizens by the year 2030 .	I
[MASK] am happy to note how much School of Open Africa has grown in Kenya and embraced in countries like Senegal , Nigeria , and South Africa among other African countries in the last few years .	I
[MASK] is a signatory to the UNESCO s 2012 Paris Declaration on Open Education Resources licensed under Creative Commons open licenses .	Kenya
The [MASK] of open education resources improves the quality of teaching and learning , including by accelerating student comprehension and by providing more opportunities for the realisation of universal access to education .	use
Open Educational [MASK] ( OER ) are teaching , learning , and research materials in any medium that reside in the public domain or have been released under an open license that permits their free use and re-purposing by others .	Resources
Fully aware of the role of education in a country s development agenda , [MASK] am sure that the new initiatives being undertaken by School of Open Africa , the Creative Commons and UNESCO are making their contribution towards the social , economic , and political pillars which are the three fundamental cornerstones of our country , and indeed for our great continent .	I
[MASK] are now in the second medium term plan cycle ( 2013 - 2017 ) whose theme is  Transforming Kenya : Pathways to Devolution , Socio-economic Development , Equity and National Unity  .	We
As you may be aware , the ICT [MASK] rolled out the National ICT Master plan that will set the pace for progression of the country in ICT for the next five years .	Authority
The Master [MASK]  once fully rolled out  will completely transform government processes , services and management , and make information access and service delivery more efficient .	plan
Again , the Master [MASK] , with the flagship projects to pilot its implementation , will steer the march towards the digital future that will transform the country to a regional technical hub , raise the country s competitiveness and align the country in line with vision 2030 s ICT goals .	plan
By launching the Kenya ICT Master Plan , the [MASK] revealed its commitment towards the enhancement of access to quality education and training through ICT in line with the Millennium Development Goals ( MDGs ) .	government
[MASK] are reviewing the National ICT Policy Guidelines to ensure alignment with proposed Sustainable Development Goals .	We
As a country , [MASK] are also privileged to have a National ICT Policy whose goal is to create a prosperous ICT - driven Kenyan society .	we
[MASK] provides a platform that enables the realization of these goals .	ICT
[MASK] must emphasize that Creative Commons through the School of Open Africa has provided a good example of innovative use of ICT in education that resonates well with the Kenya National ICT Master Plan .	I
The [MASK] of ICT into educational programmes places both the teaching staff and students at the forefront in the utilization of ICT for the enhancement of lives .	integration
[MASK] note with great pleasure the freedom to re-purpose offered by openly licensed educational resources , the convenience online access to learners as alternative courses delivery and certification methods .	I
At this juncture , ladies and gentlemen , [MASK] thank William Fisher III , Professor of Intellectual Property and his staff at the Berkman Centre for Internet and Society at Harvard Law School for providing a free copyright law course taught to graduands present today to receive their certificates .	I
[MASK] also thank Michael Murungi ( then CEO , National Council for Law Reporting or  Kenya Law  ) and Alex Gakuru for successfully conducting the course in Nairobi .	I
[MASK] must congratulate the former students and ask to make the very best use of the copyright law knowledge they acquired while also challenging all universities represented here to consider emulating the highly successfully CopyrightX initiative .	I
As the government continues to work on modalities of ensuring universal access to education and increasing the internet penetration in all parts of the country , [MASK] are pleased to witness this mode of study that will definitely translate to affordable education .	we
Open Education [MASK] coupled with innovative use of ICT in education will accelerate realization of a modern Kenya that will be a knowledge - based economy .	Resources
By using Open Educational Resources , OER , [MASK] of Open is opening up to many students who would have otherwise missed the opportunity of accessing education , especially in the marginalized areas which could not adequately access quality education .	School
Ongoing , voluntary , and self - motivated [MASK] of knowledge for either personal or professional reasons is one of the characteristics of the 21st Century .	pursuit
[MASK] of the major ways of promoting life - long learning is the continuous use of ICT innovations in education .	One
[MASK] congratulate School of Open teams across Africa for the innovative and transformative mode of teaching and learning that we are launching today .	I
This African [MASK] is a worthy model for other regions of the world to emulate .	initiative
As I conclude [MASK] take this opportunity to applaud UNESCO s efforts and contribution in the development and growth of the country through this noble initiative that enables the primary , secondary and universities to optimize the use of Information and Communication Technology ( ICT ) in learning .	I
[MASK] acknowledge the generous financial support from the Hewlett Foundation and SOO Africa teams support by Google .	I
[MASK] am very honored to be with you all .	I
[MASK] Joe Biden and I talk often about our mutual passion for everything you all do .	President
[MASK] is a very exciting moment to join you for the unveiling of the work that you have been laboring on for decades .	This
So , yes , as Chair of the National Space Council , [MASK] know that today represents an exciting new chapter in the exploration of our universe .	I
From the beginning of history , [MASK] have looked up to the night sky with wonder .	humans
And thanks to dedicated people who have been working for decades in engineering and on scientific marvels , [MASK] can look to the sky with new understanding .	we
When NASA launched the Hubble Space Telescope in 1990 , [MASK] were able to see the stars unobstructed by the Earth s atmosphere and understand the universe in ways we could have never imagined even a few decades earlier .	we
And now [MASK] enter a new phase of scientific discovery .	we
Building on the legacy of Hubble , the James Webb Space [MASK] allows us to see deeper into space than ever before and in stunning clarity .	Telescope
[MASK] will enhance what we know about the origins of our universe , our solar system , and possibly life itself .	It
And [MASK] is an example of how the scientific endeavor can build upon the international rules and norms that govern our cooperation in space .	it
This [MASK] is one of humanity s great engineering achievements .	telescope
And the [MASK] we will see today are a testament to the amazing work done by the thousands of workers across our nation who dedicated years to this project .	images
[MASK] embarked on this complex endeavor for the benefit of humankind , and in the process , accelerated American innovation , strengthened partnerships with our allies , and will undoubtedly inspire generations to look to the heavens with excitement and ambition .	They
And [MASK] was going to say  good afternoon ,  but we re starting this meeting late because I was engaged in preparing for a trip to the Middle East .	I
But [MASK] is a historic day .	today
Bill , [MASK] re a good friend .	you
And  and , Dr. Nelson , [MASK] re doing a great job leading this Office of Science and Technology Policy .	you
It really is a matter  [MASK] really is amazing .	it
Six and a half months ago , a [MASK] launched from Earth carrying the world s newest , most powerful deep - space telescope on a journey one million miles into the cosmos  first of all , that blows my mind : a million miles into the cosmos  along the way unfolding itself , deploying a mirror 21 feet wide , a sunshield the size of a tennis court , and 250,000 tiny shutters , each one smaller than a grain of sand .	rocket
Put together , [MASK] s a new window into the history of our universe .	it
And today , [MASK] re going to get a glimpse of the first light to shine through that window  light from other worlds , orbiting stars far beyond our own .	we
[MASK] s astounding to me when I read this and saw the  I mean , it really is .	It
It s  it s  anyway , I do nt want to  [MASK] ll see what they think when we see this .	I
[MASK] s hard to even fathom .	It
Tomorrow , when this image is shared with the world , [MASK] will be a historic moment for science and technology , for astronomy and space exploration , for America and all of humanity .	it
You know , as an international collaboration , this [MASK] embodies how America leads the world not by the example of our power , but the power of our example .	telescope
A partnership with others , [MASK] symbolizes the relentless spirit of American ingenuity .	it
And [MASK] shows what we can achieve , what more we can discover , not just about distant places , but about our very own planet and climate , like NASA s Earth System Observatory that we launched last year .	it
[MASK] s why the federal government must invest  must invest in science and technology , more than we have in the past .	That
These [MASK] are going to remind the world that America can do big things .	images
And [MASK] ll remind the American people , especially our children , that there s nothing beyond our capacity  nothing beyond our capacity .	they
