You
[MASK] can also go to Porte d'Enfer , a beautiful still stripe of sea between a scenery of reefs .	You
[MASK] stands the biggest shopping mall of the island .	Here
Not too far from there , [MASK] can find a local bar / nightclub named Bik Kreyol , Beau Soleil , 0590258046 or 0590920648 ( Entrance  5 , Drinks  3 ) .	you
The [MASK] is typical , it 's a former warehouse .	building
[MASK] are within 5  10 minutes walking distance from the nearest parking lot , some require at least 3  4 hours of hiking ( those are , of course less frequented by other tourists and you might find yourself alone at a spectacular waterfall in the middle of nowhere - an amazing experience ! ) .	Some
The local rum [MASK] offer tours ( check for opening times as they may very from season to season ) which are certainly worth the while since rum production is a very integral part of Guadeloupe 's economy .	distilleries
Even though they might not be the best way to get around the island , a [MASK] on the bus is still an experience you should not miss .	ride
Cheap , full of locals , conducted by fearless drivers , [MASK] can enjoy the beautiful Caribbean panorama to the sound of Guadeloupean zouk music .	you
Some [MASK] are not good for passengers with weak stomachs .	routes
[MASK] ( Persian :  , also known as Esfahan ) is a city in central Iran , south of Tehran and is the capital of Isfahan Province .	Isfahan
The [MASK] call it " Nesf - e - Jahan " , meaning " Half The World " .	Persians
Today , textile and steel [MASK] take their place .	mills
Its [MASK] , tree - lined boulevards and relaxed pace make it one of the highlights of Iran .	architecture
The [MASK] is 430 km south of Tehran at the foothills of the Zagros mountain range .	city
The [MASK] enjoys a temperate climate and regular seasons .	city
The [MASK] has an Armenian Quarter called Jolfa ( originally called New Julfa ) established by Shah Abbas I in the 1600s after he destroyed the prosperous Armenian town of Julfa in Armenia and forced all of the Armenians to move to Persia , mostly to Isfahan .	city
Today the [MASK] still has many Armenian Churches , an Armenian school , shops and Armenian residents .	quarter
Isfahan International [MASK] or Isfahan Shahid Beheshti ( IATA : IFN ) was a military air base before the revolution .	Airport
From the Airport [MASK] can take cab for c. IRR 200,000 to the city centre .	you
Since most people are going there anyway , [MASK] can always ask people to share taxi .	you
The [MASK] contains two mosques , a palace , and the bazaar .	square
The [MASK] is the largest historical public square in the world after Tiananmen Square in Beijing and it is a UNESCO World Heritage Site .	square
[MASK] a very popular place for locals to picnic on Friday and holiday evenings .	This
1596 , dating from the Saffavid era , the [MASK] is the most historically famous in all of Persia .	avenue
The stunning [MASK] of Isfahan are among the most beautiful and interesting in the world .	mosques
Built during the Safavid period , [MASK] is an excellent example of Islamic architecture of Iran , and regarded as one of the masterpieces of Persian Architecture .	it
Its [MASK] is mainly due to the beauty of its seven - colour mosaic tiles and calligraphic inscriptions .	splendour
Started in AD 842 , [MASK] is the first Islamic building to adopt the four - courtyard layout of Sassanid palaces .	this
[MASK] is forty - eight meters high and there are seven floors , each accessible by a difficult spiral staircase .	It
[MASK] is rich in naturalistic wall paintings by Reza Abbassi , the court painter of Shah Abbas I , and his pupils .	It
It's Persian [MASK] is one of nine inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List .	Gardens
[MASK] ( Pronounced : Wootch ) is Poland 's third biggest city , and the capital of the dzkie Voivodship .	d
In recent years , [MASK] has been battling rising unemployment and youth migration resulting from the failing textile industry and is repositioning itself as a hub for design and creative industries .	d
Owing to its history , [MASK] has an impressive collection of residential , commercial and industrial 19th - century architecture including some of Europe 's largest factory buildings , now mostly repurposed as shopping centres or lofts .	d
Recent local [MASK] and a long - standing cultural scene ensures there is always something more to do than just sightseeing or shopping , with the city hosting some of the best museums and art galleries in the country .	investment
The close [MASK] of Warsaw and d 's location at the crossroads of the Polish motorway system make it an ideal destination for a day trip or longer city break .	proximity
The [MASK] of the city 's name is unknown , however , the word d translates to " boat " in English .	origin
However , the real [MASK] of d started with the industrial era at the beginning of the 19th century when the city was chosen to be the heart of the rapidly - growing textile industry .	development
The [MASK] of d soared from some 4,000 people in the 1830s and 40,000 in 1865 to over 300,000 inhabitants at the turn of the century , which was an unprecedented growth on a worldwide scale .	population
New [MASK] , craftsmen and merchants came to d ; markets and town fairs came to life .	inhabitants
The [MASK] obtained from prosperous textile mills opened up practically unlimited possibilities for their owners .	profits
The city [MASK] became expressions of the riches and power of the local tycoons .	residences
Ever since the industrial revolution brought a massive influx of workforce , [MASK] had been a city almost equally divided between four cultures - Polish , Jewish , German and Russian .	d
Andrzej Wajda 's [MASK] , Promised Land based on a novel by the Nobel laureate Wadysaw Reymont , depicts those times and is a worthwhile introduction to the city 's bustling history .	movie
Although the city was not destroyed in the aftermath , the material [MASK] were serious as the machinery , raw materials and finished goods were taken away by the fleeing Nazis .	losses
The day before the liberation , about 80,000 [MASK] left d in panic .	Germans
Since the fall of communism in Poland , [MASK] has not enjoyed the rapid economic growth cities like Krakw , Warsaw and Wrocaw have experienced , and has had to endure the fall of much of its textile industry , rising unemployment and emigration ( within Poland and abroad ) .	d
[MASK] led to further dilapidation of the investment - starved city , and many of its streets and buildings show profound signs of neglect .	This
However , the [MASK] is rapidly changing now with d campaigning and redesigning itself as an up - and - coming destination .	situation
To accomplish this , [MASK] has been capitalizing on its film history - d is jokingly referred to as the " Hollyd " of Poland and hosts several film festivals and many other cultural events .	d
[MASK] today may not have the glitz and glamour of its heyday ; however , there is a certain charm to d in its partially renovated faades and leitmotivs , not to mention its grand artistic traditions .	d
[MASK] is the capital of the state of Yucatn in Mexico .	Mrida
[MASK] has a population of about 750,000 , and is the largest city in the Yucatn Peninsula .	It
[MASK] is a city of contrasts .	Mrida
[MASK] will find elegant hotels , restaurants and malls in the northern part of the city .	You
[MASK] has a rich cultural life which also reflects its diversity .	Mrida
From the later 1800s to the 1920s [MASK] enjoyed prosperous boom times fueled by the henequen or sisal plant harvest , which made Yucatn the rope maker to the world .	Mrida
Progressive [MASK] had electric trams and street lights before Mexico City .	Mrida
The [MASK] constructed the grand Pasejo Montejo avenue north of the old town , inspired by the Champs - lyses in Paris .	wealthy
With the development of artificial twines the sisal [MASK] ended , and Mrida slowed to a more sleepy provincial capital until development picked back up in the late 20th century .	boom
The city 's [MASK] is colonial and the climate is tropical .	ambiance
The daytime [MASK] varies ; in January , it is about 24  C ( 75  F ) and in June , about 35  C ( 95  F ) .	temperature
To beat the heat , most [MASK] are busiest in the mornings .	people
[MASK] have lunch and siesta , then go back to work for a few hours in the late afternoon .	They
The cool [MASK] from the Gulf of Mexico drift into Mrida in the evenings and this is when many of the residents spend their time outdoors .	breezes
[MASK] can see them visiting and talking as they stroll along the streets , sit in the plazas or dine in the many sidewalk restaurants .	You
The [MASK] maintains several tourist information offices , all of which can offer helpful information on accommodation , free maps , and bus connections .	city
All [MASK] also have free copies of Yucatan Today , a helpful weekly Spanish - English publication listing all events in the city and the surrounding region .	offices
[MASK] is the capital of the state of Arizona as well as the most populous city in the American Southwest and sixth largest city in the United States .	Phoenix
Founded in 1871 , [MASK] has become the region 's primary political , cultural , economic , and transportation center .	it
Over time [MASK] has merged with the neighboring cities of Scottsdale , Tempe , Glendale , Peoria , Chandler , and Gilbert to form the Greater Phoenix Metropolitan Area .	it
Currently [MASK] such as Apache Junction , Fountain Hills , Queen Creek , and Sun City are becoming part of this metropolitan area as well .	exurbs
[MASK] is extremely hot and dry in the summertime , so always have sunscreen with you !	Phoenix
Why would [MASK] want to start a city in the middle of a desert ?	anybody
The [MASK] is , surprisingly , agriculture .	answer
The [MASK] that now encompasses Phoenix was a center of the Hohokam culture , which built large canal systems and a network of towns and villages , whose remains may be viewed in the city to this day .	area
White [MASK] discovered the remnants of the Hohokam culture in the 19th century .	settlers
The city 's [MASK] reflects its history as a city " reborn from the ashes " of the previous settlement .	name
European - American [MASK] of the area commenced in the 1860s , and in 1911 the completion of the first of several large reservoirs in the mountains north and east of Phoenix insured its success as a center for irrigation - based agriculture .	settlement
Recent [MASK] are seeing a revival , and trendy hotels , bars , shops and restaurants are making it a place to be again .	years
[MASK] and sunny winter weather also ensured a thriving tourism industry , and encouraged many Easterners and Midwesterners to relocate to Phoenix .	Warm
High - tech [MASK] began to flourish after World War II , and since that time the growth of Phoenix has been explosive .	industry
As a result , a [MASK] of just over 100,000 in 1950 has given way to a 2014 estimate of 1,537,058 ( with the metro area estimated at 4,489,109 ) .	population
[MASK] has an arid climate with long , hot summers and very mild winters .	Phoenix
[MASK] has the highest average temperature of any metropolitan area in the States .	It
The [MASK] varies enormously from one season to the next .	weather
While it 's not as cold as in the northern states during the winter , [MASK] does freeze sometimes , and temperatures in the 30s  F ( that 's around or slightly above 0  C ) are not unheard of .	it
In the summer , very hot and dry [MASK] is the norm .	heat
On the hottest days , [MASK] can get up to 115  F ( 46  C ) or more .	it
Monsoon [MASK] with lightning occur regularly from July to September during the late afternoon and evening , occasionally overnight also .	rains
[MASK] is the most ideal month .	April
In some neighborhoods , cicada [MASK] make loud sounds from sunset to sunrise .	insects
[MASK] is the dominant language in Phoenix .	English
[MASK] is a language often used for day - to - day discourse in many places , although English is the language of preference , especially when dealing with businesses and government .	Spanish
Phoenix Sky Harbor International [MASK] ( IATA : PHX ) +1602275-4958 is the main air gateway to Arizona .	Airport
[MASK] is at the southeast end of Downtown .	It
[MASK] is a hub for American Airlines and Southwest Airlines .	It
Valley Metro [MASK] goes west to S 75th Ave along S Buckeye ( via Greyhound depot ) from Terminal 2 .	#13
Likewise [MASK] can take the PHX skytrain over to the nearby 44th & Washington St Station to catch the #1 ( west to the downtown Central Station and Priest & Washington in Tempe to the east along Washington St ) ; #44 bus ( north to the Desert Ridge Marriott Resort in Deer Valley along N 44th St & Tatum ) ; and the light rail ( east to Tempe & Mesa and to Midtown ( along Central Ave ) via downtown in the other direction ) .	one
With over 40,000 inhabitants , though , [MASK] 's not just a nature reserve .	it
The [MASK] is new to tourism , so if you are looking for a luxurious vacation this is not the right destination .	Island
However , [MASK] is a perfect destination for the adventurous and nature loving travelers .	Socotra
[MASK] takes pride in their eco - tourism and values their spectacular plant and wildlife that may sometimes be only found on this island .	Socotra
Although the lodging and facilities may not be the same as more modern and developed locations , [MASK] is a beautiful and magnificent destination choice .	Socotra
[MASK] is an eco - tourism system with limited infrastructure and new to the international tourist market , and therefore the hotel accommodations are not quite like other destinations .	Socotra
[MASK] of the rooms at these hotels have their own bathroom , but there are a few rooms at the Hafijj Hotel and Socotra Hotel that must share bathrooms .	Most
Considering Socotra is a fairly new eco - tourism destination , their [MASK] are decent .	facilities
The most popular [MASK] is actually camping on the beaches .	lodging
[MASK] can choose to purchase camping tour packages which include a driver or guide that will show tourists around the beaches as well as provide meals during their stay .	Tourists
[MASK] is a fantastic way to enjoy the beauty and wildlife of the island .	It
Like everything else , [MASK] and transportation has only just begun in recent years .	infrastructure
And [MASK] depends on your interest .	this
Nature [MASK] should go from early October to late April .	enthusiasts
The [MASK] occurs in July till mid-August ( during July in the south east and south west of the island , wind surfing activity can be arranged ) .	monsoon
Generally , [MASK] and natural viewing is best from the end of January through May .	wildlife
Yemenia [MASK] offers one flight per week on Thursday morning .	Airlines
Felix [MASK] offers two flights per week on Wednesday afternoon and Saturday morning .	Airways
Flight [MASK] are almost three hours .	durations
While on the outer coastline , breathtaking natural [MASK] have pure white sand dunes and palm trees .	beaches
Socotra [MASK] is very rich and is home to many rare spectacular species of reefs , fish , birds , plants , and trees which are not found anywhere else in the world .	Island
The limestone [MASK] and the Hagghier Mountains are the richest areas for endemic plant species , but endemics are found throughout the island in every type of vegetation .	plateau
[MASK] of the most famous plants is the dragon 's blood tree  dracaena cinnabara  which exists only on Socotra and nowhere else on the Earth .	One
The [MASK] got its name because if any damage is made to the bark then a dark red liquid oozes out .	tree
The dragon 's blood [MASK] thrives in Socotra 's arid climate	tree
[MASK] is one of Denmark 's most scenic areas , and should be a top destination of anyone taking the time to explore Denmark outside the capital .	It
The [MASK] has a milder climate than the country 's average , and because of this , is home to flora and fauna not seen anywhere else in Denmark .	area
The [MASK] is one of the most diverse natural environments in the country , and is designated as an international wildlife protection area , as it is home of several rare and protected species .	area
If you are interested ornithology the many shallow [MASK] around the islands and islets is a treat with thousands of birds and colonies , one of the more notable is the Arctic Tern , which migrates to Antarctica and back ( nearly 40,000 kilometers ) every year .	waters
[MASK] is the longest regular migration by any known animal .	This
[MASK] also find Shore Crabs , Beach Otters and - rare for Denmark - Seals in the shallow waters and beaches .	You
On dry land , up on the many islands [MASK] can find badgers , stoats and several types of deer .	you
The main entry [MASK] are Svendborg which is easily reach both by highway , bus and train - and Faaborg , which is best reached by bus from Odense .	points
While some islands are connected by the same ferry , [MASK] will generally have to go back to the mainland to pass between the islands , if you rely on public transportation .	you
However the best [MASK] to visit is really by boat , and there are plenty of options to do this .	way
A popular [MASK] , and one good for your health too , is by sea kayak .	option
Several rental [MASK] also gives you the option of trained guide , which can both provide information about the sights you visit , and make sure you are safe .	places
Smack [MASK] : 225 DKK per hour / 825 DKK per day , Sea Kayak : 125 DKK per hour / 350 DKK per day , 1 hour instruction : 450 DKK .	Dinghies
The archipelago [MASK] ( da : havsstien ) is a 220 km hiking trail connected by ferries that circles the entire area .	trail
The local tourist [MASK] in Svendborg and Faaborg can arrange baggage forwarding between your chosen camps or accommodations during peak season .	offices
Pre arranged package [MASK] are also available from Travel Heels in Taasinge or Vagabond Tours in Tranekr , in cooperation with the local tourist authority .	tours
A comprehensive [MASK] with excellent maps is available in Danish only for 150 Kr at most tourist offices in the region .	guidebook
[MASK] with maps , tips and points of interest in English , broken up into 7 parts is available at the tourist offices as well and as pdf files on the introductory link , it is sometimes also available at parking lots along the route , but these are only restocked a couple of times throughout the year , so you may be out of luck .	Pamphlets
[MASK] Is only 1 km  and home of a stubborn but loving 8 people , making it one of the smallest populated islands in the country , how long the island can sustain a full year population remains to be seen , but permanent life on the island will probably be a thing of the past in a not too distant future .	Birkholm
Non the less [MASK] is a pretty , but incredibly flat place , with the highest point towering a proud 1,8 meters over the sea !	it
If you are a hunter , [MASK] might be lucky to run into the yearly Pheasant or hare hunts - you can even rest assured your " evil deeds " does some good , as it supports life on the island .	you
[MASK] are a polite people and , while remarkably tolerant of foreigners gallivanting on their beaches and with their women , you ll find that you will get more respect if you in turn treat them and their customs with respect .	Thais
In brief , [MASK] salute superiors first .	inferiors
[MASK] should not wai service people or street vendors .	You
[MASK] will also often see Thais doing a wai as they walk past temples and spirit houses .	You
while you 're unlikely to cause offense if you do , [MASK] may well look slightly strange .	you
If somebody makes a wai to you , a slight [MASK] alone is more than sufficient for ordinary occasions , and for business , most Thais will shake hands with foreigners instead of waiing anyway .	bow
Personal [MASK] is very important in Thailand as a measure of respect to other people .	appearance
[MASK] will find that dressing appropriately means that you are shown more respect in return .	You
[MASK] translates in many ways , even sometimes lowering initial offering prices at markets .	This
While some allowance is made for the differing customs of foreigners , [MASK] respond more positively to well - dressed Westerners .	Thais
Traditionally , [MASK] are modest and conservative dressers .	Thais
At a minimum your [MASK] should be neat , clean , and free from holes or tears .	clothes
Except at the beach or at sacred sites normal western [MASK] is acceptable for both men and women , except that you should avoid clothing showing a lot of skin .	dress
[MASK] are preferable to shorts , blouses should have capped sleeves , and if tank tops are worn , the straps should be thick ( i.e. , not spaghetti straps ) .	Pants
Thai [MASK] generally wear pants , and most Thais view an adult man wearing shorts as fairly ridiculous ;	men
Men 's [MASK] should be knee length or more , if worn at all .	shorts
Flip - [MASK] , hiking sandals , and clog - type shoes are usually a good pragmatic choice for traveling in Thailand ;	flops
your [MASK] should be unambiguously modest and cover your entire torso and most of your limbs .	dress
For men , ankle - length [MASK] are mandatory ;	pants
on top , t - [MASK] are acceptable , though a button - front or polo shirt would be best .	shirts
[MASK] recommend that women wear only full length dresses and skirts ;	Many
[MASK] should make sure that your clothing covers at least your shoulders and your knees and some places may require that you wear ankle - length pants or skirts and long sleeved tops .	you
[MASK] and sleeveless shirts are highly inappropriate , as are short skirts .	Shorts
The [MASK] are even more strict for foreign visitors , so even if you see a local in shorts it 's not OK for everyone .	rules
Topless [MASK] is common by Western women at many tourist beaches .	sunbathing
[MASK] are an integral part of Buddhism in Thailand , and Thai men are generally expected to spend a certain amount of time living as a monk at least once in their lifetime .	Monks
[MASK] should make every effort to make way for monks on the street and give them room so they do not have to make contact with you .	Women
[MASK] should avoid offering anything to a monk with their hands .	Women
Therefore , should you wish to donate to a monk , [MASK] should only offer food , and put your monetary donation in the appropriate donation box at the temple .	you
Those [MASK] that accept money are almost always fakes .	monks
[MASK] is in the Green Country region of Oklahoma .	Tulsa
The [MASK] had about 391,000 people and the metro area had about 937,000 people as of 2010 from the US Census Bureau .	city
The Tulsa Bartlesville Combined [MASK] had 988,000 in the 2010 census .	area
[MASK] lies in northeastern Oklahoma , at the convergence of the Great Plains and the Ozark Plateau , and receives an average of 40 inches of precipitation each year , both of which account for its abundant beautiful rolling green terrain .	Tulsa
As a result , [MASK] breaks the Oklahoma stereotype of being nothing but a flat , arid dust bowl .	Tulsa
[MASK] can be very warm and with the cold wind across the plains it can get very cold in the winter , but it does not last long .	Summers
[MASK] has over 225 days of sunshine annually .	Tulsa
In Tulsa [MASK] will find old west charm as well as a cosmopolitan atmosphere .	you
[MASK] will find the people of Tulsa love their city and they have that southern charm , so they are willing to help you find your way around .	You
[MASK] has one of the largest concentrations of Art Deco in the nation , having been a booming city during the 1920s when the architecture was first built by rich oil barons who built stately mansions and turned the Downtown area into a treasure trove of art .	Tulsa
[MASK] has major airlines with direct flights to major cities in the U.S.	It
[MASK] is a small but nice airport with sofas and chairs all around and a very laid - back feel .	It
The [MASK] offers free short term parking ( first half - hour free ) .	airport
Richard L. Jones , Jr. [MASK] ( IATA : RVS ) ( often called the " Riverside Airport " ) is south of downtown and is a general aviation airport .	Airport
Most [MASK] drive almost everywhere , although bus , bike , and pedestrian routes are starting to catch on .	Tulsans
The world 's former largest [MASK] spans the roadway near Vinita , OK .	McDonalds
Almost all major [MASK] are one mile from each other , and exactly in a straight line .	intersections
[MASK] makes it much easier to find places than in cities where streets go every which way .	That
The major [MASK] is downtown , which is slanted at almost a 45 degree angle to the rest of the grid .	exception
In the core of the city , named [MASK] run north / south and are named after US cities , generally in repeating alphabetical order ( for example , Winston - Yale - Allegheny - Braden ) .	avenues
Name [MASK] East of Main are cities east of the Mississippi River , vice versa for name streets west of Main .	streets
Numbered [MASK] run East / West with Main Street and the Arkansas River as the dividing line .	streets
In some parts of the city , numbered [MASK] intersect , so the distinction is important .	streets
Although rare , one east - west numbered [MASK] may even intersect with a street of the same number running north - south .	street
Thus the " twisted " [MASK] down - town represents the original extent of Tulsa ca 1907 .	area
Tulsa [MASK] provides bus service for the Tulsa Metro area .	Transit
[MASK] served are Tulsa , Sand Springs , Sapulpa , Jenks , and Broken Arrow .	Cities
The central [MASK] is at 319 S. Denver ( downtown ) .	station
[MASK] do not run that often , especially to the outer towns like Broken Arrow .	They
Unlike major cities in the Northeast , the city [MASK] is not a major form of transportation in the city .	bus
[MASK] is usually a means of travel for those who are without their own motor vehicle .	It
[MASK] has an extensive interconnected paved bike trail system .	Tulsa
[MASK] follows the Arkansas River from downtown Tulsa south to the suburbs .	Rivertrail
The Katy [MASK] runs west to Sand Springs .	Trail
The Osage [MASK] is a rails - to - trails route that begins at the OSU - Tulsa campus and travels north 15 miles to Skiatook .	Trail
The Creek [MASK] connects Rivertrail and continues east through Broken Arrow to the NSU - Broken Arrow campus .	Trail
[MASK] accustomed to flat terrain may find Tulsa 's rolling land to be a bit more challenging , particularly during the heat of summer .	Riders
If you are looking for a good workout , the Creek Turnpike [MASK] follows the land 's original contours .	Trail
Four bike loan [MASK] , located along Rivertrail , allow riders to borrow a bike for free for up to twenty - four hours .	depots
[MASK] has an active bicycling community .	Tulsa
[MASK] is an ancient cathedral city with a history that dates back to before Roman times .	York
As of the 2001 census , the [MASK] of York was 181,000 .	population
[MASK] was home first to the Ninth Legion and later the Sixth .	York
[MASK] quickly became one of the most important cities in Roman Britain , and after 211 became the capital of the province Britannia Inferior .	York
Captured by the Vikings 866 , the [MASK] quickly took on a new identity as Jorvik ( pronounced " Yor-vik " ) and experienced a major urban revival as a centre of Viking trade and settlement in northern England .	city
The Coppergate [MASK] of the 1970s revealed much of this Viking past .	excavations
[MASK] is a fairly small city - four days is enough to see the major sights although York is a city that reveals its charms to explorers with curiosity and patience .	York
The official [MASK] are the Viking Festival , the Festival of Angels , Early Music , Late Music , Horse Racing ( the " Ebor Race Meeting " ) , Multicultural Food and Arts , Chinese New Year , Mystery Plays , Christmas St Nicholas ' Fair , and the Food and Drink Festival .	festivals
[MASK] 's a romantic city for a weekend break .	It
[MASK] is full of magic and a wonderful place to bring children !	York
Most [MASK] will arrive in York by road ( car or bus ) or rail from other parts of the UK or an airport .	travellers
Although York is not directly on any of the main north - south motorways , the [MASK] are reasonably good .	connections
Alternatively , [MASK] can take the M1 all the way to the A64 , but the upper reaches of the M1 around Sheffield and Leeds can get very congested , especially in the rush hours .	you
From the west , the [MASK] and the M62 provide connections from Liverpool and Manchester , and from the north the A1 and the A19 link York with Tyneside , Northumberland and south - eastern Scotland .	A59
Traffic [MASK] on the main arterial roads serving the city ( especially the A19 on Bootham and the Inner Ring Road ) can get very bad , especially during the rush hours and on Saturday mornings .	congestion
The [MASK] of some roads near bottleneck junctions to accommodate bicycle lanes has made traffic jams even worse still in recent years , and parking in the city centre is very expensive .	remodelling
However , the last [MASK] from the city centre leave at around 8 pm in the evenings and you are not allowed to leave your car in a Park and Ride overnight .	buses
If you are only visiting for the day but staying until late evening , [MASK] will need to use a city centre car park .	you
Do [MASK] always seem to cross paths with people who are stuck on themselves , intolerant of people different from them , rude or downright arrogant ?	you
These [MASK] can be a great source of potential pain , and this article is here to help you sort the arrogant from the not - so - arrogant .	people
Is [MASK] always about them ?	it
Do [MASK] get mad or irritated if the centre of attention moves to someone else ?	they
[MASK] are good signs of arrogance .	These
[MASK] and smugness is often a reflection of limited life experience , and feeling concerned that those with greater life experience " have got something over them " .	Arrogance
Rather than seeking to find out more through questions and learning ( actions viewed by them as showing vulnerability ) , arrogant [MASK] tend to generalize from their limited , narrow life experiences and try to impose their small worldview on others .	people
[MASK] of your achievements or seeming lifestyle can cause another person to feel smug or arrogant about something they think they do better than you or own / have that you do n't .	Jealousy
Arrogant [MASK] have an extremely strong need to look good .	people
When you make them look bad - even if it is the slightest offense - [MASK] will usually be very mad at you .	they
[MASK] happens when you question ( or at least seem to question ) their appearance , intelligence , athletic abilities , or anything else relating to their self - image .	This
If it 's minimal , [MASK] may be simply having a bad day .	they
But if they 're enraged , then [MASK] may see you as questioning their ' perfect little world . '	they
At some point or another , most [MASK] realize that the world does n't revolve around them .	people
Arrogant [MASK] counteract this by creating an atmosphere that revolves around them , and get angry if they 're reminded of the real world .	people
[MASK] frightens arrogant people because it suggests imperfection , change and lack of certainty ( realities we all must contend with as best we can ) .	Ambiguity
As such , instead of accepting that the world behaves randomly and at times totally averse to one 's preferences , the arrogant [MASK] seeks to control everything and everyone , which of course , is an impossible mission .	person
[MASK] hurts when it intrudes ; as such , an arrogant person is less likely than other people to self - reflect or analyse , thereby not seeing their own imperfections .	Reality
[MASK] may also give themselves undue credit for positive achievements instead of acknowledging the input of others or of circumstances .	They
[MASK] 's a sign of arrogance , since it is very hard to be a truly good friend to someone who 's stuck on themselves .	That
Prideful [MASK] have a strong need to look good , and being self - sufficient is an effective way to do that .	people
Since being a good friend to someone usually means helping them , [MASK] often ca n't stand the thought of a good friendship .	they
Ironically , arrogant [MASK] often ca n't understand why they do n't have any reliable and supportive friends .	people
How do [MASK] treat those not like themselves ?	they
In other words , how do [MASK] treat those with different beliefs , cultural backgrounds and ways of seeing the world ?	they
If it 's inherently negative , then [MASK] 're either over - zealous , ignorant of other people or what to avoid those that contradict their fantasy land that caters to them and them only .	they
Many times prideful [MASK] have a serious ' my - way 's - the - only - way ' attitude .	people
[MASK] is simply a protective mechanism for their false image or their fantasy land .	This
Do [MASK] have a general sense of ' coolness ? '	they
Are [MASK] a chatterbox ?	they
Do [MASK] act like they own the place , or act like the ' big dog ? '	they
Are [MASK] very keen on their self - image ?	they
Many arrogant [MASK] have a false charm that no one seems to see through .	people
But the arrogant [MASK] is usually more than happy to show their cruel side to those that they do n't like .	person
When they are cruel , their [MASK] will usually ignore it or not do anything to stop it since they 're afraid that they 'll be treated badly by their ' friend . '	friends
If their condemnation seems to be reasonable , [MASK] probably are n't hubristic .	they
If it 's harsh , [MASK] are .	they
For the most part , arrogant [MASK] see people that they do n't like as threats to their perfect little world .	people
If they have been saying bad things about you , [MASK] may simply not like you .	they
If they 're nice to your face , but talk bad about you behind your back like it 's their favourite hobby , then [MASK] probably have a problem with pride .	they
Arrogant [MASK] often subconsciously know that they do n't have any good friends .	people
[MASK] compensate for this by creating the impression that they have a lot of friends - they have a ' quantity , not quality ' mentality .	They
Then [MASK] simply insult their trophy friends when they are n't looking .	they
[MASK] began in royal courts in the early 1600's , and early forms of this elegant and sophisticated art involved long skirts and wooden clogs .	Ballet
[MASK] who study ballet also retain flexibility throughout their adult lives , making this technique the basis of training for all types of dance .	People
While dancing ballet takes dedication and requires serious training , [MASK] can learn the basics to prepare yourself for further study .	you
[MASK] should also stretch to " wind down " at the end of ballet dancing .	You
Properly - fitted ballet [MASK] should be snug , but not so tight they cut off blood flow and create numbness in the feet .	shoes
[MASK] should fit them to where the drawstring is tied slightly loose .	You
If your drawstring is longer than your pinkie then [MASK] should cut it off till it is roughly the size of your fingernail .	you
The [MASK] just completes the fit .	drawstring

This [MASK] outlines how to plant and harvest basil .	article
[MASK] comes in many different varieties , each of which have a unique flavor and smell .	Basil
Cinnamon [MASK] really does smell like the sweet spice , and it also has unusually beautiful and fragrant flowers .	basil
Lemon [MASK] actually contains citral , an aromatic compound found in citrus fruit , and smells very lemony .	basil
[MASK] and Greek basil are much more difficult to grow , but form pretty little bushes which stay well - contained .	Globe
[MASK] needs warm air and sun to do well , so it 's often easiest to start the seeds indoors instead of risking that they 'll get damaged by frost .	Basil
If you live in a hot climate , [MASK] can start the seeds outside instead .	you

When the plants become a few inches tall and their leaves mature , [MASK] 's time to transplant them to a larger container .	it
[MASK] does not tolerate frost so do n't plant too early .	Basil
[MASK] does best in well - drained soil , and should not be subjected to standing water .	Basil

In the Harry Potter series written by JK Rowling the main wizarding [MASK] is Quidditch .	sport
However [MASK] do n't have to have magical powers to play .	you
[MASK] has also spread outside of America and is now played on 5 continents .	Quidditch
[MASK] can be a hindrance however , so feel free to not use brooms .	Brooms
Both [MASK] start from the edges and attempt to obtain the quaffle and bludgers .	teams
[MASK] try to score by throwing the quaffle into one of the three goal hoops .	Chasers
Each [MASK] is worth 10 points .	score
[MASK] try to peg players with their bludger .	Beaters
If a player is pegged [MASK] have to stop what they 're doing and pay a penalty ; i.e. ( drop the quaffle in the case of a chaser ) and run back to and touch their goal post or alternatively sit down for 10 seconds .	they
[MASK] guard the goal posts at each end and attempt to block chasers ' attempts at scoring .	Keepers
If Keeper is close to their hoops [MASK] are safe from being hit by bludgers .	they
[MASK] try to tackle the snitch ( a person ) or obtain an object attached to the snitch such as a sock or flag .	Seekers
[MASK] can establish you own rules as to how a player catches the snitch .	You
Then the [MASK] search for the snitch , and attempt to tag the player .	seekers
Other [MASK] , such as the method adopted in 2005 , makes the snitch a tennis ball in a sock , hanging out of the running shorts of the snitch runner .	methods
Regardless of method , the winning [MASK] wins 30 points for his or her team , unlike the books , in which the snitch is worth 150 points .	seeker
The [MASK] of Muggle Quidditch thought that it was worth too many points so changed the value of the snitch for muggle Quidditch .	creators
The [MASK] , generally a track runner , runs around ( usually the boundaries ) trying to evade the seekers .	snitch
The [MASK] should ensure that rules are being followed .	referee
[MASK] also keep track of the score .	They
[MASK] do n't need flying broomsticks or magic balls to play this version of the game - it 's tailor - made for muggles like us .	You
This [MASK] shows a more realistic approach to playing Quidditch .	video
Alternatively the [MASK] can be a small yellow ball ( tennis balls work great ) that is hidden before the game starts by a bystander or referee .	snitch
[MASK] can try hitting the bludgers around in the air with a shortened hockey sticks or a short bat .	Beaters
[MASK] could also use regular - length hockey sticks to hit bludgers ( perhaps wiffle balls ) on the ground .	They
If desired , the [MASK] is able to do whatever he or she wants to avoid capture .	snitch
[MASK] can play water quidditch in a pool .	You
Almost all the same [MASK] apply .	rules
[MASK] can even use fake snitches .	They
[MASK] can buy authentic looking brooms to make the game more realistic .	You
One [MASK] is Quarter Snitch Quidditch .	variation
Another variation is where the [MASK] places the snitch somewhere in the field ( in this case it 's a small ball ) .	referee
The [MASK] has to find the snitch blindfolded , relying only on the coach 's instructions , while the game is still on .	seeker
A [MASK] flying in the air can hurt .	ball
If you 're playing quidditch [MASK] 're probably just having fun so play nicely .	you

If you plot multiple charts , [MASK] will see a drop area for multi-chart fields .	you
Each [MASK] consists of one point from each data series .	category
Category [MASK] usually appear across the x axis of the chart , although this can vary depending on the type of chart you are using .	labels
Data [MASK] provide the values to be summarized in the chart .	fields
A filter [MASK] is similar to a page field in a Microsoft Excel PivotTable report .	field
For example , when you move a Product field to the filter area , [MASK] can have the chart display category and series values for one product at a time .	you
In the following example , the Salesperson [MASK] is in the MultiChart area , but it 's filtered so it displays individual charts for Buchanan and Davolio .	field
In the following example , [MASK] is the outer field and Salesperson is the inner field .	Year
[MASK] can expand and collapse multiple fields to show more or less information in a particular field .	You
For example , [MASK] can collapse the outer field ( Year ) in the example so that the inner field items are no longer displayed .	you
The [MASK] of a chart does not have to include all fields that are available from the source data .	layout
If more data is available , [MASK] can add fields to the chart .	you
For example , if the chart summarizes sales revenue , and the source data also includes sales quantities , [MASK] might add the Quantity field as a data field to summarize both revenue and quantity of products sold .	you
[MASK] can also remove fields from the chart layout that you no longer want to see .	You
[MASK] means that when you move a series or category field to the filter area and back , previously hidden items are again hidden .	This
When you design a chart for other users , [MASK] can restrict the user 's ability to change the layout of the chart by preventing fields from being added and moved .	you
The data [MASK] displays a tree view of the data model of a data access page .	outline
[MASK] lists the record sources , fields , and calculated controls of a page .	It
Because the field list of a page does not show the contents specific to a page , [MASK] can use the data outline to review the structure of a page .	you
[MASK] can also select the objects displayed in the data outline , set their properties , define and edit relationships between record sources , and delete fields and record sources .	You
The following [MASK] shows the Orders page with two group levels .	illustration
The inner group [MASK] contains fields from the OrderDetails table and a calculated control named Value .	level
In the outer group level , the header [MASK] contains fields from the Orders table and the footer section contains a calculated total control named OrderValue .	section
The following [MASK] shows the data outline for the Orders page .	illustration
The [MASK] in this topic goes to the Web .	hyperlink
[MASK] can switch back to Help at any time .	You
[MASK] can group based on the first n characters of the individual items .	You
For example , [MASK] can group the LastName field by first letter to create groups , such as A , B , and so on .	you
[MASK] can specify the start and end values for the grouping range .	You
[MASK] can randomly select items from a row or column field and group them into higher-level groups .	You
For example , [MASK] can select from the Promotions row field all the promotions that run for a specific period and create a group .	you
[MASK] would add a new row field named Promotions 2 above the Promotions row field with two members : Group1 and Other .	This
[MASK] can change the caption of Group 1 to Fixed and Promotions 2 to Category in the Properties dialog box .	You
The Other [MASK] will contain all items that you did not include in the Fixed custom group .	group
[MASK] can then select all the popular promotions from the Other group and create a new custom group that will be captioned Popular .	You
After you do this , the Category [MASK] will have three members : Fixed , Popular , and Other .	field
The following [MASK] shows how the PivotTable view will look after the captions of the custom group field and custom groups have been changed .	illustration
3 The Other [MASK] is the parent of the items you did not assign to any specific custom group .	group
[MASK] can not group items that belong to different fields or items that belong to parent items into a custom group .	You
When you delete a custom group that is not the last custom group in the field , the deleted group 's [MASK] automatically move to the Other group .	members
The [MASK] you create do not affect source data .	groups
When you move a field that has custom groups between row and column areas , the custom group [MASK] that are based on the field move with the field .	fields
However , the bound [MASK] will show the custom group hierarchy in the drop-down list , so you can filter data by selecting custom groups or individual values .	field
When you move the field back to a row or column area , the custom group [MASK] will appear again .	fields
[MASK] can not move a field with custom groups to the detail area .	You
[MASK] can select two or more custom groups to create a higher-level grouping .	You
For example , [MASK] can group the members of the Category field into two groups : high priority promotions and low priority promotions .	you
The following [MASK] shows how the row area will look with nested custom groups .	illustration
[MASK] can also remove a lower-level custom group .	You
The following [MASK] shows what the data will look like after the Category field has been removed .	illustration
For example , your [MASK] might look like following :	grid
When the pointer changes to a double-headed arrow , [MASK] can drag the line to a new location .	you
If you move the line to the right , the [MASK] between the moving line and the nearest parallel line to the right remains constant , and the perpendicular line to the left of the moving line lengthens .	distance
If you move the line to the left , the [MASK] between the moving line and the nearest parallel line to the right remains constant , and the perpendicular line to the left of the moving line contracts .	distance

For reasons that were never made clear to him , [MASK] suddenly felt an irresistible urge for a particular red notebook at the bottom .	he
[MASK] pulled it out and examined it , gingerly fanning the pages with his thumb .	He
[MASK] was at a loss to explain to himself why he found it so appealing .	He
[MASK] was a standard eight-and-a-half-by-eleven notebook with one hundred pages .	It
But [MASK] about it seemed to call out to him  as if its unique destiny in the world was to hold the words that came from his pen .	something
Almost embarrassed by the intensity of his feelings , [MASK] tucked the red notebook under his arm , walked over to the cash register , and bought it .	Quinn
[MASK] made it to Grand Central well in advance .	He
Stillman 's [MASK] was not due to arrive until six-forty-one , but Quinn wanted time to study the geography of the place , to make sure that Stillman would not be able to slip away from him .	train
As he emerged from the subway and entered the great hall , [MASK] saw by the clock that it was just past four .	he
Already the [MASK] had begun to fill with the rush-hour crowd .	station
Making his way through the press of oncoming bodies , [MASK] made a tour of the numbered gates , looking for hidden staircases , unmarked exits , dark alcoves .	Quinn
[MASK] concluded that a man determined to disappear could do so without much trouble .	He
[MASK] would have to hope that Stillman had not been warned that he would be there .	He
If that were the case , and Stillman managed to elude him , [MASK] would mean that Virginia Stillman was responsible .	it
If Stillman did not show up , [MASK] would go straight to 69th Street and confront Virginia Stillman with what he knew .	Quinn
As he wandered through the station , [MASK] reminded himself of who he was supposed to be .	he
The [MASK] of being Paul Auster , he had begun to learn , was not altogether unpleasant .	effect
Although he still had the same body , the same mind , the same thoughts , [MASK] felt as though he had somehow been taken out of himself , as if he no longer had to walk around with the burden of his own consciousness .	he
By a simple trick of the intelligence , a deft little twist of naming , [MASK] felt incomparably lighter and freer .	he
At the same time , [MASK] knew it was all an illusion .	he
[MASK] had not really lost himself ; he was merely pretending , and he could return to being Quinn whenever he wished .	He
The [MASK] that there was now a purpose to his being Paul Auster  a purpose that was becoming more and more important to him  served as a kind of moral justification for the charade and absolved him of having to defend his lie .	fact
[MASK] wandered through the station , then , as if inside the body of Paul Auster , waiting for Stillman to appear .	He
[MASK] looked up at the vaulted ceiling of the great hall and studied the fresco of constellations .	He
[MASK] had never been able to grasp the connection between the constellations and their names .	Quinn
As a boy [MASK] had spent many hours under the night sky trying to tally the clusters of pinprick lights with the shapes of bears , bulls , archers , and water carriers .	he
But [MASK] had ever come of it , and he had felt stupid , as though there were a blind spot in the center of his brain .	nothing
[MASK] sat there for a short time without saying anything .	They
At last , [MASK] gave a little shrug , which seemed to acknowledge that they had come to an impasse .	Auster
[MASK] stood up and said , I was about to make some lunch for myself .	He
[MASK] hesitated .	Quinn
It was as though [MASK] had read his thoughts , divining the thing he wanted most  to eat , to have an excuse to stay a while .	Auster
I really should be going , [MASK] said .	he
But yes , thank you . A little [MASK] ca n't do any harm .	food
How does a ham [MASK] sound ?	omelette
[MASK] retreated to the kitchen to prepare the food .	Auster
[MASK] would have liked to offer to help , but he could not budge .	Quinn
His [MASK] felt like a stone .	body
For want of any other idea , [MASK] closed his eyes .	he
This time , however , [MASK] found nothing interesting inside his head .	Quinn
[MASK] seemed as though things had ground to a halt in there .	It
Then , from the darkness , [MASK] began to hear a voice , a chanting , idiotic voice that sang the same sentence over and over again : You ca n't make an omelette without breaking eggs .	he
[MASK] opened his eyes to make the words stop .	He
[MASK] ate with crude intensity , polishing off the meal in what seemed a matter of seconds .	Quinn
After that , [MASK] made a great effort to be calm .	he
[MASK] lurked mysteriously behind his eyes , and his voice seemed to tremble as he spoke , but somehow he managed to hold his own .	Tears
To prove that he was not a self-obsessed ingrate , [MASK] began to question Auster about his writing .	he
[MASK] was somewhat reticent about it , but at last he conceded that he was working on a book of essays . The current piece was about Don Quixote .	Auster
[MASK] asked him about the essay .	Quinn
[MASK] suppose you can call it speculative , since I 'm not really out to prove anything .	I
In fact , it 's [MASK] done tounge-in-cheek .	all
An imaginative reading , [MASK] guess you could say .	I
[MASK] 's the gist ?	What
[MASK] mostly has to do with the authorship of the book . Who wrote it , and how it was written .	It
[MASK] 's quite simple .	It
[MASK] , if you remember , goes to great lengths to convince the reader that he is not the author .	Cervantes
[MASK] describes how he discovered the manuscript by chance one day in the market at Toledo .	Cervantes
[MASK] hires someone to translate it for him into Spanish ,	He
and thereafter [MASK] presents himself as no more than the editor of the translation .	he

And yet [MASK] goes on to say , Quinn added , that Cid Hamete Benengali 's is the only true version of Don Quixote 's story .	he
All the other [MASK] are frauds , written by impostors .	versions
[MASK] makes a great point of insisting that everything in the book really happened in the world .	He
Because the [MASK] after all is an attack on the dangers of the make-believe .	book

[MASK] had to claim that it was real .	He

[MASK] agree with you .	I

Yes , [MASK] see what you 're getting at .	I
The [MASK] I present in the essay is that he is actually a combination of four different people .	theory
[MASK] Panza is of course the witness .	Sancho
But [MASK] can neither read nor write .	Sancho
Therefore , [MASK] can not be the author .	he

[MASK] put the story into proper literary form  in Spanish  and then turned the manuscript over to Samson Carrasco , the bachelor from Salamanca , who proceeded to translate it into Arabic .	They
